loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Maria Concepcion has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from food vending.

Maria Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a single mother with 8 children of whom three attend school. She is a farmer and mainly grows coffee, beans and maize for sale. She works for 4 days a week and 10 hours a day. She started her businesses way back in 2003 and was motivated by the fact that the business required less capital and was profitable.

She also deals in a local brewery and produce business from which she gets an extra income to support her family. She hopes to use the loan to boost her bar business and also buy fertilizers and manure for farming. She usually sells her goods to fellow traders from neighboring trading centres.

Her hopes and dreams are to develop herself and also construct another house. However, she faces a challenge of limited capital, and defaulting customers which affects her business. 

She is described as an honest and hard working woman in business. She appreciates the services offered by lenders.

loans.use: to buy stock of local brews for sale.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en: Vang is 34 years old and living in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a carpenter. Moreover, he can earn more income via rice cropping. He can earn about 22,700 KHR per day. For Vang, this is his first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his entire loan portion to buy a solar panel. He hopes that his house can have electricity to use.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Ranojon

texts.en:
Ranojon is widowed. She is a careful mother of four children. Ranojon’s children are adults. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years. She experienced a lot of difficulties in her life, because her husband died many years ago and she has grown her children alone.

Ranojon works hard from early morning till late evening in her cowshed, to feed cows. She sells cows in a local market. Her business is the main source of family income. Ranojon must buy coal and wood for the winter season, but she has not money. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy coal and wood for the winter season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy coal and wood for the winter season.

loans.name: Nụ

texts.en:
Mrs. Nụ works in agriculture, growing food. She is 41 years old, and she is married, with two children. She lives with her two dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nụ first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nụ has been involved in her farming business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Nụ faces in her life is the lack of a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, with which she will build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nụ hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: construction materials with which to build a toilet

loans.name: Lịch

texts.en:
Mrs. Lịch operates a food stall/restaurant selling food.

She is 26 years old and married with one child. Lịch lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Lịch  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lịch has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lịch  has been involved in this business for four years.

The main hardship that Lịch faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Lịch hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Rebeca Esperanza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Rio De Oro.
En este lugar vive la señora Rebeca, tiene 27 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, ambos  estudian en escuela e inicial. Su esposo es comerciante y estudia Ing. en Sistemas.
Doña Rebeca es una joven madre y esposa muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ganar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar con los gastos que generan sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días unas dos horas por día, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva en este negocio por más de 5 años con el cual se gana algo y puede ayudar a su marido que también tiene gastos de sus estudios.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Rio de Oro lending group meets every two weeks in the La California neighborhood in Portoviejo.  It’s the capital of Manabi and has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Rebeca lives here.  She is 27 years old, married, and has two children, ages, 8 and 3.  Both attend the local school.  Her husband is a merchant and is studying systems engineering.

Rebeca is a young mother and hardworking wife who likes to work in order to earn her own income so she can help with her children’s expenses.  She sells clothing and Avon products (beauty, cosmetics, perfumery, and ladies’ accessories) and works about two hours every day.  She sells on credit and collects every weekend and had been doing this for five years.  This allows her to earn some money and help out her husband who also has educational expenses.

She is asking for this loan to buy clothing, creams, and cosmetics.  She has been with the lending group for four years and likes that they help her with loans.  Her dreams are to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 33 years old, is married with two children. She lives in Ozamiz, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her business venture for a couple of years has been her little sari-sari store, which has helped her sustain the needs and the survival of her family.

However, with increasing demand from her customers, Maricel needs to replenish the inventory of her sari-sari store with items such as candies, biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. To answer the problem, she is borrowing an amount of PHP 5,000.00. This would be a great help for her to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as candies, biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo, etc. for her sari-sari store, which sustains the needs of her family

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Elizabeth, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 50 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Elizabeth has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Elizabeth isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, Elizabeth will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Elizabeth's Group will purchase a total of 13 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en: Sorphorn is 28 years old and a mother of three children who are living in Kampong Cham province. To support the family's living condition, she grows cassava on two and half hectares. Moreover, she can earn more income via rice cropping. This is Sorphorn's fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee to support her farmland.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is 46 years old and a married mother of six children, and is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Hellen has been a farmer for more than 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund. She decided to join this year because she really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though she is new to the program, Hellen wanted to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Hellen hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 3 solar lights, as, even though Hellen decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize	.

loans.name: Tren

texts.en:
Tren is an old man, living in Kampong Cham province. He is 54 years old and a father of three children. To support his living, he grows cassava as the main source of income. Moreover, he can earn extra income via cashew apple growing.

This is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor fees, to take care of his farmland. He hopes that he can get more yield from his crop, than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay farm labor fees, to take care of his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is an old man of about 38 years living with his wife and his five children who are attending school. He does agriculture, an activity he has done for over 30 years and is proud to have ripped a lot from it. 

In addition to a retail shop, Wilfred runs a local brew-selling business, which also supplement his daily income. According to him, through the above businesses he has been able to take care of his family responsibilities and children.
 
Wilfred also says he has acquired this loan to boost his agricultural business, especially adding manure to his coffee garden, which he believes will boost his harvest. Wilfred also affirms that his biggest clientele base is within coffee traders around his place who usually deposit money before the actual harvest of coffee is done.

According to him, his biggest challenge is unfavorable weather changes such as droughts and floods.

He is described as a hardworking man who has been able to achieve everything from his sweat

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en: This single young man in the photo is Bakhtiyor. He is a native of Jilikul district and he is 22 years old. Bakhtiyor is a farmer. He, along with his brothers, is engaged in growing crops on a 1.5 hectare plot of land. Bakhtiyor now wants to start his own trading business. He is interested in buying and selling vegetables. But he doesn't have enough start-up capital to bring in the goods. For this reason, Bakhtiyor is taking a loan to purchase potatoes for resale. He will deal with buying goods and his brother Safarbek will sell them in the market. They expect financial support.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes for resale

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La socia María Esther pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia María Esther ,la socia continua con su carrera de guía de turismo, la socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua trabajando con las diferentes agencias que solicitan sus servicios, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para pagar gastos de educación.
texts.en:
María Esther is one of the members of the communal bank Patrón de San Sebastian in the city of Cusco. She is still studying to become a tourist guide. She is grateful for her previous loan and promises to comply with her payment terms. She continues to work with different agencies that require her services, and this is her means of providing for her family.

She is requesting this loan to cover education expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her education costs.

loans.name: Bertha Rosa

texts.es: Bertha es una mujer emprendedora y laboriosa en su negocio, casada y propietaria de una tienda de ropa y repostería en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años, madre de dos hijos quienes son su deseo de superación para seguir adelante. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de pantalones, camisas, talladores, toallas, pan dulce, pan simple, empanadas, etc. Ella lleva seis ciclos trabajando con la institución ADIM y ha sido muy responsable y honesta en los días de pago, con los créditos anteriores ha invertido en su negocio y en el mejoramiento del hogar.
texts.en:
Bertha is an enterprising woman and a hardworking business owner. She has a clothing store and pastry shop, which she has been running in her home for the past four years. She has two children, who inspire her to improve herself and get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to buy pants, shirts, kitchen towels, bath towels, pastries, bread, empanadas, etc. She has been working with ADIM for six cycles now and has always been very honest and responsible with her payment terms. She used her previous loans to invest in her business and make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, kitchen towels, bath towels, pastries, bread, empanadas, etc.

loans.name: Mamilita

texts.en:
Mamilita is 57 years old and lives in Ozamiz City. She is married with eight children. 

Mamilita is managing her fishing business and owns fish cages. She earns a meagre income each month doing this type of work. She supported the needs of her big family, especially her children's education, until they graduated and got their own jobs. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase an additional fishing boat, floating guards, and other fishing accessories to improve and expand her fish cages. 

In the future, Mamilita hopes to build a decent house for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase additional an fishing boat, floating guards, and other fishing accessories to improve and expand her fish cages.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 62 años de edad, su estado civil es separado, vive en Morropón junto a su hijo quien es mayor de edad, Morropón es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios como agua,luz, cable, etc. Y está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Andrés es el servicio de carpinteria; él confecciona puertas, ventanas, juegos de comedor, roperos, comodas, etc., esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años, contando con clientela fija en la zona y los alrededores. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en capital de trabajo, pues desea realizar la compra de una cantidad mayor de materia prima (madera de cedro y tornillo), para la elaboración de sus productos, lo cual le beneficiará en tener mayor producción, generando asi mayor ganancia. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas ya que pobladores de la zona estan trabajando en empresas formales.
texts.en:
Andres is 62 years old and separated.  He lives in Morropon with his adult son.  Morropon is a place where people are farmers, merchants and raise livestock.  There are basic services such as running water, electricity, cable, etc. and it’s located in the district, and province of Morropon; an within the Piura district on the northern coast of Peru.

Andres is a Carpenter and makes doors, windows, dining room sets, desks, etc.  He has been doing this for more than 10 years and has steady customers in the area.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a large quantity of supplies (cedar and screws) to make is products so he can increase his production and earnings.  The market has good prospects because the local people are working for companies.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 44 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y tres hijos de 21 que ayuda en trabajos y aporta ingresos a la UEF, el segundo de 13 años estudia en colegio secundario en distrito Santo Tomas y el tercero de 11 años estudia en escuala de caserio tayales donde viven; vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada en caserio Tayales frente a centro de salud; Lorenzo y su cónyuge son nacidos en caserio Tayales del distrito santo tomas, Lorenzo se lleva bien los mienbros de caserio y pobladores del distrito; Lorenzo cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Lorenzo es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1,5 has. Variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantacion esta en segundo año de producción tiene tres años de edad, cultiva café en caserio Tayales por el Salluc distrito santo tomas, actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cria ganado vacuno, contando a la fecha con 5 reses de su propiedad, también cria de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 has. De café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 44, has a stable home and lives with his wife and three children: one is 21 and helps with the work and contributes income to the UEF, the second is 13 and goes to secondary school in Santo Tomas, and the last one is 11 and goes to school in the small village of Tayales where they live. Lorenzo lives in his own home made of rustic materials located in the Tayales village in front of a health center. It has running water. Lorenzo is doing well with the village members and the district population. He has good personal and business references in the area. His community depends primarily on farming, ranching, and business. It is in the Santo Tomas district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region in northern Peru.

Lorenzo cultivates coffee; right now he as 1.5 hectarces. The Catimor variety, resistant to disease, is in its second year of production; it's three years old. He cultivates coffee in the Tayales village, Salluc sector, Santo Tomas district. He has done this work for 10 years and has experience in coffee cultivation. He also raises cattle. Right now, he has five cattle on his property. He also raises small livestock: chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and other animals, in addition to cultivating common products. The purpose of this loan is to maintain and cultivate two hectacres of coffee, ensuring good production for 2015, causing better sales volume and therefore providing better income so he can improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate two hectacres of coffee, ensuring good production for 2015.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Jocelyn successfully repaid a previous loan and is now requesting a new one to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Jocelyn's business profile to better support her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Realyn

texts.en:
Realyn is 27 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Realyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Realyn has been farming rice for eight years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Desde el año 2009 el señor Rodrigo pasó a ser propietario del negocio familiar el cual es la fabricación de arepas, un alimento a base de maíz muy tradicional en Antioquia. 

Hablando de Rodrigo es un hombre carismático, dedicado y responsable, padre de tres hijas y que se ha trazado una meta ya que es el propietario del negocio familiar el cual es poder genera empleo.

Sabe que para brindar empleo debe mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, ser más competitivo y tener sostenibilidad, cosas difíciles de lograr pero que con compromiso y trabajo las quiere lograr.

 Solicita un crédito para mejorar su producción de arepas invirtiéndolo todo en maíz y arepas. 

Rodrigo solicita una ayuda para trabajar cumplir sus sueño apoyar a personas brindándoles un trabajo, quiere crecer y seguir con esta tradición de fabricación de arepas en leña una tradición que poco a poco se está perdiendo y él es el llamado a mantenerla.
texts.en:
In 2009, Rodrigo became the owner of the family business, which manufactures arepas, a traditional food item made out of corn that is typical in Antioquia. He has lots of charisma and is a dedicated and responsible man. He has three daughters. 

Rodrigo has set a goal for himself as a business owner, which is to create jobs. He knows that in order to be able to do this, he must improve his sales, increase his customer base, and his business has to become more profitable, competitive, and sustainable. These are difficult goals, but he is willing to work hard and be committed in order to achieve them.

He is requesting this loan to improve his production, so he will invest all of it in corn and in making arepas. Rodrigo is asking for help so that he can keep working and make his dream of helping others by offering them employment a reality. He wants to continue the tradition of making arepas using firewood, which is being lost little by little. His calling is to keep it alive.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Solomon's Group

texts.en:
Solomon is a 62-year-old, proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and he is representing his group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Solomon has noticed that he has a larger farm group support.

Solomon says his harvest was good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing two solar lights, in addition to the fertilizer and maize seeds, because now he will have light during dark hours for his children to study by. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Solomon’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, un astuto, hombre con un negocio de salsamentaría que es un lugar de esparcimiento y compartir con amigos pensado en personas adultos mayores donde se reúnen y comparten una bebida con amigos y se siente agradables.

Es un padre de dos hijos ya mayores de edad pero la menor de 20 años vive con él y quiere que esta joven tenga un estudio y sea profesional un deseo que no pudo realizar pues su infancia fue difícil.

Jorge igual quiere comprar una casa propia y tiene gran creencia y seguridad en que el negocio le va a permitir alcanzar estas metas y por ello está muy motivado con el crédito que desea solicitar y que invertirá en la compra de bebidas, mecatos (dulces, papas en bolsa, etc.), en su negocio y bebidas alcohólicas.
 
Este crédito le permitirá tener un mejor surtido y ofrecer a sus clientes una buena experiencia
texts.en:
Jorge's an astute man with a deli business that's in a district for entertainment and sharing with friends, older adults who get together and share a drink with friends for pleasant company.

He's the father of two adult children, but the younger one, 20, lives with him.  He wants this young woman to get an education and be a professional, something he couldn't achieve because he had a difficult childhood.

Jorge also wants to buy his own house, and he has great faith and confidence that his business will allow him to realize his goals.  That's why he's so motivated by the loan he wants to request.

He's going to invest in his business and buy beverages, pastries, sweets, potato chips, etc., as well as alcoholic beverages.  This loan will allow him to have better stock and offer his customers a good experience.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his deli such as beverages, fried foods, sweets, and food

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa una bella adolecente de 20 años de edad, madre soltera cabeza de familia de una pequeña de 3 años la cual ha podido mantener gracias a un negocio de venta de mercancía que monto hace dos años, vende especialmente calzado, gracias a su madre pudo montar su negocio le enseño y la motivo a trabajar pues tiene un hijo por quien luchar.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de variedad en calzado pues quiere incrementar su inventario, su utilidad, y llegar a un mayor número de  clientes.

El monto del crédito es equivalente al tipo de mercancía que vende pues los zapatos y tenis tiene un costo elevado.

Su sueño es salir adelante, estudiar y darle a su hija todo lo que este a su alcance.
texts.en:
Luisa, 20, is a single mother who is the head of her family. She has a 3 year old daughter who she has managed to support thanks to a business selling merchandise which she started two years ago. She specifically sells footwear and thanks to her mother she was able to start up her business. Her mother taught her and motivated her to work as she has a child to look after.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy a variety of footwear since she wants to expand her inventory, her usefulness and so attract a greater number of clients.

The loan amount is equivalent to the type of merchandise she sells since shoes and trainers have an elevated cost.

Her dream is to get ahead, study and give her daughter everything she can.

loans.use: to buy footwear to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Al- Yasamin Group

texts.en:
Al- Yasamin is a group which consists of seven members, all women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 350,000 YER from AMB.

Monira is the leader of the group. She is a 39-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of three children. She lives with her family, in their own house, in the capital city of Sana'a. Monira studied until the elementary education, and she works as a secretary in the private sector, with a small salary. The house where Monira and her family live lacks many home appliances and furniture. Monira wants to furnish her house, but she doesn't have enough money to do this. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB, in order to purchase furniture for her house.

Monira looks forward to opening a savinga account in the bank. Also, she hopes to furnish all her house.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cassava to grow to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Shemu's Group

texts.en: Shemu, pictured above, leads a loan group made up of eleven farmers in the Kakamega North District of Kenya. He decided to lead this group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and the father of two children. With a portion of this loan, Shemu will not only buy maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. The solar light will allow his family to have illumination at night so his children can study. Shemu plans to use the profits he earns this year to save more money for the future. The people in Shemu’s Group will use this loan to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his corn harvests

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio Javier pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
El socio continua trabajando en  una institución pública, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio también continua con su negocio  de pasamaneria, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de cepillos, aguijas, hilos, botones,tijeras entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Javier belongs to the Patrón de San Sebastián communal bank in the city of Cusco.

He works at a public institution. Javier is having a good time with his work and is doing well thanks to his daily efforts. He also has a business in craft products. He hopes to continue growing his business so he can keep supporting his family.

Javier is requesting a loan to buy brushes, needles, thread, buttons, scissors, and other items. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: para la compra de cepillos, aguijas, hilos, botones,tijeras entre otros.

loans.name: Coty Fiorela

texts.es:
Coty Fiorela tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Coty Fiorela se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que esta ubicado en su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para compra de mercadería, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad de productos(cosmeticos, perfumes, joya, etc.), con gran influencia en el negocio; Coty Fiorela piensa incrementar su negocio para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Coty Fiorela, 23, is not married and has one son. She lives with her family in a rural area of Oyotún district, in Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. Her community is more or less dedicated to agriculture, raising livestock and business.

Coty Fiorela has more than three years experience selling cosmetics and beauty products with her business, which is located in her home. She is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise. This investment will mean that she has a wider range of products (cosmetics, perfumes, jewellery etc.), with a lot of influence in the business.

Coty Fiorela is thinking about expanding her business so that she can fulfil the various needs and tastes of her local customers. This will then allow her in the short term to increase her income, and therefore her profits, which will mean she can improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and widen her range of products.

loans.name: Cúc

texts.en:
Cúc is 52 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Cúc operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  

In 2008, Cúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Cúc has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Cúc faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Cúc hopes to maintain a successful business, to build a new house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional materials for her manicure/pedicure service business. Merlinda has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from a beauty salon.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Aludia Maria

texts.es:
Luego de separarse de su marido la señora Aludia se encontraba buscando una forma de generar ingresos pues la comida se acababa, las deudas llamaban y tomo la iniciativa de buscar un empleo pero encontró un no en cada puerta que toco, desesperada tomo la decisión de iniciar su propia empresa y desde el año 2012 vende artículos en general, chulos, diademas, pulseras, aretes, medias, artículos para uñas, cabello, pañales etc. 

Es madre de una hija ya mayor de edad y cada que puede la apoya para que esta pueda estudiar sin descuidar su más preciado sueño, poder comprar un día una casa propia, pero seguirá persiguiéndolo pro lo pronto necesita mejorar su negocio ya que tienen una necesidad de mejorar sus ventas, incrementar su utilidad, y darle sostenibilidad al negocio y lo hará invirtiendo en este con un crédito con el que comprara mercancía en general de la anteriormente mencionada.
texts.en:
After she separated from her husband, Aludia was looking for a way to generate an income because she was running out of food and bills were piling up. She decided to look for a job but she was rejected at every turn. Desperate, she decided to start her own business, and since 2012 she has been selling items in general: hairbands, bracelets, earrings, stockings, nail products, hair products, diapers, etc. 

She has an adult daughter and helps her whenever she can so that she can stay in school, but her main focus is her precious dream of one day being able to buy her own house. She is working towards that goal, but for now she needs to improve her business. She needs to improve sales, profitability, and sustainability. She will do this by investing this loan in her business. She will use it to buy merchandise in general, such as the items mentioned above.

loans.use: to buy assorted costume jewelry and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Rosalba De Jesus

texts.es:
Rosalba una humilde trabajadora y dedicada mujer de 64 años de edad, vive con su esposo con el que sorprendentemente ha logrado criar, levantar nada más y nada menos que 11 hijos.

Tanto ella como su esposo son productores agrícolas  siendo su esposo más agricultor y ella dedica a los animales y es por esta razón que necesita una ayuda para poder mantener su negocio mediante un crédito que usara para la compra de concentrado que es el alimento del cerdo y los pollos. 

Su sueño es tener salud para trabajar el negocio que por tantos años le dieron a ella, su esposo y 11 hijos una forma de vida estable.
texts.en: Rosalba is a simple worker and 53 year old mother. She lives with her husband and surprisingly the children that she has had and raised, nothing more, nothing less than 11. Both her and her husband work in agricultural production. Her husband is more of a farmer and she works with animals. For this reason she needs a loan to help her keep up her business. By way of this loan she will buy concentrated feed for pigs and chickens. Her dream is to have good health to work her business for as many years as God grants her and with her husband and her 11 children enjoy a stable life.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Isah expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home. In the long run, he would like to ensure that other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing now, so he can store his maize to sell later, at a higher price

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
This is Diana, a 30-year-old married mother of a 5-year-old and a 4-month-old. Their house, as you can see in the picture, has no doors or windows yet. The cold weather has already started and Diana is very worried about the fact that her children live in that cold house. Installing doors and windows is urgent as per her saying, “We started building the house because the one we had was almost collapsing and we had no other choice, but to build a small new one. Our money was not enough though to finish building it and people addressed us to the VFA that has a clear vision on children,” said Diana during the interview. 

To make a living, Diana’s focus has been on agriculture, planting and selling in large quantities peppers, beets and potatoes while her husband receives a monthly income from working in a nearby carpentry shop.

loans.use: to install doors and windows in the house where two children (a 5-year-old and a 4-month-old) live with their parents

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo was born in 1961 year. She is widowed and has three children. She is a business lady and has a great experience in business. Marhabo has been busy with buying and selling dried fruits in a local market. She has been busy with this business for more than 16 years, and also she works in a school. Marhabo has higher pedagogical education. She teaches math in a local school and has many pupils.

Marhabo uses the profit of her business and her salary to offer her family all necessary things. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni, to buy coal and wood to keep warmly her house, in winter season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy coal and wood to keep warmly her house in winter season

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Thúy works in agriculture, farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thúy hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu   works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Thu   is 32 years old and she is married with two children.
Thu   lives  in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thu's   first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Thu   has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thu   faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thu   hopes for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como Estancia Vieja en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito Alfa Y Omega. Lugar de gente humilde y dedicada a la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora  Olga, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de 4  años  de edad, la cual  estudian en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Olga se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Belcorp  (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), ropa y sabanas, trabaja todos los días en la mañana, deja a créditos  y cobra semanalmente, esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres años y hoy tiene bastante clientela. 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito por que le está yendo muy bien con su negocio, sus ganancias le han servido para ciertos gastos que tuvo en los estudios de su pequeña. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, ropa y sabanas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The Alfa y Omega lending group meets every two weeks in the area known as Estancia Vieja, within the Colon parish of the city of Portoviejo.  It’s a place where the people are humble and work as merchants and farmers.

Olga lives here.  She is 39 years old, married, and has a four year old daughter in kindergarten.  Her husband works as a merchant

Olga does catalog sales of Avon and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery, and ladies’ accessories), clothing, and bedding.  She works every morning, sells on credit, and collects every week.  She’s been doing this for three years and she now has many customers.

She is asking for another loan because things are going well with her business and her income has helped with some of her daughter’s educational expenses.  She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, clothing, and bedding.  She has been with the lending group for two years and likes it because the loans help her to get ahead.  She wants to be able to provide the best for her little girl.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Sen works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. This is Sen's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Sen faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment for a toilet, in order to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Sen hopes to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She wants her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment for a toilet…to build a toilet

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 52 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with three children. She keeps livestock and poultry.  She has been able to get more income from the sale of the products, such as milk and eggs. She has been running her business for 20 years. She also sells clothes as her secondary activity and it has been profitable too.

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, at 44 years old, is seeing his dream fulfilled. That dream is to be an independent person and have his own dairy goat milk business. Thanks to the introduction of Juhudi Kilimo in his life, he can achieve this dream and continue upward. Peter is now hoping to take the opportunity to raise a dairy goat, and therefore requests a loan which will purchase a high breed of dairy goat. Peter practices mixed farming, and he loves dairy farming.

He is the father of three children, 12, 14 and 16 years old, and he has dreams of paying for their education - even though they want to be footballers! Peter, as a good father, is always at their side to support them unconditionally. This is why he is so determined to succeed, in this new process of his life.

Dairy goat milk fetches a high price in the market. Therefore, Peter will be assured of high returns from this business, which will translate to an improved standard of living. All that Peter is waiting for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Taalaigul

texts.ru: Таалайгул досрочно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей с финансированием. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Таалайгул есть 2 коровы, 5 овец и 1 лошадь.На земельной доле она дополнительно посеяла картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль Таалайгул составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Таалайгул будет вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что позволит ей улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Taalaigul repaid her previous loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. She currently has two cows, five sheep, and a horse, and also plants potatoes on shared land. She earns about 20,000 som (KGS) per month. She applied for another loan with Bai-Tushum Bank in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. She will use the profits to continue investing in additional livestock, which will allow her to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Sok is 61 years old and a mother of four children. To support her family's condition, she grows rice as her main source of income and works as a construction worker to supplement her income. She can earn income of about 23,500 KHR per day. This is her fifth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her past loans. In her group of four, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get bigger yields than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La socia Rita pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Rita sigue dedicándose a su negocio de constructora la cual realiza edificios, casas, entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para pagar materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Rita is one of the members of the communal bank Patrón de San Sebastian in the city of Cusco. She still works in the construction business. Her company builds buildings, homes, and other dwellings. She is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with her payment terms. She has been in business for several years, and things are going well for her because she puts lots of effort into her business every day. This is her means of providing for her family.

This member is requesting a loan to pay for construction materials.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials.

loans.name: Thương

texts.en:
Thương is 27 years old and  is married with two children.
Thương lives  in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has a service business shipping goods. Thương has been involved in this business for eight years.
The main hardship that Thương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. This is Thương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thương hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for them  to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
Lucero tiene 47 años, es soltera, conocida en el medio, por su labor de elaboración y venta de comida. Vive en casa familiar con madre e hija que trabaja por zona de residencia. Lucero cuenta con buenas referencias. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada a 42 Km de Chiclayo, pasando Zaña, habitada por gente respetuosa y amigable, que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Lucero se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, desde hace más de 02 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 10 años. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de gaseosa, galletas y andamios, para poder incrementar sus ventas, además de poder captar un número mayor de clientes, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucero is 47 years old, single, and well-known in her area for the food she makes and sells. She lives in a family house with her mother and works in the neighborhood. She has good references and comes from a close-knit family. The community where she lives is located 42 Km from Chiclayo, after Zaña. Its residents are respectful and friendly people who work in trade, agriculture, and raising livestock. It belongs to the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast.

Lucero works making and selling food and has been doing this for over two years. She also works raising and selling pigs, which she has been doing for over ten years. She needs a loan to invest in purchasing sodas, cookies, and shelves, so that she can boost her sales and reach more customers. This will allow her to increase her profit in the short run, and in turn improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sodas, cookies, and shelves.

loans.name: Én

texts.en:
Mrs. Én works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Én is 64 years old and married with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Én's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

The main hardship that Én faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Én hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
Annah is a 52-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Annah has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Annah described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Annah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Psychology. Here is her story:

“I have strong analytical skills. I am good at mathematics and learning different languages. I know English best among my classmates and I strive to be the best in what I do. Additionally, I am a goal-oriented and persevering person.  Now the most important goal is to become the best psychologist in Kyrgyzstan, getting a Bachelor’s Degree at AUCA.

There are many reasons for me to study at AUCA. AUCA offers high quality education, an American system of study, has well-known instructors, internship opportunities and employment prospects. I learned about AUCA when I studied in the ninth grade since at that time, I decided to enter the Psychology Department. AUCA’s tuition fee is so high for my family that I need a Kiva loan to cover part of it.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma es una mujer joven de 18 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negosio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es constante, paciente, optimista, comprometida, amable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Cullucachi’ ubicada a orillas del lago Titicaca y que se caracteriza por ser una región productora de leche y forraje, además de contar con tres pisos ecológicos que le permiten criar ganado vacuno, ovino y camélido, y cultivar hortalizas y tubérculos. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura constante entre 4-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Zulma es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero manta y pollera) y su lengua materna es el aymará (que se habla en el lugar) para el comercio habla español. Vive en una casa de adobe que cuenta con electricidad. Su negocio es la producción de derivados lácteos como; el queso, yogurt, requesón, etc., y lo comercializa en la feria del lugar y también en la ciudad; “Además de producir leche, me dedico a la agricultura; siembro todo tipo de hortalizas y las vendo en los mercados de La Paz”. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea realizar una inversión en la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de ganado lechero para incrementar su oferta y obtener mejores ganancias. Esta es su primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Zulma solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para incrementar su producción para ofertar a fin de año.
texts.en:
Zulma, 18, is single, doesn’t have children, and has an artisanal cheese business.

She is reliable, patient, optimistic, committed, kind, and hard-working. She has her business in the Cullucachi community on the shores of Lake Titicaca. The area is known for being a region of milk and fodder production, in addition to having three ecological layers that facilitate raising ovine, bovine, and camelidae, and to cultivate vegetables and tubers. The cold and dry climate has a consistent temperature between 4 and 12 degrees Celsius throughout the whole year.

Zulma has dark skin, long black hair, she is short, and wears traditional clothing (hat, shirt and skirt) and her native language is Aymará, which is spoken in the area. For business, she speaks Spanish. She lives in an adobe home that has electricity. Her business is in producing dairy products such as cheese, yogurt, cottage cheese, and similar products. She sells them at the market in the region and and also in the city. “In addition to selling milk, I also work in agriculture. I plant all kinds of vegetables and sell them at the markets in La Paz.” Her dream is to improve her family’s quality of life and she wants to make an investment in growing her business by buying milking cows to increase her offerings and to earn more money. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. She has done this work for 18 years.

For these reasons, Zulma is requesting a loan to buy milking cows to increase production for the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy milking cows to increase production for the end of the year.

loans.name: Ileana Patricia

texts.es: Ileana es una mujer emprendedora de 45 años de edad, casada y madre dos hijos siendo sus mayores motivadores para su superación, es propietaria de un taller de costura desde hace dieciocho años, el crédito los solicita para la compra de tela e hilos, gruesa de zipper, entre tela, cintas de mantequilla, chifón, etc., además incursionara el negocio de venta de calzado, este último es uno de sus mayores logros obtenidos.
texts.en: Ileana is an enterprising woman. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children who are her main motivation to improve herself. She has owned her sewing shop for eighteen years now. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers, lining, ribbon, chiffon, etc. She also plans to incorporate shoe sales to her business, which will be one of her greatest achievements.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Thả

texts.en:
Mrs. Thả is 57 years old and she is married with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Thả operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2005, Thả joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thả has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

The main hardship that Thả faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thả hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nilton Sixto

texts.es:
Nilton es un hombre luchador  y empeñoso en lo que se propone lograr, actualmente trabaja en una empresa reconocida como operario. El y su familia viven en un departamento alquilado, dentro de sus posibilidades económicas, su mayor propósito es comprar con mucho esfuerzo una casa propia para una mejor comodidad y seguridad, por lo pronto Nilton desea amoblar el departamento donde viven, es por ello que estaría solicitando el crédito, con esto desea mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
Nilton está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, ya que de brindarle el crédito el podrá empezar a emprender lo que tanto anhela una casa propia.
texts.en:
Nilton is a driven man who is very dedicated to whatever goals he sets for himself. He is currently working for a well-known company as a factory worker. He and his family live in a rented apartment within their means. His main goal is to work hard so that one day he can buy his own house and live more comfortably and safely. For now, Nilton wants to furnish the apartment where they live, which is why he is requesting this loan. This way he wants to improve his and his family's quality of life.

Nilton is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity, because this loan will allow him to start working towards what he so badly wants, a home of his own.

loans.use: to buy furniture and appliances for his home.

loans.name: Francisco Luis

texts.es:
2 hijos son el motor de vida del señor Francisco quien desde año 2008 inicio un negocio de distribución de gas, una actividad que aprendió empíricamente y que siguió realizando al ver los buenos resultados que le daban.

Francisco es uno de las pocas personas del sector rural que oferta un servicio de distribución de gas y ya que visualiza su negocio a 5 años como el mejor distribuidor de todas las veredas, le gustaría pedís un apoyo crediticio para la compra de pipetas de gas al por mayor.

Este crédito le ayuda a crecer en inventario pudiendo abarcar un mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco's two sons are the driving force behind his life. In 2008 he started a gas distribution business, which he learnt empirically. He continued the business seeing the good results he was getting.

Francisco is one of the few people in the rural area who offer a gas distribution service, and since in 5 years time he can see the business being the best distributor in the town, he would like to ask for a loan in order to buy gas canisters in bulk.

This loan will help him to grow his inventory and take on a larger number of customers.

loans.use: to buy gas canisters in bulk.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva works hard to support her family. Primitiva is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Primitiva requested a loan of 20000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more ingredients and items to sell.

Primitiva has been in this business for 30 years now.

Primitiva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the door lock and strengthen the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to register at school and start studying for her professional career.

loans.name: Carmenza Idalia

texts.es:
Carmenza una sonriente, trabajadora, emprendedora y simpática mujer de 61 años, madre de 4 hijos ya todos ellos mayores de edad, que desde el año 2011 monto un negocio de venta de helados y agradece a su hermana que fue quien la motivo y le enseño de tal profesión. 

Trabaja diariamente entre 8 y 10 horas y buscando mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, poder tener sostenibilidad del negocio, diversificar la oferta de productos, mejorar su local y en fin vivir dignamente le gustaría solicitar un auxilio crediticio para invertir en silletería, adecuaciones del punto de venta y surtido en sabores variados de helado.

Una ayuda puede impactar esta mujer que con su negocio ha podido mantener su hogar.
texts.en:
Carmenza, 61, is a hard-working, enterprising and kind woman with four adult children. In 2011 she set up a ice cream business and she is grateful to her sister, who was her motivation and taught her the business.

She works between 8 and 10 hours every day. She is looking to improve her living conditions, have a sustainable business, expand the range of products, improve the premises and live in dignity. She would like to ask for loan to invest in seating, modifications to her premises and ice cream stock in various flavours.

Any help will have an impact for this mother who has managed to support her household with her business.

loans.use: to invest in seating, modifying her premises and ice cream stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 33 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child who is now at its school age. 
Carmen earns income from her rice retailing business. She’s been engaged in this business for four years. She earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. That amount is so helpful in supporting her family, and not depending solely on her husband. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase three additional sacks of rice for retail. 
Carmen has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Carmen hopes to establish her own rice retailing store business.

loans.use: purchase three additional sacks of rice for retail.

loans.name: Joel's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Joel, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. He is 40 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.  He is married and has four children.

Joel is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Joel says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Joel will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of eight solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of four acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will receive a total of eight solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Bibiana Andrea

texts.es:
Bibiana es una mujer casada con una pequeña hija de 7 años, sufrió una terrible experiencia en su vida y es que los grupos paramilitares la obligaron a abandonar su terreno.

Esta maravillosa mujer nunca se rindió y a pesar que lo dejo todo atrás está formando una nueva vida y como siempre trabajando por el progreso de su hija, trabajar por una mejor vida y hacer como el ave fénix renacer de las cenizas.

Solicita la cooperación de todos pues busca una ayuda para seguir progresando por lo tal necesita un auxilio crediticio para comprar abonos, riegos, pesticidas y semillas de cebolla.

Este crédito le ayuda ampliar su cultivo y tener una mejor rentabilidad por cada cosecha.

Se compromete a pagar cumplidamente sus cuotas y a progresar cada día más para mandar a su hija a la ciudad a ejercer una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Bibiana is married and has a seven-year-old little girl. She suffered a terrible life experience, when paramilitary groups forced her to leave her land. This wonderful woman never gave up and in spite of everything that she had to leave behind, she is starting a new life and working hard for her daughter like she always does. She wants to work for a better life and be like the phoenix, which is reborn from the ashes.

She is requesting everyone's cooperation, for she needs some help in order to keep moving forward. She needs a loan to buy fertilizer, irrigation supplies, pesticides, and onion seeds. This loan will allow her to expand her crops and have a more profitable harvest. 

She promises to make her payments on time and work harder every day so that she can send her daughter to the city to attend University.

loans.use: to buy irrigation supplies, pesticides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 54 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Grace likes to think of herself as a very hard-working individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learnt a lot from farming training. Grace plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Grace’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her maize harvests.

loans.name: Yélé Group

texts.fr: Mariam membre représentatif du groupe vend des pagnes bazins, des bijoux et des chaussures. le groupe de Marian travaille avec ACFIME depuis Juillet 2012 et jusque là, elle font des remboursements correctes. Mariam est mariée et mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés et 1 travaille actuellement.Avec ce prêt, elle pourrait acheter des bazins, quelques bijoux et des chaussures à la mode pour vendre. Cette brave dame aimerait renforcer son activité dans le futur et le bénéfice de ses ventes lui permettra de continuer son commerce.
texts.en: Mariam, the group's representative, sells traditional damask-type "bazins" fabric, jewelry and shoes. Mariam's group has been working with ACFIME since July 2012 and so far all their loans have been repaid on time. Mariam is married and has six children, all of whom study and one also already working. With this loan, she will be able to buy traditional fabric, some jewelry and shoes in popular styles  for resale. This hard-working woman would like to strengthen her business in the future, and the revenue from her sales will allow her to develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric, jewelry and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Rosario Guadalupe

texts.es: Rosario de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su nieto, ella se dedica a la agricultura (siembra maíz), comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, y ya tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
39-year-old Rosario lives in her own home with her two children and grandchild. She makes a living in agriculture (planting corn), selling her products in the surrounding area. She already has many customers. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. to continue with cultivating her crops.

loans.use: to purchase of seeds, fertilizers,manure, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Yai's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Yai is 47 years old and a mother of four children. She earns income to improve her family's conditions via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for 35 years and earns about 33,300 KHR per day. This is her sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a motorbike to transport her rice. She expects that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport her rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 53-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibungyo, Uganda. He deals in cocoa buying and selling but he also has a cocoa garden. He sells to cocoa agents in Bundibugyo. He hopes to build a permanent house for his family.

Tadeo intends to use the loan to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Davide

texts.en:
Davide must do some minor repairs to her house. There are children under 18 years of age living in the house. 

The region where they live is located in the northern part of the country where the cold is bitter and the snow has already started.

loans.use: to make some minor repairs to the house where children under the age of 18 live.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de venta de lácteos, la socia continua  vendiendo  leche, quesos entre otros, la socia vende su mercadería a su clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Julia continues to work at her dairy sales business, selling milk and cheese among other things.  She  sells her merchandise to customers who ask for it.  Julia is a very responsible and dedicated person, and thanks to this she has brought her family forward.  She is asking for a loan to purchase more milk.  Julia is grateful for the loan she was granted, and promises to repay her loan according to the repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase milk

loans.name: Phê

texts.en:
Mrs. Phê works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

She is 45 years old and married with two children. Phê lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Phê has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Phê's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Phê hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en:
Tâm has a retail business selling electronics supplies. She has been involved in this business for 9 years.

Tâm is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives  in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tâm has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Armela

texts.en:
Armela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Armela has been in this business for six years and earns more income from food vending and farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Armela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a smallholder farmer in Basii Masige, located in the Kisii region of Kenya. She is in love with farming. She started farming 14 years ago, around the same time she got married to Clement. The couple engages in numerous income-generating activities to provide for their three children. Everline keeps a dairy cow and 12 poultry birds, for milk and eggs for both consumption and sale.

She is seeking a loan to add another dairy cow, on their 0.1-acre farm. This investment will double her milk production quantity when both cows are on their lactation days, and cushion shortages on 'off-lactation' days (so to speak). This investment will ensure a steady flow of income throughout the year and less dependence on her husband.

A portion of the profits that will remain, after feeding the family, will be rolled back into the business for development and maintenance. Help Everline scale up her business and elevate her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a second dairy cow.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi is a maize farmer from Furana village, in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idi can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, for a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Idi, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing at harvest time, reducing pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Kimsan

texts.en: A villager living in Kandal province, Kimsan is 57 years old and a mother of five children. For her living, she earns an income to support her family condition via deserts and vegetable selling. For Kimsan, this is her eighth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue his Bachelor's degree, majoring in Information Technology. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Information Technology.

loans.name: Gulafzo

texts.en:
Gulafzo was born in 1975 year. She lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a builder in Russia. Gulafzo is a sewer. She has been busy with sewing for more than 18 years. She works in an atelier. She sews mainly women's national clothes. Gulafzo sews high-quality and fashionable clothes. She is an honest woman.

Gulafzo is a repeat client of Imon International, and she has a good credit story. Gulafzo always tries to promote for the education of her children. Now, her elder son studies in Russia. He applied to the university successfully. Gulafzo must pay the tuition of her son. She is asking for a loan to pay tuition for her son. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 55 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at their adult and school age.

To make her living, Lilia is engaged mainly in hog raising and vegetable gardening businesses, which she has had for 15 years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month, doing this type of business activity.
