Lilia has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two sacks of grower feeds. She has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. Lilia is hoping that someday, more of her relatives and friends in their barangay (village) will join the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of grower feeds

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
A Sra: Lucia de 52 anos de idade, viuva e mae de 5 filhos dos quais 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e os 4 sao indepedente e vivem nas suas casas . Ela è scouting numa empresa de producao de banana. 
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao(cimento, blocos, janela e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Lucia, 52, is a widow and a mother of five children. One of her children is in primary school and the other four are independent and live in their own houses. She works in scouting at a banana production company.

She will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, and a window) and to pay workers to continue construction on her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, blocks, and a window) and to pay workers to continue construction on her house.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, 36 years old, is married with two children. She has been peddling food and snacks to make a living. She sells snacks in her village and also accepts orders for any occasion, earning well for the family. To meet the current demands, she took a new loan recently to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell. She was happy to say that with this loan, she can rest assured that she can meet her desired income and save more for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare more snacks to sell

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Adelaide tem 41 anos de idade, casada e mãe  de quatro filhos dos quais uma frequenta o ensino superior  e os restantes estão no ensino primário e secundário, respectivamente.
 Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar roupa diversa como: bolsas, lençois, capulanas, camisetes  para revender, de forma a fortificar o seu negócio. 
A sua esperança  e o sonho é montar um salão de costura, uma vez que para além de negociante é também costureira. Gostaria ainda de ver o seu negócio a crescer mais, concluir a sua casa e confortar a sua familia
O desafio é  formar os seus filhos para que um dia prosperem a partir dos seus recursos
texts.en:
Adelaide, 41, is married and a mother of four children. One of her children is in higher education and the others are in primary and secondary school.

She will use this loan to buy various clothing, such as bags, handkerchiefs, capulanas (traditional women's clothing), and shirts to resell. In this way, she will strengthen her business. Her wish and dream is to open a sewing shop, as she is also a seamstress aside from her business. She would also like to see her business grow, finish her house, and give comfort to her family.

Her challenge is to educate her children so that they can one day prosper from their resources.

loans.use: to buy various clothing, such as bags, handkerchiefs, traditional capulanas, and shirts to resell.

loans.name: Isaura

texts.pt:
A sra Isaura tem 40 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 04 filhos dos quais 03 estudam e 01 não tem idade escolar
 Negociante de profissão  e com o empréstimo pretende comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade tais como arroz, óleo, cebola, feijão, peixe, carne, frangos, cerveja e refrescos para  revender na sua mercearia.
O seu sonho é ter uma casa concluida para melhor confortar os seus filhos visto que ainda dependem da sua mãe porque o seu marido faleceu e deixou-lhes com a casa não concluida.
O obstáculo à realização do seu sonho é a falta de dinheiro para concretizar o seu sonho.
texts.en:
Isaura, 40, is single and a mother of four children. Three of her children are studying and one is too young for school. She is a trader. With this loan, she plans to buy basic products such as rice, oil, onions, beans, fish, meat, chicken, beer, and soft drinks to resell in her grocery store.

Her dream is to have her house finished to give her children greater comfort. They depend on her because her husband died and left them with an unfinished house. The obstacle in the way of achieving her dream is her lack of money.

loans.use: to buy basic products such as rice, oil, onions, beans, fish, meat, chicken, beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Mrs. Hường works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is 26 years old, and she is married, with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. Hường has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hường has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hường faces in her life is the lack of a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hường hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: José Horacio

texts.es:
José un productor agropecuario y productor de leche el cual tiene 65 años de edad, es padre de 4 hijos 3 de ellos menores de edad, gracias a sus cultivos y a su vaca les puede dar el sustento diario.

Todo su conocimiento del campo lo aprendió de su padre de quien también lo heredo y lucha cada día por mantenerlo.

José le ha tocado estos ultimo años una época muy complicada pues el clima no ha sido un gran aliado, pasa por una temporada de sequía, a una temporada de fuertes lluvias que ahogan sus cultivos pero aún sigue en pie y luchando por que sus hijos estudien y no sean unos campesinos que solo trabajan para comer quiere que tengan hambre y sed de grandeza.

Este humilde y trabajar hombre solicita una ayuda para comprar semillas, abonos, riegos para su cultivo pues tiene un terreno que quiere usarlo para cultivo.

Su mayor sueño es ver que sus hijos estudien y que hereden esta tradición familiar pero administrando sus terrenos como todos unos profesionales con título haciendo de su cultivo un negocio rentable y que siga dándole a la familia franco la comida por muchos años.
texts.en:
José works in agriculture and livestock. He is 54 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are still minors. Thanks to his fields and the milk his cows produce, he is able to support them with their daily needs. 

All his knowledge he learned from his own father who he inherited the farm from and he spends everyday maintaining it. 

José has experienced some complications in the past few years and the climate has not been a good friend to him. He lived through a drought and then a period of heavy rainfall that drowned his crops. But he continues to pick himself back up and work hard so that his children can go to school. He wants them to achieve more than being fieldworkers when they grow up so that they are not stuck in a cycle of working to earn just enough to eat and drink. 

This humble and hard working man is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, manure, and irrigation for his fields since he wants to farm on land he has.  

His biggest dream is to see his children continue in school and to inherit the family farm, but to manage it as professionals, to make the family business profitable and to be able to feed the family for years to come.

loans.use: purchase manure for his fields.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Socorro works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Socorro is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell of charcoal business.

Socorro has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Anibal De Jesus

texts.es:
Aníbal un hombre de 71 años de edad que desde el año 64 fundo una ebanistería la cual opera hoy en día y emplea a dos familiares.

Aníbal aprendió solo del negocio, es un hombre casado, con 6 hijos y este negocio ha ayudado a este hombre a mantener a cada uno de ellos, hoy en día todos son mayores de edad tienen familia y su padre sigue madrugando diariamente a tender el negocio. 

Aníbal pide una ayuda crediticia para invertir dinero en la compra de materia prima que sería madera, y herramienta de mano ya que quiere mejorar sus ventas.

Aníbal es un hombre que ha recorrido ya la mayor parte de su vida y su sueño es que su negocio lo tomen alguno de sus hijos y siga con esta tradición que desde el año 64 ha brindado un servicio eficiente y de calidad a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Aníbal, 71, opened a joinery in 1964 which he still runs today, employing two relatives. 

Aníbal learned his profession alone. He is a married man with 6 children and this business has helped him to support every one of them. Now they are adults with families and their father continues to get up in the early hours every day to tend to the business.

Aníbal is asking for financial help so he can invest money in buying primary materials, namely wood, and hand-tools so that he can improve his sales.  

Aníbal is a man who has already lived the majority of his life and his dream is for one of his children to carry on his business which since 1964 has offered an efficient and high-quality service to the community.

loans.use: to buy hand-tools and wood for his workshop

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en:
Samson is a 54-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Samson has noticed that he has larger farm group support.

Samson described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Samson’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 49-year-old widow and a mother of eight children. She has been responsible for the family since her husband passed away. Today she is the sole breadwinner for two members of her family. The rest of the family started their own businesses to make living easier for their mother.

Randa is a hard worker who started a knitting business in her home 26 years ago. She is a very talented and skilled knitter. Twenty-one years ago she also started a small business in her home, creating souvenirs for weddings, births, and other special events. She also arranges special artificial flowers bouquets.

Randa is always trying hard to build up a better future for her children. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to help her son in opening his own shop. This loan will help Randa guarantee her son's future.

loans.use: to open a shop for her son.

loans.name: Maridalia

texts.es:
Maridalia reside en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, ella es natural de la zona, vive en casa propia junto a su familia. Maridalia no tiene carga familiar. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además del comercio. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que dedica el Maridalia es a la venta de Carne de cerdo y a la crianza del mismo, además de la venta de bebidas como es clarito gaseosas, actividad que realiza en su domicilio, desde hace más de 3 años, Maridalia cuenta con clientela fija en la zona y buenas referencias personales y laborales. Destino del crédito será para mejora de su vivienda(cambiar techo) pues ya se viene la temporada de lluvias y Maridalia desea asegurar su vivienda para tener mayor seguridad y comodidad para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maridalia lives in the district of Buenos Aires on the northern coast of Peru. She is a native to the area and she lives there with her family. Maridalia has no one to take care of. Life in the community here is quiet and the people here make a living in agriculture and livestock as well as in commerce.

Maridalia makes a living selling pork. She also sells sodas. She works from home, as she has for the past 3 years. Maridalia has a loyal clientele and good personal and work references. The loan she is asking for will be used to replace the roof on her house. The rainy season is coming and Maridalia wants to be sure that her home is safe and secure as this will help improve her quality of life.

loans.use: put a roof on her home.

loans.name: Sophon's Group

texts.en:
Sophon, a local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 40 years old and a mother of four children. 

To improve her condition, she grows rice on a one hectare area and works as a construction worker to earn extra income. 

This is the first loan for Sophon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more yields than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Angela una mujer con un carácter y espíritu muy fuerte sus 52 años de edad vela por el cuidado de sus dos hijas adolescentes de 18 y 22 años, es una madre que cuida de ellas sola puesto que se separó de su esposo. 

Trabaja realizando misceláneas, como portavasos, decoraciones para mesas, artesanías en general y aprendió de la profesión gracias a un amigo.

Con la ayuda de un crédito que se encuentra solicitando la señora Angela buscara mejorar su ventas, hacer llegar su producto a más personas, almacenes. 

Angela quiere impulsar su negocio pensando en cumplir un sueño de comprar una vivienda propia para vivir tranquilamente con sus hijas y por ello el capital requerido lo invertirá en materia prima para realizar sus artesanías. 

La principal dificultad es encontrar personal en temporada alta pues este conocimiento y tipo de trabajo es poco visto.
texts.en:
Angela has a colorful personality with a lot of spirit. She is 52 years old and she takes care of her two daughters who are 18 and 22 years old. She has been a single mother since she separated from her husband. 

She makes a living by making miscellaneous things like coasters, table decorations and other crafts that she learned how to make from a friend. 

With the help of this loan, Angela will improve her sales and expand her market to more people and stores. 

Angela wants to stimulate her business so she can achieve her dream of buying her own home and living there with her daughters. But to get there, she needs to invest money in purchasing more supplies for her crafts. 

The main problem she has is finding additional workers to help her because it is not common for someone to have this kind of knowledge and these kind of skills.

loans.use: purchase material like plastics, glue and more for her crafts.

loans.name: Yeny Alexandra

texts.es:
Un pequeño préstamo es lo que necesita Yeny para impulsar su negocio de venta de productos de consumos y uso personal, un pequeño apoyo para surtir su negocio que inicio por necesidad económica y por falta de oportunidades laborales y más pensando en su hija. 

Gracias a un amigo monto su negocio la apoyo y la oriento, Yeny es muy responsable trabaja diariamente 10 horas por día pues tiene la determinación de sacar su negocio adelante, mejorar sus venta, aumentar, sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, sostener el negocio y tiene la fe de poder hacerlo tiene la fe de que algún día comprara una vivienda propia, tiene la fe de que las condiciones de su vivienda cambiaran.

El crédito será invertido en surtido en general como talco para pies y cuerpo, desodorantes, copos para los oídos, papel higiénico, pañales, protectores, algodón, crema dental gel, jabón, barnice, etc. Etc. Etc.
texts.en:
Yeny needs a small loan to boost her business selling personal products. This will provide support to stock her business, which she started due to a financial need and a lack of opportunities, thinking of her daughter.

Thanks to a friend who guided and supported her, Yeny started up her business. She is very responsible and works for 10 hours per day. She is determined to move forward with her business, improve her sales, increase her clientele and utility, and sustain her business. She has faith that she can do so, she has faith that one day she will buy her own house, and she has faith that her living conditions will change.

She will use this loan to stock her business with products such as foot and body powder, deodorants, headphones, toilet paper, diapers, protectors, cotton, toothpaste, soap, varnish, etc.

loans.use: to buy personal products, such as creams and lotions, for her business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, domicilio en la Caserío Culpón del distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. La cual es una zona rural. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Wilson se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 04 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desera realizar la compra de cuyes, patos, gallina, pavos, para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales; el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de hacer crecer su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson, 29, is single and has no children under his care. He lives in his family's house in the village of Culpón in the Nueva Arica district, which is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. It is a rural area. His community is basically dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Wilson has made a living raising and selling farm animals for four years. His business is located in his home. He is applying for a loan to increase his working capital. He would like to buy guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, and turkeys to increase and diversify his livestock. This loan will help him to make a better investment with the goal of growing his business and satisfying his clients' demand. In a short period of time, this will allow him to improve his income, increase his profits, and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to increase and diversify his livestock.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell for her business.

Nelly has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of liquors for her business.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Nancy, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 28 years old, is married and has 4 children. Nancy has been a farmer for 5 years and is often referred to as a very hard-working individual.

Nancy isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has learnt a lot from farming training since joining. This year, Nancy will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during the dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Nancy's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor and hand tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is from Labuyo, Tangub City. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family. He has always been known to provide the best for his family. Gideon has been earning a living in his retail business for the past years. 

To generate more income, Gideon decided to expand his resources after he learned that he could obtain financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, he has requested a loan to restock his store inventory to increase sales and meet customers' needs. Gideon smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family with a better life.

loans.use: to restock his store inventory to increase sales and meet customers' needs

loans.name: Al- Atheer* Group

texts.en:
This group is named Al- Atheer*. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are applying for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

Wafa is 27 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She is an educated woman who has received an elementary education. Wafa lives with her family in a rented house in a poor area of Sana'a. 

Wafa cooks on a very old stove that doesn't work well. The stove is not efficient and consumes a large amount of gas, which costs Wafa a lot of money every week. Wafa wants to replace her stove with a new one, but doesn't have enough money. Therefore, she will use her loan of 25,000 YER from AMB to purchase a new stove for her house.

Wafa looks forward to having her own house.

loans.use: to purchase a new stove for her house

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer from Furana village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Musa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing at harvest-time thus reducing pressure to sell maize at low prices.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta has been preparing and selling a variety of snacks in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years, earning well to add to her husband's income for the family. Vicenta has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional ingredients to cater for orders and demand this season. She plans to use the additional revenue that this will generate to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to cater for orders and demand this season

loans.name: Adriana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Adriana una humilde tendera del sector de Medellín que viene hoy a solicitar un crédito pues muestra gran preocupación por la incursión de los diferentes supermercados en los barrios y que poco a poco van arrebatando clientes disminuyendo su utilidad pues no pueden competir con los bajos costos de estos. 

Adriana es una madre de dos hijas, ella busca que sus muchachas puedan ingresar al estudio para ello necesita aumentar su utilidad pues en este momento sus ingresos no son suficientes por ello solicitara un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido de la canasta familiar en general, granos, abarrotes, víveres, bebidas, granos etc. 

Esta ayuda le permitirá tener buenos precios de los productos, tener variedad de productos y poder competir con los demás negocios.
texts.en:
Adriana is a humble storekeeper in the area of Medellin, who comes today to ask for a loan, as she is very worried about the incursion of different supermarkets in the neighborhoods. Little by little they take away her clients, decreasing her profits, because she cannot compete with their low prices.
Adriana is the mother of two daughters. She wants her girls to be able to attend school, therefore she needs to increase her profits. At the moment, her income is not enough, which is why she will ask for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of stock of general staple goods, grains, groceries, food, drinks, etc. 
This help will allow her to have good prices for her products, to have variety, and be able to compete with other businesses.

loans.use: to buy stock of general staple goods, grains, groceries, food, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Liên is 44 years old and she is married with one child. She lives  in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to build a new house, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru:
Робия 28 летняя жительница района Дангара. Она мать одиночка. У Робии двое детей, близняшки. Дочке и сыночку 4 года. Робия с детьми живет в родительском доме вместе с мамой, двумя братьями и женой брата. 
   Робия имеет среднее специальное образование, но в течение 6 лет занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды. Она берет заказы на шитье на дому. Для нее такая работа очень удобная. Робия может следить за детьми и работать одновременно. На данный момент ей необходимо купить новую швейную машинку, из-за неисправленной технической проблемой с нынешний машинкой. На новую машинку не хватает средств, и она вынуждена обратиться за кредитом, чтобы сохранить деятельность.
texts.en:
Robiya is a 28 year old resident of the Dangara region. She is a single mother. She has two children, who are twins. Her daughter and son are four years old. Robiya and her children live in her childhood home together with her mother, two brothers and one of the brother's wife. 

Robiya has vocational education, however for six years she has worked with sewing women's national clothing. She takes orders for sewing at home. This work is convenient for her. She is able to look after the children and work at the same time. 

Currently, Robiya needs to purchase a new sewing machine, due to technical problems with her existing one, which cannot be repaired. She does not have enough money for the new sewing machine, and she needs to applie for a loan in order to keep her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 34 years old and has three children.  She is married and has two children who are in school.

For the past sixteen years, Marivic has been in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Marivic has serviced nine prior NWTF loans to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира является 24-летним пекарем, проживающим в районе Б.Гафурова. Это один из самых больших районов в городе Худжанд. Шоира живет там вместе с мужем, двумя маленькими детьми и свекровью. Ее муж занимается предоставлением услуги мастера по ремонту домов. Сама Шоира на протяжении 3,5 года работает в пекарне. Она идет на работу каждый день с раннего утра и остается там до позднего вечера. Шоира печет национальные лепешки на тануре и это ремесло ей передано от матери. Она любит свое дело и работает с удовольствием. Единственная трудность в ее работе - это транспорт. Из-за того, что она поздно заканчивает свою работу, она с трудом добирается до дома на транспорте. Поэтому Шоира решила приобрести себе автомобиль, чтобы решить эту проблему. На сумму кредита она собирается купить легковую машину. Благодаря данному кредиту она сомжет продолжать свою работу без трудностей. Шоира надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Shoira is a 24 year old baker, who lives in the B. Gafurov district. This is one of the largest districts in the city of Khujand. Shoira lives there together with her husband, two small children and mother-in-law. Her husband provides a master carpenter service, renovating houses. 

Shoira has worked at a bakery for a period of 3.5 years. She goes to work from early morning and stays there to late evening every day. Shoira bakes national flatbread in a special bread oven (tanur), which she learnt from her mother. She loves her work and works happily. 

The only difficulty with Shoira's work is the transport. Due to the fact that she finishes work late, it is hard for her to get home with public transport. Therefore, she decided to purchase a vehicle, in order to solve the issue. She has decided to purchase a small car with the loan amount. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to continue her work without difficulties. Shoira hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 25 year old, single lady from a village near Nablus city. She lives with her parents and brothers in a simple house. Her father works as a construction worker where he gets an unstable income due to demand. 

Rawan studied law and she has a BA degree but she could not find a job in this field due to the bad economic conditions. She loves photography and she would like to become a professional in the future.

Rawan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new camera to start her photography business. By taking this loan, Rawan will be able to achieve her dreams and also work to help her family.

Rawan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new camera to start her photography business.

loans.name: Janechit

texts.en:
Janechit, owns a guso (seaweed) production business in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been in this business for the last ten years.  During good seasons, she can generate more income. 

Janechit is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 frm PMPC to finance the purchase of guso seedlings and other production materials.  She is very grateful for the help that the cooperative is extending her.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and materials for guso (seaweed)

loans.name: Manuel Eusebio

texts.es:
Manuel, un hombre de 39 años de edad lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Apartadó y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos aprendiendo de este negocio de manera empírica.

Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y tres  hijos menores de edad.

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 2 años con el fin de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para reformar su galpón, su principal dificultad es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Manuel!
texts.en:
Manuel, a 39-year-old man full of dreams and aspirations for his life, lives in a farm in the town of Apartado. He makes a living with the production and sale of chickens and hens, learning about this business in an empirical manner. With this work he tries to support his family, made up of his wife and three sons who are minors. 

It is an occupation that he has been practicing for approximately 2 years with the goal of getting ahead and improving the living conditions of his family.
He is asking for financial support to buy chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials to restore his shed. His main difficulty is the lack of money to invest in his business. With this loan, he will be able to have a more sustainable and established business. 

With a loan that you make today you can improve the life and business of Manuel!

loans.use: to buy chickens and laying hens for his business

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Ее зовут Назира. Ей 44 года. Назира гордо носит статус жены и мамы. Она очень добрая вежливая и гостеприимная домохозяйка. Назира более 5 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она любит свою работу и хочет развиваться в данном направлении. Причина, по которой Назира обратилась за кредитом, является ремонт дома. Она собирается купить стройматериалы, чтобы отремонтировать дом в скором времени. Для нее ремонт жилища является больше чем необходимость. Она надеется на Вашу отзывчивость. Назира боится, что их дом может не выдержать холода. Помогите Назире.
texts.en:
This woman is called Nazira. She is 44 years old. Nazira proudly carries the status of wife and mother. She is a good, polite and welcoming house wife. Nazira has worked with sewing women's clothing on order for more than five years. She loves her work and would like to develop in this direction.

The reason why Nazira applied for a loan in the renovation of her house. she decided to purchase building materials in order to renovate her house shortly. For her, renovating her home is more than necessary. She hopes for your sympathy.

Nazira is scared that their house will not keep the cold out. Please help her.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for renovating her house

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra has a motorcycle transport business where she generates family income. She is 60 years old, married with four children. 

Because she needs to maintain the good condition of her motorcycle, she borrows money from PMPC amounting to PHP 6,000. This will serve as a great help for her, especially for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle parts for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Угулой мать одиночка в возрасте 43 лет. У нее единственный сын в возрасте 22 лет. Он помогает маме в ее деятельности. Угулой занимается продажей женской одежды и галош. В торговой деятельностью она занята уже 7 лет свой жизни. Она хочет работать в данном направлении и ей нравиться общаться с новыми людьми. Угулой решила расширить деятельность и привести товар зимней одежды, но для совершения покупки и привозки нового товара ей не хватает денег и Угулой обратилась за кредитом, потому что считает, что это единственный выход, для реализации ее плана. Вы можете поддержать Угулой. Она верит в Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Uguloy is a single mother of the age of 43. She has one son who is 22 years old. He helps his mother with her business. Uguloy works with selling women's clothing and shoes. She has worked in retail sales for seven years. She wants to work in this area and she likes to meet new people. 

Uguloy decided to expand her business and bring in winter clothing, however she does not have enough money to make this purchase and import new goods. Uguloy applied for a loan because she reckons this is the only way to realize her plans. You can help Uguloy. She believes in your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase and import winter clothing to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell  for her general store business.

Maricel has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from buy-and-sell rice grains and charcoal.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
Maria, a sus 66 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 

A pesar de las adversidades que tuvo que enfrentar por la movilidad en su sector, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante, gracias a ello lleva 3 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.

Maria manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle sostenibilidad a su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Maria, at her 66 years of age, is a charismatic and helpful woman who is dedicated to working in her own store, a grocery store that she started because of the need to generate income in order to get her family ahead.  Despite the adversities that she had to face due to mobility in her area, she had the strength and determination to lift herself up and move forward.  As a result, she has 3 years of experience in this business.

Her goal in life is to continue to progress and for this reason she wants to strengthen her business by purchasing an assortment of products like groceries, grains, fried foods, soft drinks and some general basic staples.  In this way she will be able to offer her customers better quality and service, managing to significantly increase her sales and the income that she receives from them. 

Maria states that her greatest desire is to give her business sustainability and in the future she wants to turn it into a supermarket, in which the customers can find all of the items that they need and in this way increase its profitability.  She also wants to be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

By supporting this loan you will be contributing to the business ventures of Colombian women!

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of groceries and foods for her store.

loans.name: Frank's Group

texts.en:
"Frank," pictured above, has been a farmer for twenty years. He is 60 years old, married, and has seven children. He is proud to represent his group of sixteen farmers from the Kakamega South District. 

Frank likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. Since 2012, he has been working alongside One Acre Fund. He decided to represent his group because he wanted to become more active in his community. Being a part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he enjoys a healthier life because of better nutrition. Frank plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

Frank’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.75 acres of land. Some group members will be using their loans to purchase solar lights and this loan will finance the purchase of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvest

loans.name: Horongna Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe HORONGNA ont en moyenne 56 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et des céréales. 
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe HORONGNA sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. CHATA, 1ère femme de la droite vers la gauche ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 Kg de riz, 100 Kg de mil, 50 Kg de maïs, 40Kg de fonio et 20 Kg de haricot. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Horongna group are all women averaging 56 years of age, with five children. They all live in traditional expanded families in Bla, Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).The group members know each other as relatives. They work buying and reselling cereals and miscellaneous items.

After having duly repaid their prior loans, the group members are on their fourth solidarity loan. Chata, the first from right to left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 100 kg -220 lbs] of rice, 100 kg of millet, 50 kg [110 lbs] of corn, 40 kg [88 lbs] of fonio [a staple African  grain] and 20 kg [44 lbs] of beans. She stocks up locally and in the nearby villages sells. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit.

She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 45,000 West African francs, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees, with the remainder reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products [for resale].

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Roselyn is 36 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Roselyn has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Roselyn has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Samit Mauricio

texts.es:
Samit es un hombre de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

El monto un café internet desde hace 6 años y vende alternativamente algunos elementos de papelería en el mismo negocio.

El tiene 36 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar un equipo de cómputo y un aire acondicionado para mejorar su local y por ende mejorar sus ventas.

Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y comprar su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Samit is a man with good ideas and a creative mind, always trying to find ways to increase his family's income.

He set up an internet cafe 6 years ago and also sells some paper products in his business.

He's 36 years old and is ready to face whatever challenges life has in store.

He's requesting financial support to purchase a computer and an air conditioner to improve his shop and thus boost his sales.

With this money he'll make an investment in his business and attract more clients, and change his revenue for the better.

His biggest dream is to have a great internet cafe with good income and to purchase a home.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and an air conditioner for his shop.

loans.name: Joraqul

texts.ru:
Чоракул  родился 1971 года. Он  женат и имеет 3х детей. Его жену зовут Салтанат, она домохозяйка. Он очень трудолюбивый мужчина любит семью и старается для благополучия своей семьи. Хотя  у него есть высшее образование, но он работает не по своей профессии. Он занимается куплей и продажей скота. В этом ему помогает его друг. Также для дополнительного дохода он занимается куплей продажей грецких орехов, от которых он имеет 400-500 сомони дохода в месяц. Он хочет получить кредит на покупку и откорм скота. В дальнейшем он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить доход от этого. 
Чоракул заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Joraqul was born in 1971. He is married and has three children. His wife is called Saltanat. She is a house wife. Joraqul is a very hardworking man. He loves his family and strives for their well-being. 

Even if Joraqul has higher education, he does not work in this profession. He works with animal sales. One of his friends helps him with this. As an additional income, he also works with selling walnuts, from which he gets 400-500 somoni in income per month. 

Joraqul would like to get a loan to purchase and feed cattle. In the future, he would like to expand his business and get more income from it. Joraqul thanks MDO Arvand in advance for the help.

loans.use: to purchase and feed cattle

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna is 26 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is school-going age. 

To support her family, Sokna grows rice. Moreover, she earns extra income as a construction worker. This is Sokna's first loan with Kiva partner, VisionFund. She will spend her entire loan to buy a horse, which will be used to transport her rice to sell. 

She hopes to earn more income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a horse to transport her rice to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sonia Marisol

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer muy emprendedora que siempre ha luchado por su familia, es soltera porque desde muy joven ha trabajado para apoyar a sus padres y hermanos, de quienes se siente orgullosa porque están saliendo adelante. Actualmente está trabajando como ayudante de venta de pollo asado y cree que le está yendo bien por su dedicación, esfuerzo y porque es muy amable con los clientes. 
Sonia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una nueva cocina para su casa y así reemplazar la que ahora tiene que ya es un poco antigua y es peligros, con esto su familia estará más segura y tendrá mayor bienestar. Así Sonia seguirá luchando para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos y más adelante poder construir su casa propia
texts.en:
Sonia is a very enterprising woman who has always fought for her family.  She is single because since she was very young she has worked to help her parents and siblings and she feels very proud of them because they are getting ahead.  She is currently working as an assistant selling roast chicken and she believes that it is going well for her because of her dedication, efforts and because she is very nice to customers.

Sonia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support that they have provided her she will be able to buy a new stove for her house and thus replace the one that she has now which is already a little old and is dangerous.  With this her family will be safer and have greater well-being.  Sonia will continue struggling to improve the quality of life of her loved ones and to be able to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new stove to replace the one in her house.

loans.name: Never Danilo

texts.es:
30 años de experiencia hablan por sí solos de la calidad, no solo del servicio, sino también del trabajo que desempeña Never en su cerrajería, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su larga trayectoria.

Es un hombre muy trabajador e inicio este negocio por gusto y vocación, aparte de ser una fuente de ingresos para la educación de sus hijos.

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de hierro y laminas de acero con las cuales podrá abastecer su negocio con materia prima y así permitir la sostenibilidad de su negocio y el aumento de sus ventas.

Es padre de 4 hijos menores de edad, los cuales los tuvo con su actual esposa; su familia le ha servido como fuente de inspiración y fortaleza para sacar su negocio adelante y espera seguir con su actividad ofertando sus servicios de cerrajero a todo aquel que lo necesite.
texts.en:
30 years of experience speak for themselves, as to the quality of not just the service but also the work that Never performs in his locksmith shop. He's famous in his neighborhood for his long career. 

He's a very hard-working man and he started this business for both pleasure and as a calling, in addition to being a source of income to provide for his children's education. 

For this reason he's requesting a loan to purchase iron and steel plates so he can stock his business with raw materials, thus sustaining his business and increasing his sales. 

He's a father of four minor children, which he had with his current wife; his family has been a source of strength and motivation to keep his business going and he hopes to continue offering his locksmith services to anyone that needs them.

loans.use: To purchase metal and steel plates.

loans.name: Esmelinda

texts.es:
Esmelinda tiene 47 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente. Tiene casa propia, cuenta con servicios públicos de agua y luz. Esmelinda vive en el caserío Franco Alto. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno y caprino y a la agricultura. Y está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Esmelinda es la crianza de animales menores, tales como pavos, gallinas y cerdos, además de realizar la venta de la de pollo, pescado y chicha de jora. Actividad que realiza en su domicilio, además de recorrer en los caserios aledaños como Franco Bajo, Zapotal, Talanquera y otros. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra harina por quintales para su chicha y engordará sus animales y aves para esta navidad. Se referencio Esmelinda y es bien visto en la comunidad donde vive.
texts.en:
Esmelinda is 47 years old and she has a common law marriage.  She has her own house with public water and electricity.  Esmelinda lives in the village of Franco Alto, where the people raise beef cattle and goats, and work in agriculture.  It is located in the district and province of Morropón, in the Piura Region of Peru’s northern coast.

Esmelinda raises small animals such as turkeys, hens, and pigs.  In addition, she sells chicken, seafood, and chicha de jora (traditional corn beer) from her home, and in adjacent villages such as Franco Bajo, Zapotal, Talanquera, and others.

The loan will be used for the purchase of flour by the quintal (weight measure equivalent to about 46 kilograms) for making her chicha; and she will fatten her animals and birds for Christmas.  

Esmelinda has good references and she is well regarded in her community.

loans.use: to purchase flour for making her chicha (traditional beer), and to fatten her animals and birds for Christmas.

loans.name: Kasongodde Twegatte Farmers' Group

texts.en:
Edirisa owns a produce business where he sells beans. He is a hardworking man who is married with four children. Edirisa lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started his business in order to support his family and also does commercial farming to supplement his income. Edirisa’s business complaints include limited capital, price fluctuations, and impassable roads during the rainy season.

Edirisa is requesting a loan to buy beans to sell. In the future, he has a vision of building a permanent home and buying a motorcycle to aid him in transporting his produce.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a variety of products to sell, like rice, oil, onions, beans, fish, meat, chicken, beer and drinks.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thủy is 22 years old and married with one child. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past three years, Thủy has operated a food stall where she sells meat. Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2013 to improve her business and she has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy’s main hardship in her life is not having an hygienic latrine.

Thủy is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet. In the future, she hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
Senhora Virginia, tem 43 anos de idade, casada e mãe de seis filhos, frenquentando ensino primário e secundário, é professora, vive em casa própria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante do empréstimo será aplicado para a compra de varrões, blocos, pedra, para construir casa de banho e iniciar a ampliação da sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir murro de vedação do seu terreno.
O baixo salário deixa a vida dela dificel, pois as suas despesas são maiores, assim sendo luta para superar essas dificuldades para garantir um futuro melhor.
texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old and is married with 6 children, all of whom are in elementary or high school. She works as a teacher, lives in her own home with her family, and is not financially responsible for anyone besides her family.

With this loan Virginia would like to begin construction of a bathroom and home addition project by buying blocks, metal bars, and stone. In the future she would like to build a wall around her property for privacy.

Her low salary makes life difficult for Virginia, as she has many everyday expenses, so it is always a struggle to overcome these difficulties to guarantee a better future for her family.

loans.use: buy blocks, metal bars, and stone to build a bathroom and expand her house.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past 24 years, she has operated a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. Victoria is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has successfully repaid her previous loan.

Victoria is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials such as nail polish, nail cutters, nippers, and other items for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials such as nail polish and nail cutters for her business

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 40 years old. He lives in a rented house with his wife and their five children, ages 21, 11, 7, 5 and a 3-month-old baby. Maurice runs his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Lusaka, Zambia. The business is his only source of income.

Maurice has been running his money transfer business since 2012. He attributes the growth of his business to the financial assistance he has been getting from Kiva. Maurice got his first loan in April 2012, which helped him to expand his business by opening up two more outlets in Lusaka. Maurice got a second Kiva loan, which he used to add to his working capital. This greatly helped his business, as he was able to serve customers much faster. The steady growth in Maurice’s business has enabled him to employ seven people, including his 21-year-old son. Maurice says he uses the profits from his business to pay for his children’s school fees, ensure that they always have good uniforms to wear to school, and provide for their day-to-day basic needs. He hopes to make more money so that providing for his family can become much easier.

Maurice is requesting a subsequent loan, which he will use to continue to grow his existing business. This loan will be used to add to his working capital, so that he can successfully serve more customers who are looking to send and receive money from his three trading booths across Lusaka. Being able to serve more customers will bring Maurice additional profits that he can use to improve the lives of his children and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to add to his working capital, so that he can successfully serve more customers who are looking to send and receive money from his three trading booths across Lusaka.

loans.name: Rawya

texts.en:
Rawya is a 46-year-old married mother of five children who six years ago started selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Rawya is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to the upcoming Christmas to satisfy her customers' needs.

Rawya hopes to expand her business more in the future and open her own clothes shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
My name is Bernard, age 46. I’ve run my own mobile money transfer business with Zoona since September 2013. I have managed to open five outlets within a space of one year in Kasama, Zambia’s Northern Province.

I am the breadwinner for my family, which includes my two children and two other dependents that I am responsible for. All my children and dependents go to school and I pay their school fees through the income generated from my mobile transfer business. The benefits derived from the business are several, as my community gets served effectively and quickly, youths are being employed as tellers, who in turn manage to pay for their tertiary education. To date, I have employed nine tellers. With all this happening, I have been motivated to expand my business so that more communities could be served and employment created. This is why I am applying for a third Kiva loan to help me achieve my goals

loans.use: to expand my business by providing a safe way to send and receive money through my shops.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên works in agriculture farming food. Liên is 31 years old and she is married with three children. Liên lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase brick, sand, and cement to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 25 years old. He runs his own local mobile money transfer business. He describes his business as simply the sending and receiving of money electronically, with the use of a mobile phone.

Currently, Jonathan does not have enough working capital. He is not able to serve customers who want to send large amounts of money. This saddens him, as he has to turn away customers and lose out on valuable commissions. He is therefore requesting for a Kiva loan so that he can grow his capital base and serve more customers. He would also like to make an outright purchase for the trading booth, which he is currently using to serve his customers. Jonathan believes that his community benefits from his business because he offers them an easy and quick way of sending money and he works hard to give them the excellent customer service. He is constantly growing the number of transactions he does in a day. 

Jonathan describes his life as difficult. He is quick to say that he has not had it easy in life due to losing his father at a young age. He has not been able to pursue his education, he left school in seventh grade as he did not have anyone to pay for his school fees. He is however grateful for the opportunity he has to run his own business and therefore gives it all he can. 

Jonathan's appeal to his lenders is that they help him raise the money so that he can let his customers send larger amounts of money so that he can earn more commission. He has dreams of opening more mobile money outlets in the Chipata compound. He is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to ensure that he never has to turn away customers by increasing his working capital and purchasing a Zoona-branded trading booth.

loans.name: Chileshe

texts.en:
Chileshe is 26 years old. He earns his living by providing mobile money transfers in the capital city of Zambia, Lusaka. He lives in a rented house with his brothers and sisters. He comes from a family of eight.

Chileshe's days are spent serving customers and running up and down to the bank so that he can satisfy his customers. He has employed one person to help him at his shop, so when he is at the bank, his teller remains at the shop, serving customers. Chileshe started running this shop six months ago. Business is good and he says the one thing holding him back is that he does not have enough working capital to serve his customers at their time of need. He says this causes him distress. This situation becomes worse when the bank closes as he cannot send any working capital that he has to the bank to convert it to cash. 

Chileshe is taking out this loan so that he can increase his working capital and serve more customers conveniently. Serving more customers will mean he will be able to earn more profits. He is very excited about the future prospects of growing his business.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and purchase a  trading booth to ensure he never has to turn away customers.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Alba desea iniciar con un negocio de venta de mercancía variada ya que siente que es una actividad que le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, además de ser una actividad que le gusta.

Esta idea surge a partir de la motivación que le dieron sus hijos, lo que la impulsa para montar este negocio y así generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 

Aunque ella siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de mercancía como sombrillas, acolchados y algo de ropa para vender.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
With the hope of getting ahead and improving herself, Alba wants to start her own business of selling  an assortment of products as she feels that this will allow her to improve her housing conditions and it is an activity that she likes. 

This idea has come from the motivation that her children have given her which is pushing her to start up this business so she can create the necessary income to maintain her home.

Although she has always wanted to be independent, she has never had the courage to risk starting a business. However now she feels strong enough and able to do it.

She is asking for a loan to buy a range of products to sell, such as beach umbrellas, cushions and some clothes. 

With these things she will be able to start this project and will therefore be able to fulfil her dream of being independent.

With this loan you will be launching the entrepreneurial ideas of a Columbian mother!

loans.use: to buy a range of products to sell, such as beach umbrellas, cushions and some clothes.

loans.name: Silvan

texts.en:
Silvan, a 40-year-old man, has been selling fruit in the marketplace to make a living. He has three children living with him. He successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used for buying more fruit to resell.

Silvan is now taking a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more fruit to resell and to buy new tires for his motorcycle, which he uses for transportation services. He also uses this vehicle in purchasing fresh fruit to sell.  His plan is to eventually buy a motorcycle to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell and to buy new tires for his motorcycle

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. She has a small sari-sari, or retail, store where she sells various goods to the people in her area. She has been in this business for more than two years now.

Janet is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, etc. This loan will help her increase her stock, allowing her to cater to more buyers in her store. In the future, Janet wants to invest more in her store so that it will generate more revenue. She also wants to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Soạn

texts.en:
Soạn has a retail business selling incense and ghost money (Joss paper). She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Soạn is 61 years old and married with five children. Soạn lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Soạn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. With her business profits, Soạn hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Xuân

texts.en:
Xuân works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Xuân is 37 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her life is not having a biogas system. 

Xuân is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to build a biogas system. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to build a biogas system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build his house of quality materials.

loans.name: Yurany Andrea

texts.es:
Yunay una mujer de 31 años de edad, muy dedicada al trabaja y al hogar, es madre de un hijo de 12 años de edad y desde el año 2013 se dedica a atender un negocio de papelería. 

Pensando en la temporada navideña, y la temporada escolar quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido desde extensiones navideños, adornos navideños, hasta diferente material para estudiantes. 

Para ella esta temporada es muy importante pues en ella recibe los ingresos suficientes para comprar los traídos a su hijo y es un motivo más para trabajar, hacer que su hijo sonría con un obsequio que se lo trae “santa claus”.

Este crédito la ayuda a mantener su negocio y estar a la vanguardia de las temporadas que se avecinan.
texts.en:
Yunay, a 31 year old woman, is very dedicated to work and her home.  She is a mother of a 12 year old son.  Since 2013 she has run a stationery store.

Thinking of the Christmas season, and the school year, she is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of things from Christmas lights, Christmas ornaments, to different materials for students.

For her, this season is very important since in it she receives enough income to buy what she needs for her son and it is another motive to work.  She does it to make her son smile with a gift that "Santa Claus" brings him.

This loan helps her to maintain her business and to stay ahead of the seasons that are coming.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of things from Christmas lights, Christmas ornaments, to different merchandise for students.

loans.name: Quyền

texts.en:
Quyền works in agriculture, farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Quyền is 54 years old and married with four children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Quyền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Quyền faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. Quyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a 31-year-old, married woman living in Madaba. Shireen is selling blankets from her home to help support her family. Her main challenge is how to promote for her business, as it is now built on word of mouth from friends and neighbors.

Shireen is applying for this loan to increase the quantity of blankets she has, as we are entering the winter season during which there will be high demand for these products.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of blankets, as we are entering the winter season during which there will be high demand for these products.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana grows and harvests rice. She is married with four children. Her husband works with her and they get up early to go to the fields, where she has to oversee their farm as well as her crops. Susana is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she wants to improve the yield from her farm.  In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now, and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, since she wants to improve her farm yields

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture, farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Liên is 57 years old and married with three children.
Liên lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Liên faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. With her business profits, Liên hopes to build a new house, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old and widowed with nine children. With one child still in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years. She sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, noodles, candies, biscuits, detergent soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, etc. 

Virginia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aigul

texts.en:
Aigul is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia in the Department of Sociology. Here is her story:

“I live with my mother and grandmother in my grandmother’s house. My mother has been unemployed since 2003 due to her disease and she gets a small sick benefit. My grandmother is 65 and a pensioner, so their income is not enough to live and pay for my university’s tuition fees.

I am an Alumna of AUCA’s New Generation Academy in the 2013-2014 academic year. I was lucky to be among 70 students whose study costs were covered by the donor-partner of AUCA.  New Generation Academy opened my eyes and showed me a new life of education and international atmosphere. I was able to finish this program successfully and pass AUCA’s entering exams. I don’t want to lose this opportunity because of a lack of money and kindly ask for Kiva lenders’ help.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Aileen has been in this business for 15 years now.

Aileen requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 45-year-old married mother of two children. She started working in a grocery shop to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Salam is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Mamjoua, to expand her business by buying a car, which will facilitate her work and allow her to transport the goods to her shop easily.

Salam is a hardworking woman who is trying hard to satisfy her family's increasing living costs. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Taborak

texts.en:
Taborak is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is married and her husband is a migrant in Russia. They have three children they love very much. She lives together with her children in an old house.

Taborak sells a variety of fabrics. She stores her fabric in a local market. She acquires her goods in shopping centers in the city and makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. Taborak began working this way over 20 years ago because she needed to earn money.

This is Taborak's first loan with IMON. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 somoni to buy fabric for increasing her working capital. She is grateful for this financial support to help her to realize her plans and she awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabric for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. Hà is 30 years old and married with three children. Hà lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa FPW. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. Hà hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 28 years old and married. She does livestock trading, which she has been doing for the past four years. Her spouse also provides additional income to support the family and together they have been blessed with three children. 

Lucy has requested a loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more cattle to sell. She will use the anticipated income to improve her business. This is her first loan and she hopes to expand her business and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Thủy is 49 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thủy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris manages a business selling used clothing in her community to make living. She is married and has two children. Doris successfully repaid her previous loan used for her business. 

Doris took a new loan recently to purchase bundles of used shoes and bags to sell. She is hopeful she will gain more profit from her investments and plans to save a portion of it for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA ont en moyenne 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
