Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des habits et du savon. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. FATOUMATA, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 pièces de Wax, 4 pièces d’unit Wax, 2 pièces de Wax réal et 5Metres de Bazin. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes et souvent à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the  Kotognogotala group are all women averaging 34 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional expanded families in Bla, Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). The group members know each other as relatives. They work buying and reselling   miscellaneous items, clothing and soap.After having duly repaid their prior loan, the group members are on their second solidarity loan. 

Fatoumata, the first one standing from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy various types of traditional colorful fabric: three sets of wax-printed fabric, four  single-unit wax-prints, two sets of "real wax" prints and five meters  [5.5 yards] of damask-type "bazin" fabric. She stocks up locally from wholesalers and often in Bamako. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit.

She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees, with the remainder reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing [for sale].

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca  has been running a general store for over seven years, earning a good living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to boost her store income. She had to find ways to earn more. With this, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods, livestock feeds and rice to sell in addition to her stock.  She hopes to improve her business, and have a stable income for a better living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods, livestock feeds and rice to sell in addition to her stock.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Zenaida is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of the videoke machine and to pay the electric bills for her videoke machine rental business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine and to pay the electric bills of her business

loans.name: Fredys

texts.es: Fredys de 54 años de edad se dedica a la reparación y pintura d emuebles para el hogar desde hace 30 años, pues desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de pintura de muebles y poco a poco fue perfeccionando su trabajo con estudios y experiencia y contratado para pintar miebles para el hogar. Hoy ofrece sus servicios a crédito y de contado a mayoristas, trabajando de lunes a domingos, desd ela s8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche comprando a crédito a mayoristas,   para venderle a sus clientes fijos, mediante precios competitivos. Su meta mas adelante es abrir su propio taller brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y su mayor desafio es el insufieinte capital de trabajo, raón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un compresor, con esta inversión su negocio mejorará porque contará con una herramienta importante para aumentar la calidad de su trabajo  y esto es justamente lo que hace exitoso un credikiva.
texts.en:
Fredys, age 54, has been repairing and painting household furniture for 30 years.  He learned this work when he was very young, gradually perfecting his skill with study and experience, until he was hired to paint household furniture. 

Today he offers his services on credit and for cash to wholesalers.  He works from Monday to Sunday, from 8:00 in the morning until 7:00 in the evening, buying on credit from wholesalers in order to sell to his regular customers at competitive prices. 

His goal for the future is to open his own workshop, and to provide his family with a better quality of life.  His biggest challenge is insufficient working capital.  

This is the reason that he is seeking a Kiva loan, his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to purchase a compressor.  His business will improve with this investment, as he will have a tool that is important for increasing the quality of his work, making his Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Allyn

texts.en:
Allyn is 33 years old and married with two children who are in school. Allyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a direct selling Natasha and Avon products in the Philippines and requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Allyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future Allyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Hernan De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernán un hombre que lleva desde principios de los años noventa ejerciendo independientemente la profesión de reparaciones eléctricas, y que aún sigue en pie con ese negocio, ya como un hombre casado con una hija de 24 años de edad, que aprendió de su negocio gracias a unas capacitaciones y clases que tomo,  quiere solicitar un crédito con la intensión de lograr la sostenibilidad de su negocio, aumentar sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas, diversificar su oferta.

Lo hará invirtiendo en la compra de equipos que estén malos, los cuales reparara y venderé a un bajo precio para que personas escasas de recursos puedan  acceder a ciertos “artilugios”  que comúnmente no pueden comprar.

Tu puedes ayudar a este ya veterano de 59 años de edad con un préstamo que invertirá sabiamente en el fortalecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Hernán has been working independently since the early 90s. He works in electronics repair and still continues with this business. He is married and has a 24-year-old daughter. He learned this type of business by through training classes.

This loan will help Hernán to make his business more sustainable, since he will be able to grow his client base, improve his sales, and diversify his products. He will buy electrical appliances in bad condition and then repair and sell them at low prices. In doing this, low-income families will gain access to appliances they normally would not be able to buy.

A loan will help this 59-year-old to wisely invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances in poor condition so that he can repair and sell them.

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en:
Waheed is a 23-year-old single man from Nablus city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. His father works as a construction worker and gets a low and unstable income. 

Waheed is a student who studies Press and Media. He loves this field and he dreams to find a job and work as a journalist.

Waheed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a camera for his studies. By taking this loan, Waheed will be able to do his homework using the camera. Waheed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a camera for his studies

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe NIETA ont en moyenne 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, du poisson et des condiments. 
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. M’PERE,  femme debout au milieu sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 pièces de Wax, 5 pièces d’unit Wax, 15 Mètres de Bazin et 15 Mètres de tissus légers. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes et souvent à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Nieta group are all women averaging 41 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Bla, Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). The group members know each other as relatives. They work buying and reselling   miscellaneous items, fish and condiments. After having duly repaid their prior loans, the group members are on their fourth solidarity loan. 

M'Pere, the  one standing in the middle of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy various types of traditional colorful fabric: five sets of wax-printed fabric, five single units of wax-prints,  15 meters [16.5 yards] of damask-type "bazin" fabric and 15 meters of lightweight fabric. She stocks up locally from wholesalers and often in Bamako. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit.

She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 45,000 West African francs, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees, with the remainder reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing [for resale].

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth inicio la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, hace 3 años atrás, actividad aprendida gracias a que una amiga le enseño todo. 

Buscó esta actividad como una alternativa de generar dinero y obtener el sustento para su hogar conformado por su hijo de 11 años y su esposo. 

Debido al costo de vida que se presenta en Colombia, Yaneth se ve en la necesidad de generar un mayor volumen de ingresos, es así como pide un apoyo económico que la ayude a mejorar la variedad de productos que exhibe y que diariamente ofrece a sus clientes y a personas puerta a puerta. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa en diferentes marcas para abastecer su negocio.

Su principal sueño es poder convertirse en la propietaria de un almacén y poder tener un local fijo.

El negocio de Yaneth Necesita tu ayuda para salir adelante y progresar!
texts.en:
Yaneth started her clothing business as a street vendor three years ago.  She learned the work thanks to a friend who taught her everything.  She saw this job as an alternative for earning an income and getting support for her household, comprised of her 11-year-old son and her husband.

Because of the cost of living in Colombia, Yaneth needs to earn more income.  That's why she's requesting economic support to help her improve the variety of products she displays and sells daily to her customers and to people door-to-door.

She's requesting a loan to buy a supply of different brands of clothing to stock her business.

Her main dream is to be able to become the owner of a department store and have a fixed retail space.

Yaneth's business needs your help to get ahead and make progress!

loans.use: to buy a supply of different brands of clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Jefferson Steven

texts.es:
Jefferson un joven de 20 años de edad con aspiraciones, deseos de superación, ganas de salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida, es un hombre soltero que vive con sus padres, no tiene hijos pero si una gran responsabilidad y es a través de su negocio de venta de calzado, generar los ingresos suficientes para pagarse su universidad siendo sus compañeros sus principales clientes. 

A través de un crédito  quiere crecer y tener mayor variedad de mercancía, su sueño no es solo generar ingresos para estudiar él quiere tener un local, comprar una casa y tú puedes ayudar a este joven a seguir estudiando y trabajar pro realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jefferson is a young 20-year-old man with aspirations and dreams of moving himself ahead and of making something of his life. He is single and lives with his parents. He does not have any children.

Jefferson has a large amount of responsibility in his business selling footwear. Through this work, he generates sufficient income to pay for university, and his peers are his main customers.

Through this loan, he hopes to grow his stock and have a greater variety of merchandise. His dream is not only to make a profit so that he can continue studying, but also to own a store and buy a house.

A loan helps this young man to continue studying and working so that he can achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 67 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries. Mercedes has been in this business for 18 years.

In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. He is 49 years old and is married with two children. Thanh lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thanh faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom.

Thanh hopes to maintain a successful business, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom

loans.name: Kiloko

texts.en:
Kiloko is now 55 years old. She used her previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of cereals to sell, and it was profitable. She is also a farmer, and from the sale of the farm produce she is able to provide for her family’s needs. 

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her farming, to make more income and to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is a 64-year-old woman, who in addition to her business selling firewood, is engaged in another business selling groceries in her retail store. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying firewood to sell. To offer more to her customers, she took a new loan to buy more variety of grocery goods to sell in her store.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more variety of grocery goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es:
El cultivo y venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Carlos, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio.

El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 6 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días.

El decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, optó por esta actividad.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

El pide un auxilio económico para comprar abono para sus tierras y poder mejorar sus productos.

Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilamente sus alimentos sin necesidad de transportarlos por toda la ciudad.
texts.en:
Carlos works growing and selling fruits and vegetables. He is a man with a lot of perserverance to move himself forward in his business. He has made a living through this work for more than six years. He begins work very early in the morning every day.

Carlos decided to start this project because he needed to earn more income to support his family. He did not have the education necessary to get another job, and so he elected to go into this line of work. He is a kind man and is always ready to attend to the needs and wishes of his customers. 

Carlos is requesting a loan to pay for fertilizer for his lands so that he can improve his crops. His dream is to have a store where he can sell his food products so that he does not need to transport them to the city each day.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and irrigation so that he can maintain his lands.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Beatrice, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. She is 28 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has three children.

Beatrice is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to earn enough to feed her family, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Beatrice says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has had more profits from each harvest. This has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Beatrice will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of seven solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 9.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Ofelia De Jesus

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Ofelia, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus 5 hijos, vive en el municipio de Medellín, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de comidas rápidas en un pequeño carro de comidas.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su puesto de trabajo porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Ofelia ha decidido mejorar su negocio y es por esta razón que acude a un préstamo para comprar unas ruedas, un parasol e ingredientes para sus preparaciones.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.
Su principal dificultad son las épocas en las que sus ventas disminuyen.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Humble and hardworking – that’s Ofelia.  She is a real fighter of a woman who has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her 5 children.  She lives in the city of Medellín, where she earns a living preparing fast food in a small food cart.  Her food is well known by the neighbors in the area, who visit her food stand because they know that they will be able to eat delicious food there.

Ofelia has decided to improve her business.  For this reason she has come for a loan to buy some wheels, an umbrella and ingredients for her food preparations.  This loan will allow her to move forward with her business and thus obtain the needed income that will give her the opportunity to continue supporting her family and her business.  Her main difficulty is when sales decrease.

Support this woman with a loan and help make her dreams come true!

loans.use: to purchase some wheels, an umbrella and ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Lourdes raises goats to earn a living. Her husband is a farmer.

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy additional goats to raise and to buy materials for the repair of the goat house like wood and nails. This will loan will help Lourdes in improving her livestock business.

In the future, Lourdes hopes to make her business more sustainable and profitable. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional goats to raise and to buy materials for the repair of the goat house like wood and nails

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en:
Joshua is a 54-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Joshua has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Joshua described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and seeds, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Joshua’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8 acres of land and to purchase a total of 16 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and to purchase cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.ru:
Наимчон уроженец города Истаравшан. Ему 30 лет. Он женат и отец 3-их детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и заботливый отец.  По профессии он повар. 
 Наимчон обратился в МДО Арванд за потребительским кредитом. Он хочет купить автомобиль, но у него не хватает своих средств. 
Наимчон благодарит   МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Naimjon is a native of Istravshan. He is 30 years old. He is married and the father of three children. He is very hard working and a caring father. He is a cook.

Naimjon applied to MDO Arvand for a loan. He wants to buy a car, but he does not have the means.

Naimjon thanks MDO Arvand for your support and trust.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita, 43, is married with two children and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. Charita owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting coconuts and corn to earn a living. 

She earns a good income from her farm that she uses for the education costs of her children. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer and a new variety of seedlings to improve her farm yield. Her previous loan used for their farm has been repaid successfully. 

In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and a new variety of seedlings to improve her farm yield

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Medelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a direct sales business selling Avon and Natasha products in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Medelyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her Avon and Natasha direct sales business.

Medelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase incense materials such as cans, perfumes and other things to make the local incense and to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru:
Санавбар жительница  кишлака Эшонкургон, ей 33 года, замужем, мать 3-их детей. С детства её учили труду, своим трудом зарабатывает себе на жизнь и для своей семьи.  Она швея, берёт заказы на дому  для пошива национальных платьев. Её клиенты  довольны её работой.  Также она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Муж ей помогает в этом. Занимаясь животноводством хочет получить  доход для будущего своих детей. Этим своим трудом хочет принести доход для своей семьи  
Она обратилась в МДО Арванд  за  кредитом  для покупки скота. Она заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Sanavbar lives in the village of Eshonkurgon. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has been learning her trade since childhood, and with her trade she supports herself and her family. She is a seamstress. She takes custom orders for sewing traditional dresses. Her clients are satisfied with her work. She also works in animal husbandry and agriculture. Her husband helps her in this. By working with animals, she would like to earn enough to ensure her children's future. She wants to, through her hard work, bring in more income for her family.

She appealed to MDO Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. She thanks you for your support and trust.

loans.use: buy cattle.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.ru:
Наимчон мужчина в возрасте 42  лет.  Женат и имеет троих  детей. Наимчон работает мастером по ремонту дома.   Его жена  работает в магазине. Они обе очень трудолюбивые и заботливые родители.  
 Наимчон  хочет сделать ремонт  своего дома. Он хочет купить строительные материалы  для ремонта. Но ему не хватает средств.  Он обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом.  Заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Naimjon is a 42-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Naimjon renovates homes. His wife works in a store. They're both very hard working and caring parents.

Naimjon wants to repair his home. He wants to buy construction materials for the renovation, but he does not have enough money. He appealed to MDO Arvand for a loan. Thank you in advance for your support.

loans.use: buy building materials.

loans.name: Kholiqnazar

texts.ru:
Холикназар с малых лет занимался земледелием и животноводством, и вот сейчас  в свои 24 года он  женат и имеет одного ребенка. Занимаясь этим видом деятельности он приносит   доход в семью. Скот это не основной источник дохода  его семьи. Он занимается земледелием и зарабатывает с свободное мастером.
 Советуясь с семьей он обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом для расширения животноводства. Развивая свою деятельность он может принести больше дохода и прибыли в семью. Но для этого у него не хватало своих собственных средств.
Холикназар заранее благодарит  за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
From an early age, Kholiqnazarov has been working in farming and animal husbandry. Now at the age of 24, he is married and has one child. He has been supporting his family with his work. Livestock is not the family's primary, rather it is farming, since he is very skilled.

After talking it over with his family, he turned to MDO Arvand for a loan to expand his livestock. By developing his business, he can bring in more money for his family. However, he does not have enough money to do that. Kholiqnazarov thanks you for your support and trust.

loans.use: buy cattle.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. The eldest is 11 and the youngest is one. Leny runs a small variety store in her place. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place.

Leny is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as rice, noodles, soap, detergents, canned goods, toiletries, condiments and other items. This loan will enable her to increase her stock, which will attract more buyers to her store.

In the future, Leny hopes to make her business more successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as  rice, noodles, soap, detergents, canned goods, toiletries, condiments and other items

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is composed of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District and is represented by Mary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 32 years old, is married and has four children. Mary has been a farmer for 11 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Mary isn't new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that her life has changed; she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Mary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition because now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Mary's Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvest of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new and stylish clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Liệu

texts.en:
Mrs. Liệu works in agriculture, farming food. Liệu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Liệu is 47 years old and she is married with two children. Liệu lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Liệu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Liệu faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to build a biogas system.

In the future, Liệu hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to maintain a successful business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to a build biogas system.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан приятная в общение женщина. Она замужем. Ее муж с двумя сыновьями находиться за приделами страны на заработках. Гулшан с 15 летней дочкой живет на районе Шахритус. Дочь учиться в школе, а Гулшан арендует точку на рынке и занимается продажей детской одежды и обуви. В основном ей помогает ее дочь, после занятий. Гулшану нравиться работать в торговой сфере и надеется, что ее бизнес будет расширяться и приносить больше дохода. Гулшан обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести новый товар на перепродажу. Она привезет зимнюю одежду. Ей не хватает средств для реализации покупки и вся ее надежда на Вас.
texts.en:
Gulshan is a very pleasant women to talk to. She is married. Her husband and two sons are working abroad. Gulshan and her 15-year-old daughter live in Shakhritus. Her daughter goes to school, and Gulshan rents a spot in the market where she sells children's clothing and shoes.

Her daughter usually helps her after school. Gulshan enjoys working in retail and hopes her business will expand and bring in more income. Gulshan asked for a loan to buy new goods to sell. She is bring in winter clothes. She doesn't have enough money for this, and is putting all of her hopes on you.

loans.use: pay for winter clothes to resell and shipping charges.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 56 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, chips, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, chips, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elifazi

texts.en:
52-year-old Elifazi is an energetic married man with 5 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

Elifazi's main business is cattle fattening along with milk sales, which he does for additional income. He started his cattle business with the goal of not just meeting his family's needs but also being able to provide his children with an education. 

Elifazi's business dream is trading his cattle at the city. He also dreams of his children attaining university degrees. However, he complains of unpredictable weather changes, especially prolonged dry seasons, which are leading to limited pastures. 

Elifazi will use his loan to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Beatrice, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 30 years old, is married and has four children. Beatrice has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Beatrice isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Beatrice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Beatrice's Group will purchase a total of 14 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Henry Gaspar

texts.es: Antes de estudiar derecho Henry se desempeñaba en áreas parecidas esta es la razón por lo que escogió estudiar la carrera para obtener mayores conocimientos y poder aplicarlos en su trabajo. Henry tiene 56 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos que están en edad escolar. Es propietario de un Cyber el cual le ha ayudado a obtener mejores ingresos para su familia. En este momento Henry solicita el crédito para el pago de su titulación. Este crédito le será de mucho beneficio ya que podrá obtener su título y mejorara sus condiciones de vida. Dentro de sus planes futuros está poner su propia oficina.
texts.en:
Before he studied law, Henry worked in similar areas.  That's why he chose the field, to acquire a broader knowledge and be able to apply it in his work.

Henry's 56 years old and married, and he has two school-age children.  He owns an Internet cafe, which has helped him earn a better income for his family.  

Henry's requesting this loan to pay to register his degree.  This loan will be a big help to him because he'll be able to get his degree and improve his living conditions.

Among his plans for the future is setting up his own office.

loans.use: to pay to register his degree

loans.name: Shaiyrbu

texts.ru: Шайырбу, 58 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. Образование-средне-специальное, работает на авто-заправочной станции, также на протяжении 8 лет занимается животноводством. Ежемесячный доход на сегодняшний день составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Шайырбу, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 4 коровы, 2 теленка, 15 овец и 5 коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 105,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Шайырбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также она хочет купить земельный участок.
texts.en: Shaiyrba is 58 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has a vocational education. She works at a gas station. SHe also has more than eight years experience in animal husbandry. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she has a good farm: four cows, two calves, fifteen sheep, and five goats. In order to further develop her business, she has asked for a loan of 105,000 KGS from the bank Bai-Tushum in order to buy calves to fatten and sell. Shaiyrba plans to use profits from the loan to increase her livestock and eventually to buy land.

loans.use: purchase additional bull-calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan works in agriculture, raising both poultry and cattle. She is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoá province in Vietnam.

In 2014, Loan joined Thanh Hoá Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has already successfully borrowed and repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoá Fund for Poor Women.

Loan has been involved in her agriculture business for more than 10 years. The main hardship she faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to be able to build a toilet .

Loan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks in order to build a toilet.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
A Yolanda desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía por catálogo pues era responsable de sostener a sus padres y necesitaba generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (perfumería, ropa, accesorios, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Yolanda manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y poder realizar adecuaciones a su vivienda.

Haz que los sueños de Yolanda Se hagan realidad con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Yolanda has always liked to work as an independent merchant.  She began selling merchandise through catalogues because she was responsible for supporting her parents and she needed to generate the income to do so.

Her customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends in the area.  She works alone every day, and finds that, in her job, she has the advantage of being able to be available for her family at the same time she's able to be productive as a merchant.

Currently she's requesting a loan to buy perfume, clothing, accessories, and other stock wholesale.  This will allow her to stock up with a greater variety to satisfy demand, which grows during the Christmas season.  The result will be to earn more income for her family.

Yolanda said her greatest desire is to be able to keep on helping her family financially and to renovate her home.

Make Yolanda's dreams come true with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothing, accessories, and other stock wholesale

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
“When people come together, they are powerful,” says Musa, a 37-year-old farmer who has 3 children and lives in the village of Moiben in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. 

As a young man, Musa watched women in his village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led him to join Simotwo self-help group. For the past 10 years Musa has been actively involved in mixed farming. He loves passion fruit farming in particular. 

In rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere. Men do the heavy work on the farms, while their wives fetch water and carry firewood. However, this has not been a setback for Musa, who is not married yet has still managed to earn great profits with his farming. 

Kapsowar is one of the places that has favorable conditions for horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Musa has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but his biggest challenge has been a lack of funds to get the business started. So, Musa is requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. 

Through Simotwo self-help group - where members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan - Musa joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan, Musa intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers, and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow him to transport his produce faster to an international market, hence earning him more profits. 

This loan will improve Musa's living conditions and secure the future of his children.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Penelope

texts.en:
Penelope is 23 years old. She is a single mother running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business. The business is her only source of income and she is supporting her family through her Zoona mobile money transfer business. 

Penelope accessed her first Kiva loan in July 2014 and used it to purchase a trading booth and a mobile phone so she could operate and serve her customers. She is grateful to her Kiva lenders for her first loan as it helped her start her own business. She is happy with her business and is seeing it grow slowly, but steadily.

Penelope faces a challenge of not having enough money in her business to serve customers who need to send and receive larger amounts of money. She currently has a working capital of $1,500, which is not enough, as she constantly has to make trips to the bank to convert her monies from electronic to cash and vice versa.
  
Penelope is requesting her second Kiva loan so that she can boost her working capital to enable her to serve customers who need to transact larger amounts. Penelope is working hard to expand her money transfer business so she is able to provide well for her son.

loans.use: to boost her working capital to enable her to serve customers who need to transact larger amounts of money.

loans.name: Ricardo Ambrosio

texts.es:
Ricardo es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene planes de casarse y tener hijos más adelante por ello trabaja mucho para que a su familia no le falte nada. Actualmente está laborando en un grifo como atención al público, él cree que le está yendo bien por su dedicación, honestidad y amabilidad con los clientes. En sus tiempos libres ayuda a su novia en un pequeño negocio que tiene y a veces sale a jugar fútbol con sus amigos.
Ricardo quiere implementar su vivienda para su futura familia, es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para comprar algunos enseres y también para pintarrajear las paredes de su casa. él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, porque así su familia tendrá mucho bienestar y él continuará con su labor diaria mucho más tranquilo.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a very hardworking person. He has plans to get married and have children in the future. To do that he works a lot so his family will lack for nothing. Right now, he is working at a water tap serving the public. He believes that it is going well for him because of his dedication, honesty, and friendliness toward the customers. In his free time, he helps his girlfriend at a little business she has and sometimes he plays soccer with his friends. 

Ricardo wants to outfit his house for his future family. That is why he plans on using the loan to buy some items and also to daub the walls of the house. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity. This way, his family will have a lot of well being and he will continue with his daily labor with a lot more pace of mind.

loans.use: to buy some items for his house and to daub his walls.

loans.name: Luis Eleodoro

texts.es:
Luis Eleodoro tiene 49 de años edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijo quien estudia en colegio nacional de la zona. Luis Eleodoro es una persona con buenas referencias laborales y economicas. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Luis Eleodoro se dedica a la venta de pollo, desde hace aproximadamenete más de 6 años. Necesita préstamo para diversificar su negocio (compra de pollo, gallinas, patos), para la venta. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Eleodoro is 49 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his spouse and son, who goes to a public school in the area. Luis Eleodoro is a person who has good work and financial references. He is from a close family. He lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture and ranching. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, northern coast of  Peru.

Luis Eleodoro has sold chicken for more than 6 years. Luis needs the loan to diversify his business by buying chicken, hens and ducks to sell. This will allow him to improve his income in the short term, and increase his profits and therefore his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to diversify his business by buying chicken, hens and ducks to sell.

loans.name: Diyagaya Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his late 30's, is married with one child who is still in school.   He has been selling charcoal for one year now.  He works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to sell to more customers.  He dreams of owning a daladala (passenger vehicle).

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group, Diyagaya, which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a selection of beauty products and jewelry to increase his inventory and improve his sales.

loans.name: Zulfiyakhon

texts.en:
Zulfiyakhon was born in the year 1966. She is the careful mother of three children. Zulfiyakhon is a very hardworking woman. 

She has worked more than 14 years in a local market. She is a cleaning woman. Zulfiyakhon does her job well. She tries to help her husband to provide children with a good living standard. 

Now, she prepares to hold a wedding party for her daughter. She wants to present furniture to her daughter at her wedding party. With this aim Zulfiyakhon is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy furniture. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her daughter

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is a married women aged 38 years with four children who all attend school.

She lives in both town and a rural setting with her family and she deals in mobile money, a business she thought would help her to help her community to have easy access to mobile money and also earn her income. She also does agriculture to supplement this income.

She works five days in a week and 12 hours per day to maximize the income. She is optimistic by acquiring the loan that she will boost the business and ably meet the high demand of her customers.

Her future hope is to expand her business so as to increase her family income and her challenge is limited capital. She is an honest and hardworking woman who encourages lenders to continue helping small business entrepreneurs to help them pull out of poverty.

loans.use: to obtain float for mobile money

loans.name: Zhoomart

texts.en:
Zhoomart is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“I grew up without a father; my mother brought me and my sister up alone. As I remember, we always had felt the lack of money and used to save money on everything. At first my mother worked and had a little salary in Naryn village, where we lived. Days passed, we grew older and needed more money for daily necessities, which caused my mother’s departure to the neighboring country in search of a well-paid job. We were left to our relatives, who became our second parents and we still live with them on money that my mother sends.

In the 11th grade I heart about AUCA New Generation Academy, which gave an opportunity to study at this Program for free, as it was covered by its donor-partners. I understood that it was the only chance to study in the best university of Central Asia without paying a dollar. NGA program made me a confident person, who believes in his bright future and looks forward to overcome the difficulties with the help of education. My goal is to stand on my own feet and help to other families, who live in need; I know there are a lot of families like mine.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Duncan's Group

texts.en:
Duncan's Group is formed by nine farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Duncan, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 42 years old, is married and has four children. Duncan has been a farmer for six years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Duncan isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has learnt a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, Duncan will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Duncan's Group will purchase a total of 7 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Dương

texts.en:
Dương works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Dương is 29 years old and he is married with one child.
He lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Dương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business. Dương has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Dương has been involved in this business for more than ten years.
The main hardship that Dương faces in his life is not having hygeinic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet .

With his business profit, Dương hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver, aged 35, is a hardworking mother of five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has a retail business that is supplemented with commercial farming. She ventured in the above businesses in order to get income to educate her children and also cater to her family needs. She desires to expand her business to new markets despite the challenges of price fluctuations and inadequate capital. Oliver is requesting a loan to buy rubber sandals, commonly known as baggagawale, to sell.

loans.use: to buy rubber sandals, commonly known as baggagawale, to sell.

loans.name: Bình

texts.en:
Mrs.  Bình works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.  Bình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  She is 59 years old and is married with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007,  Bình joined  Kiva partner the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to improve her  business.  Bình has successfully repaid one previous loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that  Bình faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to build a biogas system.

With her business profit,  Bình hopes to maintain  a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase equipments to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Tới

texts.en:
Mrs. Tới works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Tới is 51 years old and she is married with three children.
She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Tới joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tới has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Tới has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

The main hardship that Tới faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet  .

With her business profit, Tới hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet  .

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 25 years old. She got her first Kiva loan a year ago and has grown her business by 100%. She finished paying off her loan in August of 2014 and accessed a second loan to increase her working capital. This would enable her to serve more customers by allowing them to send and receive money at her shop. She is making good repayments on the second loan.

Esther employees two young women at her shop. Today, Esther is taking out a third loan so that she can be able to finance a new outlet. She will use this loan as working capital to serve customers who come to send and receive money from her new shop. She will also be able to purchase a trading booth where she can serve her customers.

Esther believes her business is growing because she treats her employees right by giving them targets every month and giving them incentives on top of their monthly salaries. She says running a business is not easy, but if you treat people right, then they will take enough ownership and do their jobs right. When asked what she would like to say to the Kiva lenders, Esther says that the assistance from her lenders has changed her business. By increasing her working capital, Esther says she was able to serve more customers and earn more profits. The profits helped her to get back to school and take better care of her parents and her twin sister.

loans.use: To provide essential transaction funds to service her customers and purchase a Zoona branded trading booth

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by ten farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Lilian will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Lilian plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Lilian’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Mrs.  Thoa works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Thoa is 51 years old and she is married with three children.
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011,  Thoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  Thoa has successfully repaid one loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that  Thoa faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, and quipment, to build a toilet .

With her business profit,  Thoa hopes to maintain  a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick, and get equipment to build a toilet

loans.name: Esby

texts.en:
Esby runs a small mobile money transfer business in Lusaka, Zambia. He is 31 years old. He is married and has three children. His children are two, nine and twelve years old. His two older children go to school.

Esby was born in a family of eleven. He has four sisters and six brothers. He grew up in a village in Mpika, located in the Northern part of Zambia. Before Esby started running his own business, he worked as a shopkeeper from the time he was fifteen years old. He then left Mpika and started working as a security guard in Lusaka. While working as a guard, he saved up some money to start running his own business. He says he is happy to finally be able to be a business owner and offer his community a way of sending and receiving money that is easy, safe and affordable. 

When asked what challenges he faces in his business, he points to the fact that he does not have enough working capital to satisfy his customers. He goes on to explain that this is especially a challenge for him because his shop is not located close to the bank and transport is a problem. He is therefore requesting a Kiva loan so that he can increase his working capital. He will also purchase a small trading booth which he uses to serve customers.

Esby is hopeful that once he gets his Kiva loan, he will be able to serve more customers and earn more profits to help him provide for his family and see his children through high school and college.

loans.use: To purchase his trading booth and increase working capital so that he can serve more customers.

loans.name: Pjeter

texts.en:
Pjeter is 41 and married with three children, 17, 15 and 14 years old. Livestock and agriculture have been his source of earning for some time, yet he was qualified for a start-up loan from Kiva, and he’s been thrilled since. All in all, he’s got two dairy cows. He sells raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. He also owns some land, where he plants fodder and corn for animals and also cabbage that he sells. In addition to this, he’s got some chickens and ducks. Even though he’s got all these things going, he still falls below the poverty line of VisionFund Albania’s clientele criteria. 

The loan that Pjeter is requesting now will be used to open up a store in a close-by town. According to him, his income will increase up to 30-40%.

loans.use: to start up a little store in town to sell fresh fruits and veggies and other fresh products

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is a 51-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of seven farmers from Kakamega North district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, David has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

David described his harvest as good last year but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, David’s Group will be able to plant a total of four acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith has been selling and supplying peanut to manufacturing industries for 7 years and from the proceeds, she has been able to provide for the needs of her family. She is 34 years old, married and together with her spouse who also provides additional income, they have been blessed with 5 children. 

She has requested for her seventh loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy more peanuts for sell and supply. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

She paid her previous loans successfully and her future hopes are to open a factory to process peanut butter and also educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more peanut to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy, aged thirty three, is a single hardworking man living in Kyenjojo Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening a business he started seven years ago. He also does farming for additional income. 


jimmy ventured into this business to improve his standards of living. He dreams of becoming rich although he meets a challenge of unpredictable weather changes and limited capital. Jimmy needs a loan to buy cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening to sell

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is the resident of A.Jomi district. She is a young married woman and has 2 year old child. Manzura in the house of her husband started practicing animal husbandry. Three years as she grows cows and bulls for sale. Mother in law helps her in this activity. Manzura's husband seasonally goes to Russia to work.
Manzura now has only a couple of cattle in her barnyard. She would like to increase the livestock and for that purpose requested a loan. On the loan amount Manzura is going to buy dairy cow to increase the profitability of the business through the sale of milk. She hopes for your responsiveness.

loans.use: To purchase  a dairy cow

loans.name: Señor De La Misericordia De Surco Group

texts.es: El grupo “SEÑOR DE LA MISERICORDIA DE SURCO”  está conformada por socios dedicados a la agricultura y al comercio minorista. Buenaventura tiene 58 años de edad es soltera. Ella  se dedica al cultivo de frutas y flores que producen en la zona que radica. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más semillas de flores y frutas y el pago de los peones que le ayudaran en el cultivo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Buenaventura es la segunda persona parada del lado izquierdo viste chompa marrón.
texts.en:
The group “Señor de la misericordia de Surco” is made up of members dedicated to agriculture and retail trade. Buenaventura is 58 years old, and is single. She makes a living cultivating fruit and flowers that are produced in the zone that she lives in. 

The loan will be used to invest in buying more flower and fruit seeds, and to pay the workers that help her in the cultivation. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan they have provided. Buenaventura is the second person standing on the left side, wearing the brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy more flower and fruit seeds, and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Ana Gilma

texts.es: Ana tiene 32 años de edad es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee desde hace 2 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Ana está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 32 years old, and is a single mother who lives in her own home with her son. For 2 years she has had a small store located in her house. She has many customers due to her good prices and her kindness when she works. Ana is requesting a loan to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc. She will then be able to earn more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
"Pamela, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is 42 years old, a married mother of ten children, and she is often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Pamela has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Pamela wanted to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Pamela hopes to be able to save more money for the future.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights, as, even though Pamela decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candies, drinks, basic grains, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Milcent's Group

texts.en:
"Milcent, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 37 years old, is married and has seven children.

Milcent likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Milcent plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Milcent’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Sarhan

texts.en:
Sarhan is a 25-year-old married father of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, specially those who live in camps, he started five years ago selling coffee to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Sarhan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate his business by allowing him to transport his goods easily. This loan will help Sarhan improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport his goods

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 44 de años, es soltera vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hija quien estudia en colegio nacional de la zona. Elsa con buenas referencias. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Elsa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Desde hace aproximadamenete más de 10 años. Ella necesita préstamo para una compra de un número mayor de animales, así como alimento de engorde balanceado para los animales y arreglo de corral. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Elsa is 44 years old. She is not married but lives in her own home with her partner and her daughter, who is a student in the local college. Elsa has good references, and is part of a close family. She lives in a community where people work in commerce, agriculture and livestock. It is located in the Cayalti district, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. Elsa has worked for more than 10 years raising small animals. She needs a loan to buy more animals and nutritious food for the animals, and to repair her animal pen. This will allow her in the short term to earn more income, and thereby improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and nutritious food for the animals, and to repair her animal pen.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida tiene 36 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos desde hace 10 años. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Brigida se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (patos, cuyes, etc.) y además, su esposo se dedica al servicio mototaxi. Solciita crédito para invertir en compra de una cantidad mayor de animales para venta. De esta forma aumentar y diversificar su stock. Con ello tendrá mayores ventas y atención a clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Brigida is 36 years old, and has lived in her own home with her husband and children for 10 years. She is part of a close family. She lives in a community where people work in commerce, agriculture and livestock. It is located in the Cayalti district, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. Brigida works raising and selling small animals (ducks, guinea pigs, etc.). Her husband works providing motorcycle taxi service. She is requesting a loan to buy a larger number of animals to sell. In this way she can increase and diversify her stock. With this she will have better sales and provide better service to her customers. This will allow her in the short term to increase her income, and thereby improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to invest in increasing and diversifying her stock of animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder.

loans.name: Husenboy

texts.en:
Husenboy is 41 years old, he is married and has four children. 

Husenboy is a builder. He has provided services to local people as a builder for more than 15 years and has a great experience in this field. Husenboy is the only feed keeper of his family because his wife is a housewife and she has been busy with the up-bringing of their children. 

Husenboy, during some years, tries to repair his house as it is in bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy building materials such as cement, soil, etc. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his house

loans.name: Robert Jarly

texts.es:
Robert es un joven  muy trabajador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene un hijo pequeño quien es el principal motor de su vida para salir adelante, por ello día a día se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo como cocinero porque quiere brindarle todo lo mejor a su pequeño. En sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos y también cuidar a su hijo. Una de sus metas es poder iniciar su negocio propio y crecer como empresario.
Robert está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una lavadora para su casa, para que de esta manera su familia goce de mayor bienestar y salud, ya como está haciendo frío, al lavar la ropa a mano, se están enfermando. Con esto Robert estará brindando una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y continuará luchando para superarse cada día.
texts.en: Robert is a very hard-working young man with a great desire to get ahead. He has young son who provides his main motivation in life. He works hard every day as a cook, in order to provide the best for his little one. In his free time he likes to play soccer with this friends, and spend time with his son. One of his goals is to be able to start his own business and grow as a businessman. Robert is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with the loan that they are providing he will be able to buy a washing machine for his house. This is so that his family will be healthier, because it is now cold, and they are getting sick from hand-washing clothing. In this way, Roberto is providing a better quality of life for his family, and struggling to get ahead every day.

loans.use: to buy an electrical appliance for his house.

loans.name: Behije

texts.en:
Behije is in her early 60s and she wants to add some sheep to her existing herd with this loan. So far she has been planting and selling dried beans, corn, and wheat  in large quantities and planting fodder for her animals and broom straws to make brooms to sell, and also raising livestock, such as sheep and cows, and selling raw milk and baby animals. Her other income is her retirement and her husband’s. 

The village where Behije resides is known for its large quantities of delicious dried beans and red onions and is located across the national road Tirana-Korca, which makes it easy for villagers to sell their products to wholesale buyers; also some of the villagers set their booths along the road to sell the products to travelers and drivers.

loans.use: to add more sheep to her existing herd

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet David, 26 years of age, very young, hardworking and energetic. He hails from the Thika area of Kenya, an area that is blessed with good climatic conditions and favorable weather patterns that favor farming. David is still single and has been farming for the past three years. 

David was raised in a humble family, and he never got the opportunity to go to college because of lack of tuition fees. As a result, he has never had any formal employment but he didn’t surrender to that. He started farming, and through farming he has been able to take care of his parents. 

David's source of income is selling vegetables, milk, and eggs. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Thika area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why David is gratefully seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

David is very determined to succeed and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents. David's dream is to go back to school and he hopes that through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid as an old man of 53 years and lives with his children and wife. 

Rashid is involved in cattle rearing/fattening from his home area in a rural setting. He has been in this activity for over twenty-five-years and alongside that, Rashid is involved in cattle trade which majorly contributes to his sources of income.

According to him, through the above projects, Rashid has been able to buy land plus has also managed to take care of his family and sisters. Rashid is acquiring this loan to boost his cattle fattening business by buying young cows that he will feed on fodder and fatten for sale to a butcher business.

Rashid says his customers are basically people from his home area and traders. His biggest challenge is lack of enough capital to boost his businesses and bad weather.

Rashid is a hardworking man and thanks the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for the incredible work they are doing to improve people's standard of living through boosting their enterprises.

loans.use: to buy baby cows

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old single man from Deir El Balah. He lives alone in a simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. He lives in very poor conditions. He would like to improve his home and buy all the stuff he needs. 

Mohammad has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. This will provide him with hot water without using electricity. 

Mohammad appears in the photo in his home

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 29-year-old, single man from Deir El Balah. He lives alone in a simple house. Adham works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. He lives in very poor conditions. Adham would like to improve his home and buy all the stuff he needs. 

Adham has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. This will provide him with hot water without using electricity. 

Adham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y yuca, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controle de plagas, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been blurred is 26 years old, and lives in a high-risk area. He works growing basic grains and yucca, and sells his products in various markets near his house. He lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc., so that he can continue working and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y menor hijo. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Elvia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y también a la cría y venta de animales menores(chanchos) desde hace aproximadamente más de 05 años. El destino del préstamo es para compra de mercadería para bodega (arroz, azúcar, etc.). Esto le permitirá aumentar y dversificar su stock productos. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvia lives in her own home with her partner and youngest son. She has good personal references, and is from a united family. She lives in a community dedicated to trade, agriculture, and cattle raising. It is located in the Cayaltí district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru.

Elvia has made a living selling general groceries, and also raising and selling small animals (pigs) for approximately 5 years. The loan will be used to buy inventory for her store (rice, sugar, etc.). This will allow her to increase and diversify her stock of products, which will allow her to improve her revenues in the short term, increase her profits, and ultimately improve her quality of life and that of her family.
