loans.use: to buy inventory for her store.

loans.name: Kifayah

texts.en: Kifayah is a 52-year-old, married woman living in the sector called Jabal Al Hussien in Amman. Kifayah has a general store where she sells accessories in onr section and stationery items in another. She take shifts working at the shop with another member of the family. Kefaya is applying for this loan to buy more supplies and stationery items.

loans.use: to buy more supplies and stationery items for her store.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer from Rukku village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Samaila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thus reducing pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alfred's Group

texts.en:
Alfred is a 54-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of seven farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Alfred has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Alfred described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Alfred ’s Group will be able to plant a total of four acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 35-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He started seventeen years ago working as a DJ to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Due to the low financial and social situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, Tarek is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his house and make it a healthier place for his family.

Tarek hopes to expand his business more in the future by opening his own DJ shop to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en: Ishaya is a maize farmer from Galadima village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ishaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing at harvest, thus reducing pressure to sell corn for low prices.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 26-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his parents in a simple house. He works with his father in his quarry. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Naser took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. This will provide him with hot water without using electricity.

Naser appears in the photo in his home

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en: Hind is a 23-year-old, married woman who lives in Deiralla. Hind’s project started one year ago by selling accessories at home. Now she has a small store where she expanded to include selling home products besides accessories. Hind’s purpose of applying for the loan is to increase the quantity she has of accessories to increase her profit.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of accessories she is selling

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José Roberto tiene 33 de años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijas dependientes. José Roberto vive con su cónyugue y sus hijas. José Roberto vive en el caserío santa Rosa, en dicho dcaserío la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general, etc. Su comunidad está ubicado en el distrito de Sallique, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse.

José Roberto se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con terreno propio en dicho caserío, cuenta con una finca de lima frutera, la cual tiene una edad de 06 años, en muy buen estado, José Roberto cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, además cuenta con plantaciones de café variedad Catimor, su producción de lima la comercializa en su caserío o en el distrito de Piquijaca el cual se encuentra a pocos minutos, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, con solvencia moral y económica. José Roberto solicita crédito para poder invertir en el cuidado y mantenimiento de su finca, pues invirtiendo en su negocio y podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Roberto, 33, lives with his companion and has two dependent daughters.  He lives with his spouse and his daughters in the village of Santa Rosa.  The people there work in agriculture, with rice being the biggest crop, as well as in general commerce and so forth.  His community is located in the Sallique district of the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.  It's a medium-sized district that aspires to self-improvement.

José Roberto earns a living in agriculture and has more than 10 years of experience in that line of work.  He has his own plot of land in Santa Rosa and a farm with six-year-old lime tress in very good condition.  He also has coffee plants of the Catimor varietal.  He sells his lime crop in his community or in the district of Piquijaca, located a few minutes away.  He has very good personal and professional references, and is morally and financially solvent.

José Roberto's requesting the loan to be able to invest in taking care of and keeping up his farm.  By investing in his business he'll be able to earn an acceptable profit that will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to be able to invest in taking care of and keeping up his farm

loans.name: Bwizi Traders Group

texts.en:
Moses is a father of seven children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a tea a farmer and works hard maintaining the welfare of his children with proceeds from tea sales. 

He has school fees challenges and can never meet the payments on time without any financial support, as the proceeds from tea cannot allow him pay promptly. Moses found it necessary to seek credit to enable him to ease the burden. 

He is a member of a village bank where members guarantee one another to get a loan. He intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Pavlin

texts.en:
Pavlin is a cameraman/photographer by profession. He is 46 and a married father of two children. 

He’s been qualified for a startup loan from Kiva, and he is happy that this opportunity has been given to him, as per his statements.

Pavlin lives in a little town in northern Albania. Marriage and other events are part of the northern tradition culture. For almost every child who gets engaged and married there will be some sort of gathering/events. So far, to record and take pictures of those events, he’s been using old equipment that now is broken, and he wants to replace it. Pavlin goes to all the villages around except the town of his residence. In addition to this profession, he works in a gas station, and his wife works in a restaurant.

loans.use: to replace broken equipment he uses in his camera recording/photography profession

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is the group leader of her group in Kakamega North District, and she is representing 14 farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of three children. Catherine joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for more than 20 years.

Like many other farmers, Catherine decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

Catherine's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 8 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights, as, even though Catherine decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his products to the market.

loans.name: Danjel

texts.en:
Danjel is 31 and a married father of a 2-year-old. He wants to buy a dairy cow at the moment, and he needs your financial help to achieve this goal. 

The activity that he’s been pursuing in making an income is agriculture/livestock, and he has been doing okay with this, according to his statements.
 
Currently he’s got a dairy cow and about 4,000 meters of agricultural land where he plants fodder for animals and veggies for their family’s use. He sells the raw milk and the fodder to other villagers. In addition to the above activity, he receives a disability income for himself as well; he lived for long time in Italy, where during some physical type of work, he injured one of his legs that later became paralyzed. With some extensive treatments, he’s been doing better lately.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow; currently he's got only one

loans.name: Jesus Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jesus Del Carmen tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres, dedicada a la venta de refresco y al comercio de ropa, actividad que la realiza en el distrito de Pucara, así como también en el caserío de Chiple. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Jesus Del Carmen se dedica a Comercio de ropa y venta de refrescos, desde hace cuatro años en el distrito de Pucara. El Destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio de la compra de ropa para la comercialización por campaña navideña. Con lo que pretende incrementar sus ventas. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus Del Carmen is 27 years old, and lives in her parents home. She makes a living selling sodas and clothing. She performs her work in the Pucará district, and also in the village of Chiple. Her community is dedicated generally to agriculture, cattle raising, and trade. It is located in the Pucará district of the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

Jesus Del Carmen has made a living selling clothes and sodas for 4 years in the Pucará district. The loan will be used to invest in the business to buy clothes to sell in a Christmas campaign, with which she intends to increase her sales. This will allow her to improve her revenues in the short term, increase her profits, and ultimately improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in a Christmas campaign.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 27-year-old married man from a village near Jenin City. He lives with his wife and one small kid in a simple house. Thaer is a farmer where he has an agricultural land where he plants olive trees. He sells olive oil inside and outside the city. Thaer would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. 

Thaer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank. This will provide him with hot water without using electricity.
 
Thaer appears in the photo in his home

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a 52-year-old proud father of 12 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, John has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

John described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, John’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 17 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a 35-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Sarah has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Sarah described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Sarah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Magaji would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Magaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Magaji expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing at harvest, thus reducing pressure to sell corn for low prices.

loans.name: Nyame Nhyehyie Group

texts.en:
Isaac, aged 74, is a member of Nyame Nhyehyie Group. He is happily married with six children, the youngest of whom is still attending school. He lives with his family in Abura Koforidua in Central Region of Ghana. 

Isaac has been a farmer for the past 20 years and so has gained much experience. He grows oranges and cocoa on two separate farms. He belongs to a farming association that facilitates price negotiations and the marketing of the crops of members. While he is an enterprising and hardworking man, Isaac's age is making it hard for him to maintain the farms by himself. 

Isaac needs hired laborers to weed his farms, and needs to buy fertilizer and food fly traps, but there is the problem of how to finance that. Isaac needs microloan support to enable him to meet the financial needs of his farm in order to maximise crop yield and income. He will use his profits from the farms to pay for his last child's school fees and support his family. 

Isaac thanks all his microlenders for their generous assistance.

loans.use: to weed the farm, and buy fertilizer and food fly traps

loans.name: Kosi 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Kosi 2. It consists of three women from Hodeidah City, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Amna is the leader of the group. She is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of six children, living with her family in their own house. Amna works as a beautician inside her house with some equipment, accessories, makeup, and cosmetics. Amna has started her own business as a hobby. Over time, her business increased and she decided to continue in that business. In order to attract more customers, Amna applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more cosmetics and accessories to be able to attract a lot of customers.

Amna looks forward to expanding her business more through opening a beauty salon outside her house and providing it with all cosmetics and equipments.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and accessories for her customers and to be able to attract a lot of customers.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 10 años y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es independiente, constante, responsable, buena madre, optimista y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Calasaya’ es una comunidad indígena, situada en la zona altiplánica en sus orígenes fue una hacienda, adoptó este nombre porque, por el lugar de la comunidad existía una carretera, donde transitaban los viajeros y mercaderes con carrozas de Caballo del lado Peruano y trasladarse a la ciudad de La Paz, justo al lugar adyacente de la carretera estaba, una piedra situada verticalmente, donde los viajeros siempre descansaban en aquel lugar. Pues aquellos que hacían largos viajes decían en lengua aymara, ‘KALA SAIKY UKARU SAMARAÑANI’, traducido en castellano quiere decir "Descansemos donde aquella piedra que está situada verticalmente", Entonces se le fue conociendo como QALASAYA en lengua aymara, y en Castellano Calasaya.
Wilma es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, sombrero y pollera) su lengua materna es el aymará que utiliza en el pueblo, para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa de adobe que tiene electricidad. Su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal, y resumiendo el proceso que sigue es; con la leche de vaca que obtiene una parte a la mañana y otra a la tarde le agrega  el cuajo que se elabora extrayendo una parte de la ubre de la vaca, ésta comienza a hacerse parecida al yogurt, la mezcla con un cucharón de madera, luego se asienta, formándose la cuajada: la retira y la pone en otro recipiente para la maduración. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea incrementar su producción quesera mediante la compra de ganado lechero para generar mejores ingresos a fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Wilma solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para incrementar su producción de queso para fin de año.
texts.en:
Wilma, 28, is single and has a son, 10.  Her business is producing handmade cheese.  She's independent, tenacious, responsible, optimistic, hardworking, and a good mother.

She works in Calasaya, an indigenous community in the altiplano.  In the beginning Calasaya was a hacienda.  They adopted this name because there was a highway in the community where travelers and merchants with horses and carts from the Peruvian side would go to the city of La Paz.  Right on the side of the highway was a vertically placed stone where travelers would always rest.  People who were making long trips would say in Aymara, "Kala saiky ukaru samarañani," which translated into Spanish means "Descansemos donde aquella piedra que está situada verticalmente" 'Let's rest where that stone is placed vertically.'  So it became known as Qalasaya in Aymara, and Calasaya in Spanish.

Wilma is short and dark-skinned, and she wears her long black hair braided and traditional clothing (blanket, hat, and "pollera" skirt).  Her native language is Aymara, which she uses in the community; she speaks Spanish for business.  She lives with her son, who attends school.  They live in an adobe house that has electricity.

Wilma's business is making handcrafted cheese.  In summary, she follows this process: She gets cow's milk (part in the morning and part in the afternoon), and adds curd, which is made by extracting part of the udder of a cow, and the curd starts to resemble yogurt.  She mixes it with a wooden spoon, then it settles and makes the curd.  She removes it and places it in another container to ripen.

Wilma wants to increase her cheese production with the purchase of dairy cows to earn more income at the end of the year.  This is her first loan sequence with the institution in 15 years of working in this business.  For those reasons Wilma's requesting a loan to buy dairy cows to increase her cheese production for the end of the year.

Her dream is to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to increase her cheese production for the end of the year

loans.name: Loubna

texts.en:
Loubna is a 23-year-old married woman who started two years ago selling perfumes and clothes to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Loubna is a hard worker and has a good reputation among her region. 

Today, she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car, which will facilitate her work and help her in transporting the goods to her shop.
 
Loubna hopes to expand her business further in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Elsan

texts.en:
Elsan is 28 years old, married and has a son. Elsan is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region.  His wife is a housekeeper. He earns money raising and selling seasonal fruits at the local bazaar (apples, cherries, pears, etc.). He has been working in agriculture for five years and his monthly income is 200 AZN. He gets additional earnings by working in a tea café. 

Fruit growing is much expanded in Azerbaijan because people have a high demand for fruits. They like to eat them fresh or to use them in order to prepare fruit juice, jam and fruit cakes.
 
Elsan’s income doesn’t cover his family’s demands. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to supply new good fertilizers and repair his garden. This is his first loan. Please support Elsan.

loans.use: to supply new good fertilizers and repair his garden

loans.name: Samwel's Group

texts.en:
Samwel, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 50 years old, married and has six children.

Samwel likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Samwel plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Samwel’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests

loans.name: Awurade Akasa Farm Group

texts.en:
Ama is 37 years old and married with five children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. Her five children are all schooling. Ama lives at Egyirkrom in the Central Region of Ghana.  She is a farmer who has been in farming for the past 10 years. Ama has a 10-acre orange farm plantation. Ama used to maintain the farm alone but working on the large farm size is tearing on her health as it is physically too demanding. Ama needs financial assistance to pay for labour for weeding to supplement her own labour. She also has to increase her crop yield by buying fertilizer and food fly traps to improve the yield. Ama intends to use the income from the farm to expand it further, pay for the children's school fees and health insurance. Her main challenge now is finances. A micro loan will help Ama to achieve her dream. Ama and her entire group thanks all their micro lenders for their generous support. 

;

loans.use: To weed the farm, buy fertilizer and food fly traps

loans.name: Sabet's Group

texts.en:
Sabet is a 44-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of eight farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Sabet has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Sabet described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Sabet’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is 45 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Florence has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Florence also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Florence's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir recently started building an animal stable that is not done yet and wants to buy a dairy cow and finish off the stable; he doesn’t have any cows at the moment.

Vladimir is in his early 30’s and does agriculture to earn a living. He’s been planting seasonal veggies and has grapevines and plum trees, and some chickens also. Added to this, he works for pay in a nearby cow farm with 15 dairy cows. From that, he gets a monthly income of about $170 and also got the love for cows, as per his saying. “Taking care of cows increased my love for them, and now I want to have my own cow. How nice that is? “Vladimir said to the Branch Assistant who interviewed him.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, as he doesn't have one at the moment.

loans.name: Givan's Group

texts.en:
Givan is 44 years old and has five children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Givan has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Athough he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Givan also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Givan's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed lives in Marka. His business is to paint furniture. Raed started his project by self-funding. His main challenge is that he number of competitors is high, and winter weather does not help in the process of making painting fast, as it needs time to dry. He is applying for this loan to purchase supplies for the shop of paint and other items.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of paint and other items for the shop.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline is 40 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for 15 years and is always said to be a very hard-working individual. Even though Jackline is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by six farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Jackline started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Jackline’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of one solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Carmita Piedad

texts.es: Carmita es una sra de 42 años, soltera, no tiene hijos. Vive en Santo Domingo de los Colorados en casa de un hermano donde ahí tiene su local. Carmita hace 5 años cuenta con un bazar papelería, además realiza manualidades para vender y por esto es muy conocida en el barrio. Cuenta con su propia casa pero como no cuenta con el espacio para su negocio no ha podido ir a habitarla y ahora la tiene arrendada. Su sueño es con sus ingresos poco a poco ir mejorándola para ponerse su propio local. Es clienta de Fundación Alternativa desde el 2011, fiel  a la institución por el servicio que le dan. Carmita acudió para nuevamente ser favorecida con un crédito, ahora necesita por la temporada navideña ya desea surtir su negocio. La Fundación nuevamente le ayudó por ser una excelente clienta, Carmita está enormemente agradecida con Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Carmita is 42 years old, single and has no children. She lives in Santo Domingo de los Colorados, in a house that one of her brothers' owns and where she runs her own business. For five years Carmita has had a stationery shop. She also makes handicrafts to sell and is well-known in the local area for this work. Carmita owns her own house but does not have the space to install her business there and has not been able to move in; she is currently renting it out. Carmita's dream is to use her income to improve her house little by little and to use it for her business.

Carmita has been a customer at Fundación Alternativa since 2011. She is loyal to the organisation because of the service. Carmita has come back to Fundación Alternativa in order to apply for another loan. She needs it for the Christmas season: she wants to stock up her business. Fundación Alternativa is helping Carmita again as she in a great customer. Carmita is extremely grateful to Kiva for the help provided.

loans.use: to stock up her business and use her income to make improvements to her home and have her own premises and own place to live.

loans.name: Kalybek

texts.ru: Калыбек, 31 год, женат, отец 2 детей школьного возраста. У Калыбека среднее образование,в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, он занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав свою деятельность в 2004 году, на сегодня в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 10 овец, 3 лошади, 10 коз и 3 нетели. Хозяйство хорошее, зимой Калыбек содержит животных в сараях, летом выводит на пастбище. Также на земельном участке, он выращивает картофель для реализации. Он полон сил и энергии развивать свой бизнес и заниматься любимым делом, так как нужно содержать семью и воспитывать детей.  Сегодня ежемесячная прибыль Калыбека составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Он обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку четырех двухгодовалых бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Калыбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие его бизнеса и хочет накопить на постройку нового дома для его семьи.
texts.en: Kalybek is 31 years old, married and a father of two school-age children. Kalybek has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for his family, he is involved in animal husbandry and farming. Having started his business in 2004, today he has 3 cows, 10 sheep, 3 horses, 1 goats and 3 heifers. He has a good farm. In the winter, Kalybek keeps his livestock in barns and takes them to a pasture in the summer. He also grows potatoes for sale on his land plot. He is full of strength and energy to develop his business and be involved in a business he loves because he has to support his family and raise the children. Today, Kalybek's monthly profit amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). He requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy four two-year-old bulls for fattening up and resale. Kalybek plans to invest earnings from the loan into further developing his business and wants to save money to build a new house for his family.

loans.use: to buy four two-year-old bulls for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samson would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samson can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent more than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Samson expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure his children (Yunusa, Meshon and Mercy) are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing at harvest, thus reducing pressure to sell corn for low prices.

loans.name: Issmat

texts.en:
Issmat is a 44-year-old married mother of three children. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started a year ago selling chicken to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Issmat is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand her business through buying a new refrigerator which will help her freeze more chickens and thus satisfy her customers' increasing needs.

Issmat hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Glady's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Glady, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 4 children, known by her community as a very experienced farmer.

Initially, Gladys joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Gladys plans to send her children to school.

Among the 16 farmers in Glady's Group, a total of 8.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 52 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Rose has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rose also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone.

Obtaining this loan means that Rose 's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 48 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hard-working individual. Even though Beatrice is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Beatrice started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Beatrice’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy home furnishings for his family's well being.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To lay tile flooring in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 3 años al cultivo de pepino bajo riego, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito nuevamente para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que le ha ido muy bien.
texts.en: This young man's face is blurred because he lives in a high risk area.  For three years he has been growing low risk cucumbers which he sells at the different markets near his home.  He lives in his own house with his family and is requesting a new loan to buy the supplies he needs, such as: fertilizders, insecticides, herbicides and to improve the land shown in the photograph.  This is so he can continue his work which has gone very well for him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and improve his land.

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.fr: La cliente NSIMIRE est trésorière du groupe JIPE MOYO. Elle est mariée à un homme d'affaire et mère de 11 enfants scolarisés. Elle assure la vente des souliers depuis 1995 grâce au premier fonds de roulement reçu des mains de son mari.Le pret sollicité va lui permettre d’acheter 100 paires de souliers en vue de realiser son reve d’agrandir son entreprise et payer les frais scolaires des ses enfants. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux femmes à faibles revenus.
texts.en: The customer, Nsimire, is treasurer of the Jipe Moyo group. She is married to a businessman and is mother to 11 educated children. She has been selling shoes since 1995 having received her first working capital from her husband. The loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 100 pairs of shoes to help her achieve her dream of expanding her business and paying off her children's school fees. She is grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to women with low income.

loans.use: to buy 100 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KANOU ont en moyenne 43 ans, 7 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. 
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KANOU sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. SAFOURA, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  1 carton de biscuit, 1 carton de bonbon, 1 carton de savons, 1carton de Spaghetti et 15Kg de sucre. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kanou group average 43 years of age with seven children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Bla/Ségou (in the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). These women got to know each other through family links and have small businesses buying and selling a variety of products. Having repaid in full all their previous loans, the women of the Kanou group are on their fourth group loan.

Safoura, who is standing on the left of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy a carton of biscuits, a carton of candy, a carton of soaps, a carton of spaghetti and 15 kilos of sugar. She gets her supplies from local wholesalers and sells them to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credit. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000FCFA which will be used to cover health expenses, buy food, clothing and pay for school fees; the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile telephones and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy incense, perfumes, and henna for her business.

loans.name: Saramaya Group

texts.fr: Abibatou, femme battante est alphabétisée,mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle fait le commerce des céréales et fait des jus de fruit pour vendre. Abibatou et les autres membres prennent le crédit à ACFIME depuis 1 an et jusque là, elles sont à jour de leurs remboursements. Avec ce prêt, cette brave dame va acheter des sacs de vivre pour vendre. En plus de cela, elle va s'approvisionner en fruit et en sucre pour faire les jus. Le bénéfice lui permettra de renforcer son fond de roulement et aider son époux à gérer leur seul enfant.
texts.en: Abibatou is a courageous woman who is literate, married and mother to one child who is at school. She buys and sells cereals and makes fruit juices which she sells. Abibatou and the other members of the group have been borrowing from ACFIME for the past year and up until now have been on time with their repayments. With this loan, this good woman is going to buy sacks of food products to sell. Furthermore she is going to get fresh supplies of fruit and sugar to make juice. The profit she makes will enable her to boost her working capital and help her husband look after their only child.

loans.use: to buy cereals and fruits for making juice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make arabic bread.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is 50 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group made up of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Florence has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Florence also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Florence's Group will be able to receive a total of 11 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sussan's Group

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Susan is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Susan started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Susan’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia  Gladis  se sigue dedicando al negocio de panaderia, ella tiene una panaderia donde sigue preparando tortas y pasteles,  la socia ya tiene varios años en estos negocios, el sueño de la socia es ampliar la panaderia.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar harina, azúcar y manteca para que prepare el los pasteles y tortas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Gladis, continues working in her bakery business. She prepares cakes, desserts, and breads. She has already had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. She is asking for the loan in order to buy flour, sugar and lard so that she can make her pastries and cakes. 

Gladis is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and lard so that she can make her pastries and cakes.

loans.name: Getrude's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Getrude, who is a group leader and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 3 children, and she is known by her community as a very friendly person.

Getrude joined One Acre Fund in 2010, initially because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Getrude  plans to send her children to school.

Between the 11 farmers in Getrude's Group, a total of 5.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
Lucy is 55 years old and has 8 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Lucy has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Lucy also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Lucy's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 56-year-old married woman. She is expert in hand embroidery and has used her skill to provide for her family including 5 children, for many years. She started this work from a young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. 

Today she is proud to be famous in her community for the best embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns with thread and beads. She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase new beads, pearls, threads, needles and other necessary material used in embroidery. 

Kaneez is hopeful that this loan will help her to cater for more customers as females in her community are satisfied with her services.

loans.use: to purchase new beads, pearls, threads, needles and other necessary material used in embroidery.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda was born in the year 1975. She is a very hardworking and industrious woman. Mavjuda is not married and has not got any children. For many years she has worked in a kindergarden. She is a cleaning woman. Mavjuda does her job well. 

She has a small salary and it is not enough to have a good living standard. Now she needs financial support because she must treat her teeth. She has suffered from toothache for the last month. 

She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to treat her teeth. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To treat her teeth.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Mashakuru, Ibrahim and Yau.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Yahaya  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. He hopes eventually to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like food and clothing, and reducing the pressure to sell corn at low prices right after harvest.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 42 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Нургул средне-специальное образование, окончила педагогическое училище. Она получает ежемесячную прибыль в размере 8,000 сом (KGS). С 1994 года в качестве дополнительного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 лошади, 20 овец, 2 козы. На земельном надел Нургул выращивает пшеницу. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 лошади, 1 бычка и 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, а также она хочет накопить средства на покупку трех ярусной кровати для детей.
texts.en: Nurgul is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a specialized-secondary education and graduated from a teaching institution.  She makes a monthly income of 8,000 som (KGS).  Since 1994, she has been involved in agriculture, an activity which constitutes an additional source of income for her family.  She currently owns two cows, two horses, 20 sheep and two goats.  She also grows wheat on a plot of land.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase one horse, one young bull and ten sheep.  She plans to use the earnings from her loan to grow her business.  She also wants to save enough money to buy three bunk beds for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one horse, one young bull and 10 sheep in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran  is a 50-year-old, married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs and earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. 

Sughran  is a motivated mother of 4 children. For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity to cater for more customers without delay. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads and needles in a large quantity.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Paty, Kadiji and Sa'Idu. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Bala  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing at harvest, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул, 34 года, замужем, 4 детей школьного возраста. Образование у Назгул среднее. Успешно занимаясь животноводством, Назгул добилась очень хороших результатов, у нее есть 2 лошади, 6 коров и 4 овцы. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец. На прибыль от кредита она планирует увеличить своё хозяйство, и мечтает накопить средства на покупку компьютера для ее детей.
texts.en: Nazgul is 34 years old, married, and the mother of four school-aged children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education.  She successfully raises livestock and has achieved good results.  She currently owns two horses, six cows and four sheep.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of five sheep.  She plans to use her earnings from this loan to increase her farming activity.  She also dreams about saving enough money to buy a computer for her children.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his cocoa plantations.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Transito

texts.es:
Consuelo de 49 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 25 y 30 años de edad, cada una con hogar propio. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una parte por la situación económica y otra por la poca importancia que sus padres le dieron al estudio. Su esposo falleció hace casi dos años, por lo que vive sola.
Consuelo es comerciante, tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas, panes con pollo y bebidas, tiene un año trabajando de esta manera, ella es la encargada de hacer todos los preparativos de sus venta, se las arregló para conseguir un puesto en el mercado municipal y gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre es como se posiciono con la venta de su producto. Antes era ama de casa pero desde que murió su esposo tuvo que ingeniárselas para mantenerse. Todos los días camina desde su casa 1un kilometro para llegar a su trabajo y su horario es de 5:00 am a 2:00 pm y nadie más se involucra en su actividad.
El préstamo será utilizado para cancelar una deuda en una institución, quiere saldar ese compromiso a corto plazo y lo que le sobre lo invertirá en su negocio.

Consuelo pretende mejorar su negocio, pero por lo pronto cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 49, is a widow and has three children aged 20, 25 and 30 who live on their own. She could not study, in part due to financial issues, and in part because her parents did not think it was something important. Her husband died almost two years ago, which is why she lives alone.

Consuelo is a businesswoman. She sells pupusas [thick corn tortillas], chicken with bread and beverages. She has been doing this for a year and does everything on her own. She managed to get a stall at the local marketplace and built a reputation thanks to what her mother taught her. She used to work as a housewife, but she had to look for a way to make a living when her husband died. She walks around 1 km [0.6 miles] every day to go to work, and works from 05:00 am until 02:00 pm. She works alone.

She will use this loan to pay off a loan she has with an institution. She wants to settle this short term responsibility and invest what is left in her business. Consuelo wants to improve her business, but she wants to pay off her debts first.

loans.use: to pay off a debt she has with an institution.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 34-year-old married woman. She has a business selling dried fruits in her locality to earn an income. In this way, she is better able to handle her family's needs effectively. She is contentedly operating her business for the sake of her family, who appreciate and show respect for her efforts. 

Nazia is currently unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase stocks of peanuts, walnuts, and almonds. This investment will help her to increase her sales. Nazia dreams of providing a good lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of peanuts, walnuts, and almonds

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 47 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for some years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Jane also decided to purchase a solar light with part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анара, 40 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает в школе учителем киргизского языка и литературы. Анара в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи с 2009 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Анара на сегодняшний день имеет 1 дойную корову, 2 бычка и 5 овец. На ежедневной основе Анара реализует молоко, вкусное, экологически чистое и чрезвычайно полезное, оно пользуется большим спросом среди жителей. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 10,000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации домашнего молока. Доходы от кредита Анара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность в дальнейшем улучшить условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Anara is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a higher education and works in a school as a teacher of Kyrgyz language and literature.  Since 2009, she has also been involved in animal husbandry, in order to provide her family with an additional source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns one dairy cow, two young bulls and five sheep.  She sells a delicious organic milk on a daily basis, and since milk is so useful, she receives a high demand from the local residents.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS) from her entire activity.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy dairy cows in order to produce and sell more milk.  Anara is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further growing her business, which will enable her to continue to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows in order to produce more organic milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more variety to the products she sells like rice and frozen vegetables.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has 2 children.

With a portion of this loan, Grace will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Grace plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Grace’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this for many years and has become well known for providing good-quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 55-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Abida’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to cover the family's expenses. The rickshaw now requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. 

For this reason, Abida has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires along with some tools and spare parts for his vehicle. These will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Abida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires along with some tools and spare parts

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Daura village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing at harvest, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 34 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them on the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals

loans.name: Sajjda

texts.en:
Sajjda is 46 years old and is a widow woman. She has 4 children; one of her sons is shown in the photo. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Sajjda  has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her son. He wants to replace auto body parts and get new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Sajjda is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to replace auto body parts and get new tires.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson used his previous loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of retail goods such as sugar, rice and tea leaves to sell in his general store. It was profitable and this enabled him to provide for the needs of his family. 

He also has a grocery shop in Nairobi and has been running this business for 10 years. He is now 42 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with three children. 

Jackson will use this loan to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions to sell. He will be able to serve more customers and make more income. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family. 

Having paid his previous loans successfully, this will be his ninth loan from VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to expand his grocery business and live a happy life with his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fruits,vegetables and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia  is 25 years old, a married woman and a mother of 3 children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR  to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 22-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 2 children. Her husband has been doing a business selling and purchasing animals for many years. Rukhsana  fully supports and assists her husband with his work. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a smallholder farmer from the village of Kaplamai in the Nandihills area of Kenya. When you ask, he’ll tell you his most valuable asset is his two-quarters-of-an-acre farm. But it wasn’t always this way. 

For a long time, Shadrack’s farm couldn’t even sustain his family. In 2012, Shadrack heard about Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance institution that serves smallholder farmers. And from that day, life has never been the same. 

Shadrack is happily married and, together with his beautiful wife, he is blessed with one lovely child. For the past 10 years, he has been practicing mixed farming and his primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. He sells milk and farm produce to his neighbors and to the local market. However, he has been facing one big problem and that is timely delivery of the products to the market. He is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike that would solve his transportation problem. 

Kaplamai is located in a very remote area that has a poor road network and the terrain is very bad. The only mode of transport is a motorbike. This loan will be of great help because it will allow Shadrack to transport his farm products to the market and deliver them in a timely manner. 

Milk and vegetables are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch high prices. Through the loan, Shadrack will not be worried because he will always be able to deliver the products on time and gain more profits. This motorbike will be a reliable source for quick transportation for both long and short distances. 

Through the motorbike, Shadrack's life is going to change and his standard of living is going to improve.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 53-year-old married woman who has had a business buying and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of two children. 

Shamim is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life and good health as well as food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Yamwaya Group

texts.fr: Yamwaya est un groupe de femmes qui travaillent font le commerce de plusieurs articles. Rasmata, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 3 dont 2 sont scolarisés. Elle vend des plaquettes de 30 œufs chacun et des oignons, c'est pour renforcer cette activité qu'elle a besoin de ce prêt. Actuellement au Burkina, les oignons coûte un peu chère donc ce prêt sera vraiment utile pour cette brave dame. Avec le bénéfice, elle s'occupera de sa famille et continuera son activité.
texts.en: The Yamwaya Group is made up of women who earn a living from selling various products. Rasmata, the group representative, is a married mother to three children, two of whom are currently receiving an education. She sells cartons containing 30 eggs and onions. She needs this loan in order to strengthen her business. In Burkina Faso, onions are quite expensive at this moment in time, so this brave woman will find this loan very useful. She will use the profits to look after her family and carry on her business.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of eggs and sacks of onions for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is now 42 years old. He is married to Mary and they have been blessed with 2 children. He used his previous loan to buy more stock of window glass to sell and it was profitable. The income enabled him to support his family.

He has requested another loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil and cereals to sell. This will enable him to meet his customers’ needs and make more income, which he will use to pay school fees for his children. 

This is his fourth loan term and he repaid his previous loans successfully. 

His future hopes are to be successful in his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 42-year-old married woman. She has three children, and one of her children is also pictured with her. 

The man shown in the photo is Shahnaz ’s husband, who is a driver by profession and he provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning correctly. 

For this reason, Shahnaz has applied for a loan for her husband of 40,000 PKR. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts and tools for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and to provide a better transport service to his passengers. 

Shahnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts and tools for her husband's rickshaw business

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Evaline. She is a hardworking mother who is single-handedly raising four children through farming in Cheboin village. She is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to construct a cowshed that will improve the housing welfare of her animals. 

Evaline started farming on a 3 acre piece of land in the year 2000. She has managed to run the farm to date by keeping dairy cows and growing tea. She also holds a paying job that supplements her farming income and helps her to get by. 

Evaline will invest the loan in a structure that will provide dairy animals with the comfort and conducive environment necessary for high milk production. Income from this investment will satisfy her children's basic needs and uplift the entire family from the jaws of poverty. 

Evaline's dream is to provide a better life for her children, a life different from the challenging childhood she had growing up.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 47-year-old married woman. She and her husband (also shown in the photo) are involved in a business selling blankets. They have done this for about three years. They purchase different variety of blankets from markets at wholesale rate and sell them in their community. They are famous for providing good quality blankets. 

They are happily doing this business for the sake of their family. Rehana is a mother of 5 children. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs including food, health, clothing and education. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is satisfied with the support she gets from it. 

Currently she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy good quality blankets in different designs to increase their sales and earns more profit for the betterment of their family.

loans.use: to buy good quality blankets in different designs.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a retail shop at the corner of her house. She has many years of experience in this field. She purchases stocks of goods from the market at wholesale rate and sells them in her shop. 

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, health and education. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, sugar, rice and beverages etc. to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She is expecting boost in her earnings and wants to expand her business in future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, sugar, rice and beverages.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 22-year-old lady who is married to Charles, and they are blessed with one child who is ten months old.

For the last two and half years Mercy has been selling clothes of various kinds and also managing an M-Pesa service (a mobile-phone-based money transfer service), earning a monthly income of 15,000 which she uses to support her family.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan amount to buy more stock of the latest fashion clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. 

In the future she hopes to grow her business and build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of the latest fashion clothes to sell.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer from Hayin Mallam Bawa village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Isah, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet immediate cash needs like food and clothing, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices right after harvest time.

loans.name: Djekabara 1 Group

texts.fr:
