Les 10 membres du groupe  Djekabara 1  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tionso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème prêt.
La spéculation cultivée est la tomate et l’échalote avec Amadou, assis au bout  à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Ils compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Djekabara 1 Group are all married men who live within traditional families in Tionso, one of the villages of Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. The average age of all group members is 37 and each member has on average four children each. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry on running their market gardening businesses. This will be their second loan.

Amadou, the man sitting to the left at the end of the first row, grows tomatoes and shallots. With this loan, he is planning to purchase seeds, farming entrants and the materials necessary for maintaining 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, his produce will then be sold in the village and throughout Koutiala to a mixed customer base. He plans on making a final average profit of 150,000 FCFA. These profits will allow him to pay back the loan and meet his daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and farming materials

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en:
Yasemin is married and a mother of two. While her children were in school, she participated in the parent-teacher's association. She later got involved in non-governmental organizations and been interested in politics. 

14 years ago, after she had a very serious health problem, she got away from it all. While spending time at home, she contracted with a factory which produces rope and she knitted shawls. She even got the patent right on the shawls she produces. One of her biggest happiness is moving away from her consuming and passive life to a productive and social life. By this means, she financially supports her son who is studying in college. With this loan, she will buy wool. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Evli iki çocuk annesi .  Çocuklarınin okul hayatıyla beraber, okul aile birlikleri ile tanışmış.  Daha sonrası sivil toplum kuruluşlarında  özellikle kadın dernekleri ve siyasetle devam ettim.  14 yıl once çok ciddi bir rahatsızlık geçirdikten sonra herşeyden uzaklaşmış.  Evde vakit geçirmek amaçlı örgü makinesinde şal örmeye başlamış.  Özel bir ip üreten fabrika ile anlaşmış.  Ördüğü şalların patentini de almış.  En büyuk sevinci tüketici ve pasif bir hayattan, üretici ve sosyal bir yaşama geri dönmek.  Oğlunu bu sayede üniversite okumasını sağlıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile ip alacak.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Emma's Group

texts.en:
Emma is a 44-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Emma  has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Emma  described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Emma ’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 32-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. 

She has been running a cloth trade business for the past 5 years. She purchases different varieties of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her community. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Nagina has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of cloth in different varieties and colors for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. She hopes that this new loan will enable her to earn more income and expand her business. 

Her dream is to provide a good and quality education for her children

loans.use: to buy a stock of cloth of different varieties and colors for the winter season, taking account the choices and tastes of her customers

loans.name: Felister's Group

texts.en:
Felister, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 60 years old, is married and has 10 children.

Felister likes to think of herself as a very reliable person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings. Felister plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a pig.

In total, Felister’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Frosina

texts.en:
Frosina is a 39-year-old married mother of three children, 13, 10 and 7 years old who is seeking your financial help to stock up on inventory items of used children’s clothes. She finds selling children's clothes much more profitable than selling adult clothes or other items.

Frosina and her husband own a little transportation van, where they put the items and go from village to village to sell the clothes. This is their only source of income for the entire family.

Frosina and her family live in a one bedroom apartment in a building in a very little so-called town of not more than 2000 residents. Frosina was photographed with the stacks of used clothes inside her apartment.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory of used children's clothing to resell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old and married to Francis. She owns rental houses and has been in the house-renting business for 5 years. Her spouse also provides additional income and together they have been blessed with 5 children. 

She has requested her second loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy building materials such as iron sheets, timber, nails, ceiling boards and paint which she will use to renovate her rental houses so they can be in good condition and thereby attract more tenants. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. 

She paid back her previous loan successfully and her future hopes are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy building materials to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is a 23-year-old student. Bayan is a single woman and she lives in Mafraq. 

Bayan is in her third year at university and is studying Finance and Banking. Bayan’s purpose in applying for the loan is to pay her semester fees.  

Bayan’s future plan is to work using her diploma.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Dife

texts.en:
Dife is the widowed mother of a grown-up son who currently resides in Greece.  

In the photograph you can see Dife, selling some items in front of a well-known Catholic Church here in northern Albania. The locals say that some of them have already received miracles in this church, which has the name of a saint who was born in Lisbone, Portugal, in the year 1195 and who also lived in Italy.
  
Dife herself resides at her brother's house in one of his rooms, as she had no place to live before. On two or three days a week she sells items in front of the church, and one day she sells in the market of the little town where she lives. From her business activity and her pension, she makes approximately $147 per month.

Now she wants to expand her business activity by including more items to sell. Since she falls below the poverty line, according to VFA poverty tool, she qualified for the start-up loan.
 
The Assistant who interviewed Dife noted that she had said that this loan would make her so very happy.

loans.use: to expand her business activity by adding more items to sell

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María de 3 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijas de 13 y 10 años de edad, ambas estudian 6° y 3° grado de educación básica respectivamente. Ella no estudio, sus padres nunca le hablaron de estudio o de asistir a una escuela por lo que ella no se interesó. Nadie más vive con ellas.

María es comerciante, vende productos ajenos, quesadillas y tamales, de la venta a ella le dan un porcentaje de ganancia esta labor la hace todos los días de 5:00 am a 8:00 am, después se queda con venta propia de verduras. Los días domingos vende en el campo de futbol bebidas, jugos, agua embolsada y demás. Tiene 10 años trabajando como comerciante pequeño. Todos los días recorre cerca de 4 km ya que ella vende de casa en casa, aprendió a trabajar gracias a su madre que desde pequeña la mandaba a vender.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 3 docenas de ropa para adulto y ropa para niños, de estilos variados, para diversificar mas aun su negocio y aprovechar el tiempo navideño que se acerca, la ropa es uno de los productos que mas se vende.

María espera que su inversión le de los resultados esperados así trabajar con capital propio y diversificar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a single mother and has two children ages 13 and 10 years old, they are in 6th and 3rd grade in school, respectively. She didn't go to school and her parents never spoke with her about education so she was never interested. No one else lives with them. Maria sells products such as quesadillas and tamales everyday from 5:00 AM to 8:00 AM, and then she works selling vegetables. Every day on Sundays she sells beverages, juices, bottled water and other items at the soccer field. She has been working as a small businesswoman for 10 years. Every day she travels 4 km as she sells house to house; she learned to work thanks to her mother, as her mother taught her how to sell from a young age.

The loan she seeks will be used to buy 3 dozen of various styles of clothing for adults and children in order to diversify her business even more and take advantage of the approaching Christmas season. Clothing is one of the products is most frequently sold and Maria hopes that her investment gives her the expected results from working with her own capital and diversifying her business.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen of various styles of clothing for adults and children.

loans.name: Shougufta

texts.en:
Shougufta  is 41 years old and is a married woman. She helps in her husband's business of furniture making (her husband is also in the photo). They have been doing it together for many years. Over time they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. 

She is a responsible mother of 4 children and is responsible for providing them with the basic necessities of life. Currently she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to purchase good quality wood together with packs of polish and nails in larger quantities to increase their production. In this way they will be able to cater to more customers without delay which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. 

Shougufta dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood, packs of polish and nails.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es:
Reyna de 37 años de edad, está casada tiene dos hijos de 11 y 21 años de edad, ambos estudian segundo año de bachillerato y 4° grado de educación básica respectivamente. Reyna estudio hasta bachillerato, inicio la universidad, pero interrumpió sus estudios por un viaje que hizo al extranjero. Con ella viven sus hijos, su madre y unos hermanos.

Reyna elabora pan artesanal, tiene personal que sale a vender y reciben un porcentaje de ganancia de las ventas realizadas, también vende en su casa; tiene 4 años trabajando de esta manera, también tiene una tienda de artículos básicos para el hogar. Todo lo tiene en su casa, con la venta del pan se involucran sus hermanos, y lo hacen 3 veces por semana de 6:00 am a 1:00 pm. 
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar harina, azúcar, huevos, leña y demás para mantener bastecida la reserva de la panadería y mantener estable el negocio ya que es su fuente principal de ingreso.
texts.en:
Reyna is 37 years old, married, with two children ages 11 and 21 years old, both are in school, in the second year of secondary school and 4th grade of basic education, respectively. Reyna completed high school, began the university, but interrupted her studies for a trip abroad. Her mother and some siblings live with her and her children.

Reyna makes traditional bread. She has an employee that goes out to sell and receives a percentage of the earnings from sales. She also sells from her home. She has had this business for 4 years, and she also has a business selling basic items for the home. She has all this in her home, and her siblings help her with selling bread 3 days per week from 6 AM to 1 PM.

The loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, eggs, firewood, and other items to be able to maintain supplies in her bakery and stabilize the business as it is her main source of income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, firewood, and other items.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo es una persona muy trabajadora y se dedica al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio que es la venta de achinería y ropa usada de segunda mano.
Don Gerardo realiza su negocio de manera ambulante desde hace 15 años, el solicita nuevamente el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de achinería como plástico y también ropa usada como faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, etc. espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para seguir adelante en su negocio y poder seguir apoyando a su familia en el hogar.
Don Gerardo sueña con surtir mas su negocio.


Danlí, Honduras - Octubre 2014
texts.en:
Gerardo is a very hard-working man and his business is his main source of income selling various discounted items and second hand clothing. Gerardo is a street vendor and has had this business for 15 years. He seeks a loan to buy discounted items such as plastics and also used clothing such as skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, etc. He hopes this investment will enable him to obtain the necessary income to continue with his business and be able to continue supporting his family and home. Gerardo dreams of stocking his business with more items.

Danlí, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy plastics, skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es:
El trabajo del campo es una de las labores más difíciles hoy en día por el gran esfuerzo que se debe hacer para progresar, pero Maria es una mujer que nunca se ha rendido a pesar del clima o las circunstancias que puedan pasar, ella siempre está dispuesta a conseguir los recursos para su familia.

Se levanta desde primera hora de la mañana para ocuparse de su negocio de venta de leche que obtiene de sus propias vacas y adicional a esto tiene unos pequeños cultivos de plátano que también vende en la plaza de mercado.


Ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo para garantizar el sostenimiento de su negocio de leche, pues últimamente el mercado ha estado muy difícil en este campo. 

Es esta la razón que la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ganado de leche para incrementar su producción, mejorar sus utilidades y cumplir su sueño de tener su casa propia.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Maria y haz sus sueños realidad!
texts.en:
Working in the field is one of the most difficult jobs today because of the amount of effort needed to make progress; however, Maria has done well despite the weather or the circumstances surrounding her. She is always ready to get what her family needs.

She wakes up at first light to work at her business selling the milk she gets from her cows. She also has a small banana crop that she sells at the market.

She wants to increase her working capital to guarantee she can sustain the milk business. Lately, the market has been very difficult in the area.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in buying milking cows to increase her production, improve her facilities, and fulfill her dream of having her own home.

Get inspired to lend to Maria and make her dreams a reality!

loans.use: to buy milking cows to increase production.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Senhora Maria tem 37 anos de idade, casada e mãe de três filhos, dos quais um estuda e o outro terminou o ensino secundário, é negociante e custureira, vive em casa própria com a sua familia.
O montante do empréstimo será aplicado para a compra de carnes diversas  e bebidas para revender no mercado nacional.
No futuro pretende construir um estabelecimento comercial em sua casa.
O seu grande desafio e de adquirir um meio de transporte para transportar as suas mercadorias para revender e para o transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are in school and one of whom already graduated from high school. She works in sales and as a seamstress and lives in her own home with her family.

With this loan Maria will buy a variety of meats and drinks to sell, and in the future she would like to establish a store in her house. Her main goal for the future is to buy a vehicle she can use to transport her merchandise, and for personal use.

loans.use: buy a variety of meats and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Roda

texts.pt:
Senhora Roda tem 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de seis filhos dos quais quatro estudam frenquentando ensino primário e secundário, é negociante, vive em casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de areia, cimento, varrões, para dar continuidade construção do muro de vedação do seu quintal.
Para o futuro projecta fazer um negócio de decoração em eventos como casamentos e festas, como forma de ganhar mais algum dinheiro para vazar as despesas da familia.
Quer liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora como forma de garantir mais financimentos na HLUVUKU-adsema e consequentimente realização dos seus planos.
texts.en:
Roda is 45 years old, married, and has six children, 4 of whom are in elementary or high school. She works in sales, lives with her family in their own home, and is not financially responsible for anyone else.

Roda will use this loan to buy cement, sand, and metal bars, to continue with construction of a wall around her property. In the future, she would like to open a business providing decoration for events like parties and weddings so that she can earn more money to cover her household expenses. 

Roda plans to pay back the loan on time so that she can take out more loans with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner] in order to make her plans a reality.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, and metal bars to continue with construction of a wall around her property.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a very hardworking, 24-year-old, mixed-farmer based in the Litein region of Kenya. On his 0.5 acre piece of land, he keeps one dairy cow and 10 heads of poultry. Besides farming, he is involved in other side-businesses that supplement his primary income.
 
Ronald is seeking a loan investment that he will use to put in place an improved animal housing for his cow. Having a great cowshed will improve his animal's living condition and hygiene, and he will be rewarded in turn by a significant increase in milk production. 

Ronald does not have his own family yet, but your investment will put him in a more financially secure position to start one.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Menekşe

texts.en:
Menekşe is married and has two children. Her husband lost his job, so she started selling the knittings she made at home as a hobby. She sold them both from home and at stands. She could not sell the knittings in summer, so she started learning how to make ornaments.  She is selling knittings in the winter, and ornaments in the summer, and contributing to her family budget. 

She is planning to buy materials for the ornaments with the help of the loan, and increase her sales. She says "no matter at what age we are, we can achieve anything by learning".

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Menekşe hanım evli iki çocuk annesi .  Kendisi ev kadınıyken eşi işini kaybedince, evde hobi olarak yaptığı örgüleri geliştirerek evden ve stantlarda satarak aileye katkı sağlamaya başladı.  Örgüler yazın satılmayınca arayışa geçerek ,takı öğrenmeye başladı .  Takı üretiyor.  Yazın takı ,kışında örgülerini satarak ailesinin geçimini sağlıyor. Aldığı kredi ile takı malzemelerini toptan alarak,üreterek para kazanmayı hedefliyor.  İnsan isterse yaşı ne kadar olursa olsun öğrenerek bir şeyler yapa bilir diyor.

loans.use: to buy materials for the ornaments

loans.name: Semiha

texts.en:
Semiha has two children and was widowed two years ago. As a housewife, she had begun selling the handmade knitted items and jewelry she made to earn money. The work she did at home became a career, and her income provided for her family. 

With the loan she will buy jewelry materials wholesale to make new items and earn money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Evli iki çocuk annesi, eşi iki yıl önce vefat etmiş. Kendisi ev kadınıyken  yaptığı elişleri örgü ve takıları satışa sunmaya başlamış ve para kazanmaya başlıyor .  Evde yaptığı işler meslek haline getirmiş ailesinin geçimini sağlıyor. Aldığı kredi ile takı malzemelerini toptan alarak işleyerek üreterek para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy jewelry materials

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married with two children She makes meerschaum items to sell. Her husband learned the craft from his family and taught it to Fatma after they were married. The items they make appeal to local and foreign tourists. Their sales have been going well. 

With the loan, she will buy meerschaum. She wants to make more items to raise sales. Her children are studying at university, she wants to ensure a good future for them.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Evli iki çocuk annesi, lületaşı üretimi yapıyor ve satıyor .  Eşi aileden gelen ustalık ve mesleği.  Fatma hanımla da evlendikten  sonra,kendisine  lületaşını işlemeyi öğretiyor. Yaptıkları ürünler  yerli ve yabancı turistlere hitap ediyor. Satışları iyi gitmeye başladı .  Aldığı kredi ile lületaşını aldı.  Üreterek satışlarını  artırmayı düşünüyor.  Çocukları üniversitede okuyor ,onlara iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor .

loans.use: to buy meerschaum

loans.name: Alina Barbara

texts.es:
El espíritu de superación y el deseo de seguir creciendo como una joven emprendedora, han impulsado a Alina a que no desaproveche la oportunidad de obtener su licenciatura en Administración de empresas con énfasis en mercadeo. A sus 24 años, Alina cursa el 4to año de la carrera por las noches y es madre soltera de un hijo de cinco años, el cual sirvió de motivación para convertirse en una profesional a pesar de haberse convertido en mamá a temprana edad.
Afortunadamente, Alina cuenta con el apoyo de su papá, quien es ingeniero eléctrico, y con el de su mamá quien es ingeniera geóloga. Actualmente está realizando pasantías en una empresa privada donde siente que está ejerciendo lo aprendido. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para pagar el curso de titulación, esto le permitirá a obtener un trabajo estable. Ella sueña con establecer su propio negocio, tener una especialidad de la carrera y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
A spirited need to overcome and the desire to continue growing as a young entrepreneur has propelled Alina to not miss an opportunity to obtain her bachelor's degree in Business Administration with an emphasis on marketing. At the age of 24 Alina is completing the 4th year of the degree at night and is a single mother of a son who is 5 years old who serves as her motivation to become a professional, even though she became a mother at a young age. 

Fortunately, Alina can rely on the support of her father who is an electrical engineer and her mother who is geological engineer. Currently she is completing an internship at a private business where she feels she is practicing what she is learning. Alina is seeking a loan to pay for courses to complete her degree which will allow her to obtain stable work. She dreams of establishing her own business, having a specialized career and of purchasing her own home.

loans.use: to pay for the courses to complete her degree.

loans.name: Nelly's Group

texts.en:
Nelly's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Nelly, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 38 years old, is married, and has four children. Nelly has been a farmer for 14 years, and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Nelly isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, Nelly will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Nelly's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the maize harvest.

loans.name: Ernest's Group

texts.en:
Ernest is 87 years old and is often referred to as a really reliable person. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Kakamega North District, formed by 10 farmers, including himself.

Ernest has been a farmer for more than 50 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2007 because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

With this loan, Ernest’s Group will receive a total of three solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of five acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz is married with two children, and a retired nurse. She worked as a nurse for many years. Her son is at university, and her pension was insufficient, so she began to sell the jewelry she made as a hobby. That allowed her to fund her son's education. 

With the loan, she will buy materials to make jewelry wholesale, and make more items to sell.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Evli iki çocuk annesi, emekli  ve  hemşire.  Uzun yıllar hemşire olarak hizmet vermiş.  Oğlu üniversite okuyor emekli maaşı yetmediği için evde  hobi olarak yaptığı takılarılarını meslek haline getirerek satmaya başlıyor .  Bu sayede oğlunu üniversitede okutuyor.  Aldığı kredi ile takı malzemelerini toptan alarak işleyerek üretip  para kazanmak istiyor .

loans.use: to buy materials to make jewelry

loans.name: Sirine

texts.en:
Sirine is a 28-year-old married mother of four children, and a Palestinian refugee. She started a year ago selling clothes to help her husband, who has a limited salary, in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Today, Sirine is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes for the upcoming Christmas to satisfy her customers' needs.

Sirine hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Marcos

texts.pt:
Senhor Marcos tem 50 anos de idade, é casado, tem três  filhos, dos quais um frenquenta ensino secundário e outro primário, vive em casa própria e sustenta sua familia.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de azuleijos, pia, sanitas, para a construção de um quarto de banho dentro da sua casa.
No futuro espera abrir um negócio, visto que está para entrar na reforma no seu seu servico.
O seu maior desafio é de garantir o sustento escolar dos filhos até a faculdade, e reembolsar os valores sem entrar em mora para garantir futuros empréstimos
texts.en:
Marcos is 50 years old and is married with 5 children, one of whom is in elementary school and one of whom is in high school. He lives with his family in their own home and supports the family financially.

Marcos will use this loan to buy tiles, a sink, and a toilet in order to build a bathroom in his house. In the future, he would like to open a business, because he is about to retire from his current job.

His main goal is to ensure that his children are able to study through college and to pay back the loan on time so that he can take out more loans in the future.

loans.use: buy tiles, a sink, and a toilet in order to build a bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega South District and is represented by Josephine, 28 years old, the group leader pictured above. She is married and has 3 children. Josephine has been a farmer for 14 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Josephine isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013. She has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year, Josephine will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Josephine's Group will use this loan to purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests

loans.name: Soltana**. Group

texts.en:
This group is called Soltana**. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB.

Soltana is the leader of the group. She is a 52-year-old married woman, and a mother of four children, living with her family in a humble house in the capital city of Sana'a. Selling accessories, makeup, perfumes, incense, and other items is the sole business of Soltan. Her husband works as a solider with a small salary, and his income is not enough to cover the daily needs of the family. Soltana decided to help him in that. She has started her humble business more than five years ago. 

The income of her business is low, and she wants to increase it more. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more goods and items for her business to attract more customers.

Soltana looks forward to providing her family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and items for her business to attract more customers.

loans.name: Las Cafeteras Group

texts.es:
El clima donde se encuentra el grupo llamado Las Cafeteras favorece la siembra y cosecha de café y muy cerca hay una fábrica donde se procesan los granos. El nombre del grupo se debe a que todas las integrantes se dedican a sembrar, cortar y distribuir café en distintas cantidades y al mismo tiempo desempeñan otra actividad económica:

Rosa Imelda- Venta De Ropa
Magdalena - Venta De Café
María -Venta De Abarrotes
Patricia- Venta De Antojitos
Amada -Venta De Zapatos

María está casada con el señor Antonio y tienen dos hijos, uno de ellos cumplió 18 años recientemente. Desde pequeño, Antonio aprendió a sembrar, limpiar, cortar y procesar el café en el negocio de sus padres, actividad a la que sigue dedicando su esfuerzo. María maneja una pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace 7 años y ayuda a su esposo en la actividad del café. Actualmente necesita invertir para tener más mercancía: queso, arroz, azúcar, frijoles y huevo además de bolsas de plástico para entregar el café. 

María comenzó vendiendo tortillas, pero sus clientes le pedían refrescos y algunos más aceite, huevos, queso. Fue así como inició su tienda. Por las tardes y en fines de semana ella, su esposo y su hijo se dedican a cortar café y limpiar los sembradíos. "Nuestro sueño es no solamente venderle café a las empresas cercanas, sino llevar nuestro grano a otros estados para seguir creciendo". María piensa en el bienestar de su familia, pero también en su comunidad. Actualmente da empleo a 6 personas y sabe que al expandir el negocio necesitará más ayuda. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de María quien viste blusa blanca y pantalón de mezclilla, su hija menor la acompaña.
texts.en:
The weather where the Las Cafeteras group is based favors coffee planting and harvesting. It’s very close to a factory where grains are produced. The name of the group comes from the fact that all the members work in planting, cutting, and distributing coffee in different quantities, while at the same time working in other economic sectors:

Rosa Imelda sells clothing

Magdalena sells coffee

María sells groceries

Patricia sells snacks

Amada sells shoes

María is married to Antonio and they have two children, one of whom recently turned 18. Since he was young, Antonio learned to plant, clean, cut, and process coffee from his parents’ business. He now continues with this work. María has managed a small grocery store for the past seven years and she helps her husband with the coffee business. Currently, she needs to invest in more merchandise such as cheese, rice, sugar, beans, and eggs in addition to plastic bags for the coffee.

María started selling tortillas but her customers asked for soft drinks and more items like cooking oil, eggs, and cheese. This is how she started the store. In the afternoons and on the weekends, her husband and son work by cutting coffee and cleaning the seeds. “Our dream is not only to sell coffee to nearby businesses, but also to take it to other states so we keep growing.” María is thinking of her family’s well-being, but also that of her community. Currently, she employs six people and knows that to expand her business, she’ll need more help.

*The photo was taken in María’s home. She is wearing a white blouse and denim pants; her younger daughter is with her.

loans.use: to buy cheese, rice, sugar, beans, and eggs for her store and bags for coffee.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 54-year-old proud father of eight children. He is often described as a very hardworking individual. Henry has noticed that since he joined UGAFODE, he has been able to consistently feed his family and meet their other needs.

Henry described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with UGAFODE Microfinance. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, he will be able to cultivate a total of five acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and solar lamps

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu studied construction engineering as her family wished, and worked in this area for 17 years. After she had children, she stopped working as a construction engineer because of the busy work schedule and her own interest in fine arts. Arzu didn't feel the need to have her own studio and began making dolls, something she could do at home that used her creativity. She was supported by her friends and family and began taking orders for her dolls. Then she began selling them over the internet as well. With the loan from Maya, she will buy different materials and make different types of dolls. Arzu wants to develop a brand and sell her dolls in other countries.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Arzu Hanım ailesinin isteği üzerine inşaat mühendisliği eğitimi almış.  17 yıl boyunca bu alanda çalışmış.  Çocukları olduktan sonra yoğun iş temposu ve güzel sanatlara olan ilgisinden dolayı inşaat mühendisliğini bırakmış. Arzu Hanım özel bir atölyeye gerek duymadan, evde yapabileceği ve yaratıcılığını ortaya çıkarabilecek bez bebekleri yapmaya başladı.  Bu bebekleri belli bir konsept çerçevesinde tasarlıyor.  Önce çevresinden sipariş almaya başladı.  Daha sonra internetten satmaya başladı.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile değişik malzemeler alarak bebeklerini çeşitlendirdi.  Arzu Hanım markalaşmak,atölye açmak ve bebeklerini farklı ülkelere satmayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy different materials and make different types of dolls

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar is 29 year old, married, and she has a son. Her husband is a laborer. The family lives in an IDP settlement. Nigar is a good farmer; she raises seasonal fruits and then sells them at a local bazaar. Her monthly income is 200 AZN. She has been working in this field for five years, and has good experience. 

People like eating fresh fruits. They use them to prepare juice, or jam for tea. They also cook fruit cakes and other kinds of sweet things.  People prefer to buy fresh fruits from Nigar, because her products are cheaper and don’t contain pesticides. 

Nigar is a good mother; she does everything for her son. She wants her child to be well-educated. 

She plans to increase income and provide him an excellent education as is possible. 

Now she applied for 1,500 AZN in order to buy new fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a very a progressive, hardworking, 44-year-old, Kenyan mixed-farmer from Kibunai village in South Rift Kenya. He runs a mixed-farm on a 10 acre piece of land, where he grows tea and trees and keeps dairy cows and poultry. 

Fredrick is seeking a loan to construct a housing unit for his dairy animals. 

In 1999, Fredrick married his lovely supportive wife, Josephine. This was the same year he started dairy farming. He grew very passionate about this work, and he has been working to maintain and grow this business ever since. 

Today, he is seeking a loan to build an animal housing unit that will provide shelter and protection to his animals. A cowshed will also control animal movement, and improve the hygiene of the animal's habitat. 

Fredrick is expecting to realize a significant increase in milk production in the future with the introduction of this structure.  It will facilitate zero-grazing. 

Income from this investment is dedicated to educating his five children, and meeting the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Lydiah's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Lydia, often described as an extremely reliable person. She is 28 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has three children.

Lydia is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Lydia says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Lydia will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of six acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Miyase

texts.en:
Miyase has a daughter. During her school years, she had realized her interest in fine arts, especially in painting. She has improved herself in jewelry design. She has been selling her artwork on counters in some shopping areas for 10 years. 

With the microcredit she has received, she purchased materials for jewelry design, and she plans to increase her sales. Miyase has an entrepreneurial spirit, and she is very hardworking. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Miyase Hanım bir kız çocugu annesi.  Genclik yıllarında okulda başta resim olmak üzere güzel sanatlara ve el sanatlarına ilgisini fark etmiş.  Takıda kendisini geliştirmiş.  On yıldır takı işini stantlardan satarak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile takı malzemeleri aldı ve üreterek satışlarını artırmayı düşünüyor.  Miyase Hanım,girişimci ve çalışkan bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy materials for jewelry

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Magret will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

Magret plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Magret’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of nine acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Bonface's Group

texts.en:
Bonface is a 35-year-old, proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person. He is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Bonface has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Bonface says his harvest was good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, in addition to the fertilizer and maize seeds, because now he will have light during dark hours, for his children to study by. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Bonface’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jenny Haydee

texts.es:
Jenny es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de polleras.
Ella es independiente, activa, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Los Yungas’ una región geográfica perteneciente al ecosistema situada en una estrecha franja y se caracteriza por ser una zona húmeda, con nieblas constantes y precipitaciones abundantes, además de contener una mezcla de verdes laderas, precipicios, ríos, cascadas y una exuberante vegetación, con una altura que varía entre los 600 y los 2.500 metros sobre el nivel del mar. 
Jenny es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su madre que se dedica al comercio, viven en una casa de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de polleras; ella realiza la compra de polleras por mayor en la ciudad y las distribuye en diferentes localidades de los yungas (las polleras son las faldas que utilizan las mujeres de vestir tradicional). Su dificultad es que tiene que viajar constantemente y eso le ocasiona dolor de espalda por los tramos largos que debe recorrer; ‘los yungas son hermosos, hace calor y las personas de las comunidades son muy agradables, lo malo es que el camino es de tierra y después de tanto viajar, me duele mucho la espalda…’. Su sueño es iniciar un taller de costura para poder vender polleras de su propia producción y desea realizar la compra de polleras de ocasión por mayor, para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año.
Es por esos motivos que Jenny solicita un préstamo para la compra de polleras por mayor para llevar a los Yungas para las fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 27 year old woman. She is single and without children and she has a business selling skirts. Jenny is independent, active, entrepreneurial, responsible and a hard worker. She conducts her business in the region of Los Yungas, a geographic area belonging to an ecosystem located on a narrow strip that is characterized by its humidity, constant mist and abundant precipitation. In addition, it contains a mix of green slopes, cliffs, rivers, waterfalls and lush vegetation with an altitude that varies between 600 and 2500 meters above sea level. 

Jenny has brown skin. She is short with long black hair and her native language is aymará and she speaks Spanish. She spends her life in the company of her mother who works in commerce. They live in a brick house that has potable water and electricity. Jenny has a business selling skirts. She completes the purchase of skirts via wholesale in the city and she distributes them to different towns in Los Yungas. (The skirts are used by the women who dress in a traditional style). Her challenge is that she has to travel constantly and this inflicts back pain from the long stretches she has to travel. She says "Los Yungas are beautiful, it is hot and the people in the community are very friendly, the bad part is that the roads are made of dirt and after so much travel my back hurts a lot." Her dream is to start a seamstress shop and to be able to sell skirts from her own production. She wants to complete the purchase of special occasion skirts via wholesale to take advantage of her sales at the end of the year. Because of these motivations, Jenny is seeking a loan to purchase skirts via wholesale to bring to Los Yugas for the end of the year festivities.

loans.use: to purchases skirts via wholesale to bring to the Los Yungas region for the end of the year festivities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a metal cutting machine and supplies such as laminate.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. The group is being represented here by Violet, who is the group leader and is pictured above. She is 34 years old, is married, and has four children. Violet has been a farmer for 14 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Violet isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year, Violet will get not only fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but also she will purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since with the solar light she will have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Violet's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights, and will use the farming inputs they will receive to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvest of maize.

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 52-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jennifer has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Jennifer described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Jennifer’s Group will be able to plant a total of 11.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is applying for a loan of GHS 1,500 to improve his maize business. He is married and runs the business in his house, supplying maize to his customers. He is making good income from this business, and he wants to buy more stock with the loan. Benjamin lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy from him. He is busy selling, every day. He opened his business five years ago, with a small amount of working capital.

loans.use: To buy more maize and sell to his customers.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Senhora Beatriz tem 53 anos de idade, casada e mãe de três filhos fora da sua responsabilidade, é negociante a mais de 10 anos, vive em casa própria, e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado  para a compra de fardos de roupas usadas para revender de forma avulsa e ambulantimente.
No futuro pretende abrir um estabelecimento comercial em sua casa visto que está a muito tempo vendendo duma forma ambulante e a idade já não permite.
Liquidar o empréstimo sem  entrar em mora é o seu maior desafio, de modo a manter o bom nome e reputação nesta instituição.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 53 years old and is married with 3 children, all of whom are grown and independent. For more than ten years she's worked as a street vendor, and she lives in her own home and is not financially responsible for anyone else.

Beatriz will use this loan to buy large bundles of used clothing that she will divide up and sell. In the future, she would like to open a store in her home because she has been working as a street vendor for a long time and at her age it is getting hard to do. Her main goal is to to pay back the loan on time so that she maintains her good reputation as a borrower.

loans.use: buy large bundles of used clothing that she will divide up and sell.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de fotocopiadora y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de organizacion de bautizos y cumpleaños,la socia por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de fotocopiadora.La socia solicita el credito para comprar papeles y tintas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Petronila continues her photocopying business and also organizing baptism and birthday events. Through these successful businesses she is able to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her photocopying business. She seeks a loan to buy paper and ink. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy paper and ink.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz se dedica a la actividad de la confección desde hace aproximadamente 4 años, gracias a esto ha podido contribuir, junto con su esposo al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. 

Luz es madre de 3 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer todo lo necesario, es por esto que debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, Luz decidió montar un taller de confección donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros, aprendió de este oficio al lado de sus hermanas

Luz actualmente quiere aumentar la capacidad de producción de su taller de confección con el ánimo de poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos, es por esto que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina fileteadora. 

Luz espera que de esta manera pueda cumplir su sueño de que sus hijos accedan a una educación de calidad, además, de poder mejorarle la calidad de vida a su familia. 

Luz espera que su taller aumente las ventas considerablemente y en un futuro hacerlo crecer y poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Luz has been dedicated to the job of making clothing for approximately 4 years. Thanks to this work she has been able to contribute, together with her husband, to the management of the expenses of their home. Luz is the mother of 3 children who she has always wanted to offer everything they need. Because of this situation, when the earnings that her husband made were not sufficient to be able to cover the expenses of their home, Luz decided to create a seamstress business where she offers the service of making third party garments. She learned this trade together at the side of her sisters. 

Currently, Luz wants to increase the productive capacity at her sewing business with the goal of being able to pay for her children's education. Because of this she hopes that a loan will provide her with the opportunity to complete the purchase of an overlock sewing machine. Luz hopes that this way she will be able to accomplish her dream that her children will have access to a quality education, moreover, she wishes to be able to improve the quality of life of her family. Luz hopes that her business will increase its sales considerably and in the future she will make it grow and be able to generate employment for additional necessary employees.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine for her production of clothing.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has been doing a motorcycle transport business, and it has been profitable for the six years he has been in this business. He is 28 years old, married, and together with his spouse, has been blessed with two children. 

He will use this loan to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle so it can be in good condition, and thereby, serve more customers and make more income. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying another motorcycle. 

This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loans successfully. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts so he can repair and service his motorcyle.

loans.name: Karmita Del Rosario

texts.es:
Karmita del Rosario su estado civil es soltera, reside en el distrito de Morropón, ella es natural de la zona, vive en casa propia, junto a su familia. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, ademas del comercio. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Karmita del Rosario es a la venta de pescado, en su domicilio, ella realiza sus ventas 3 veces a la semana, viene trabajando con cantidades pequeñas de pescado ya que su capital es propio y su crecimiento en el negocio es escalonado, sin embargo Karmita del Rosario cuenta con buenas referencias crediticias, laborales y personales en la zona donde vive. El destino del crédito será para la compra de calaminas para su domicilio, pues ya se acerca la temporada de lluvias y desea asegurar su domicilio para que estas no afecten a su seguridad.
texts.en:
Karmita del Rosario is single and lives in the Morropon district. She is originally from this area and lives in her own home with her family. Life in the community is tranquil, and people here work in agriculture and livestock in addition to business. Her community is located in the Morropon district and province, Piura regiona, on the northern coast of Peru.

Karmita del Rosario sells fish from her home, making sales 3 times per week. She works with small quantities of fish as she uses her own money to run her business and it is growing. Karmita del Rosario has good credit, work and personal references in the area where she lives. The loan will be used to buy roofing materials for her home, as the rainy season is approaching and she wants to ensure that her home will not be impacted by the rain and compromise their safety.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials for her home.

loans.name: Hendi's Group

texts.en:
Hendi is 54 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Hendi has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Hendi also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore, save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Hendi's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's Group is formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Grace, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 50 years old, is married and has two children. Grace has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Grace isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year, Grace will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Grace's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 9.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 

Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 

Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital que le prestó un amigo, este hombre inició con una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 44 años. 

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes. 

Una de sus principales dificultades es el alto costo de los insumos y de los productos.

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica y poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias,  garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Carlos is 58 years old and he has won the love of all his neighbors for his friendliness and good sense of humor. He loves his family and that is his main motivation to struggle each day to generate his livelihood. Although he didn't have the resources to start his business that was no barrier to fulfill his dream to become a businessman.

With a small amount of capital that a friend lent him this man started a grocery store 44 years ago. His dreams haven't stopped. For this reason he finds himself requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of shelving to place his products and make them more visible and attractive for his customers. One of his principal difficulties is the high cost of his supplies and products. He hopes to improve his economic conditions and be able to have an old age without money worries guaranteeing his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy shelving to place his products and make them more visible.

loans.name: Abigael's Group

texts.en:
Abigael's Group was formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, and it is being represented by Abigael, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three children. Abigael has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and she is often referred to as a very hard-working individual.

Abigael isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013.  She has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. 

This year, Abigael will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition.  Now she will have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Abigael's Group will purchase a total of six solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko is 53 years old. She lives with her two sons and their families, in a small village of Kobuleti district. Dariko owns 0.5 hectare agricultural land, where she grows mandarin and nut trees. She sells the harvested products locally.

Dariko has decided to start a trading business and get stable income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2400 to start her trading business. She will purchase fruits and vegetables and will resell them, to get stable income. This will increase her income, and with increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin trade in fruits and vegetables and generate stable income.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. 

Hace aproximadamente 5 años inicio con un negocio de levante y venta de pollos de engorde, negocio que le genera algunos recursos para sobrevivir.

Con el ánimo de sacar este negocio adelante, Rosa busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para los pollos, adecuar el corral de sus pollos y comprar pollos.

Rosa tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita suplir sus necesidades en el corto plazo y esto le ayude a salir adelante con su negocio. 

Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Rosa is a person who has faced much difficulty in life. However she has always had the strength to overcome it and get ahead with her children. About 5 years ago she started her business of raising and selling chickens, a business that has generated the resources for her to subsist.

With the desire to get her business ahead Rosa is seeking a loan to give her the possibility of buying feed for the chickens, adapt her chicken coop and to buy chickens. Rosa hopes that the loan will fulfill her needs in the short term and this will help her progress with her business. Also she hopes to expand her business and generate greater income which she can use to offer her children a better quality of living and better opportunities to progress.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens, to adapt her chicken coop and buy chickens.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 29-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and 9-year-old son in the Gardabani district. The family has no source of income nowadays. Nana married in early age and wasn’t able to get an education, and so she has no university degree, which is one of the main reasons for her unemployment. She looks after her family and stays home, but she has a great desire to be involved in a trading business. 

Nana couldn’t request a loan from financial institutions until the Start Up program began. It is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. She requested a loan of 2,000 USD to begin trading with clothing and bed-clothing. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell among her friends and villagers. This will give her a chance to earn income and not to depend on her parents. Nana will provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes and generating income.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old, married, and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with four children. 

She is a cash crop farmer and the business has been profitable for the 20 years that she has been in this business. 

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and also service the loan. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid back her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent some agricultural land from her neighbours.

loans.name: Mata De Platano Group

texts.es:
DIANA  tiene 21 años y actualmente vive con su esposo y su hija de 2 años.
Su esposo se dedica a realizar actividades de limpieza en terrenos y fincas del sector . 
DIANA desde hace 18 meses realiza la actividad de venta de ropa y perfumería.
Es su primer crédito con Fodemi y se enteró por una amiga que les invitó junto con su madre.
Su mamá es la Líder del grupo y es muy querida en la comunidad.
En este pueblo no se cuenta con servicios de agua potable y no hay ríos.  Los moradores se abastecen de agua por pozos subterráneos.  No tienen centros de salud y si cuentan con una escuela primaria.
Los moradores de esta comunidad al igual que DIANA, realizan las debidas gestiones con las autoridades para en poco tiempo poder dotar de estos servicios tan necesarios.
DIANA dentro de 3 años espera poder adquirir una vitrina para ofertar mejor sus productos.
Gracias a sus ahorros ha podido junto a su esposo construir su propia casa. 
Felicita mucho a FODEMI por la agilidad que ofrece en los créditos a personas que lo necesitan para cambiar la vida de sus familias y de su comunidad.
texts.en: Diana is 21 years old and today lives with her husband and 2 year old daughter. Her husband works clearning land for farming and at farms in the area. 18 months ago Diana started selling clothing and perfume. This is her first loan with Fodemi and she joined the group through a friend who invited her and her mother. Her mother is leader of the group and is very beloved in the community.  In this town there is not drinkable water service and there are no rivers. Water is retrieved from subterranean wells. There are no health centers but there is an elementary school.  The inhabitants of the community, like Diana, have requested to the authorities to provide these necessary services soon.  Within 3 years Diana hopes to be able to acquire a display case to better display her products to customers. Thanks to her savings, she and her husband have been able to build their own home. She is thankful to Fodemi for the flexibility in offering loans to people who need them to change the lives of their families and community.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children and adults, as well as perfume and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Josphat's Group

texts.en:
Josphat is 47 years old and has five children. He is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Josphat has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Josphat also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Josphat's Group will be able to receive a total of three solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic has a retail shop in Nairobi town and has been running this business for 10 years. He also has a grocery store, and it has been profitable. He is 41 years old, married and together with his spouse, has been blessed with four children. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his retail shop by buying more goods such as sugar and cooking oil to sell. 

This is his tenth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and he has paid back his previous loans successfully. In the future, he hopes to educate his children and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking smallholder farmer from the Keera location in the Nyamira region of Kenya. Three years ago, he married a lovely lady by the name of Nancy and only seven months ago is when they got their first child. Being a father has brought joy to James' life and a sense of great responsibility ahead. It is for this reason that he is inspired to work even harder than before and grow his business.
 
James is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to construct a zero-grazing unit on his farm. Zero-grazing leads to increased production of milk because the animal does less walking and the feed requirement for healthy living and milk production is factored in the feed ration. 

Income from this investment will supplement the income he is already making from poultry, goats, trees, tea, onions and passion fruit. His family will benefit a great deal from this loan. His mission in life is to provide for and protect his family in the best way he can.

loans.use: to construct a dairy shed.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 26 years old and married, with three children; two attend school. 

He operates a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise like sugar, salt, and soap among other items. He supplements his income by growing maize to sell.  

His dream is to build a commercial house and educate his children,  He will use the credit facility extended to him to buy more sugar and cooking oil for his shop.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret is a 36-year-old proud mother of 4 children and is often described as very hardworking. As the group leader, she is representing her group of 12 farmers from Kakamega South District, Kenya for a loan to buy maize seeds, fertilizer, and solar lights. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Magret has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Magret described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Magret’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming planting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Derly Yuliana

texts.es:
Derly es una mujer soltera, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace unos meses inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00. Enfrentándose a una gran dificultad que es la falta de capital para trabajar.  

Derly sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Sueña con diversificar sus productos, aumentar sus ventas, pagar la educación de sus hijos y tener un negocio sostenible.

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco y ha intentado mejorar su calidad de vida.

Con tu ayuda Derly Podrá pagar la educación de sus hijos que es uno de sus más grandes sueños, aporta hoy!
texts.en:
Derly is single, a hard-worker and very responsible. She has worked with her family in different businesses where she gained experience in sales. A few months ago she started a grocery store where she can work independently. She works from 7 am until 10 pm. She is facing a big difficulty which is the lack of capital.

Derly dreams of having a supermarket in the future. For now she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products wholesale like vegetables, grains, fruit, etc. and be able to offer her clients products of excellent quality. She dreams of diversifying her products increasing her sales, paying for the education of her children and having a sustainable business.

With her business she has been able to get ahead little by little and she has tried to improve her quality of living. With your help Derly can pay for the education of her children which is one of her greatest dreams. Support her today!

loans.use: to buy products like vegetables, grains, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Tempora

texts.es:
Tempora tiene 66 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia, ella es natural de la zona. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano, maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Tempora es la crianza de animales (pollos patos) y venta de los mismos, además de la venta de chicha de jora, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 5 años, con experiencia en el negocio, y ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias perosnales y laborales en la zona. Tempora tiene capacidad de pago. El destino del crédito será para capital de trabajo pues desea realizar la compra una cantidad mayor de animales para poder surtir y diversificar su stock para poder cumplir con todos los gustos y preferencias de su público de consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Tempora is 66 years old, married, lives in her own home, and is originally from this area. The area where she lives is tranquil, and its inhabitants work in farming and livestock, planting and harvesting banana, corn, bean, etc. Her community is located in the Buenos Aires district, Morropon district, Piura region, on the northern coast of Per.

Termpora has a business raising and selling animals (chickens and ducks). In addition she sells chicha (a traditional fermented corn beverage), something she has been doing for more than 5 years. She has good personal and work references from the area. Tempora has the ability to make her payments. The loan will be used to buy a large quantity of animals to be able to stock as well as diversify her stock in order to be able to meet the likes and preferences of her customers. This will enable her in the short term to improve her income, increase her profits and thus improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals to be able to stock as well as diversify her stock.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice's Group is formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Eunice, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 36 years old, is married and has four children. Eunice has been a farmer for 18 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Eunice isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, Eunice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Eunice's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of nine acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Magret, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 34 years old, is married and has four children. 

Magret has been a farmer for 18 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Magret isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, Magret will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.
