Using this loan, Magret's Group will purchase a total of four solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 10 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Edilma

texts.es:
La señora Edilma es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de salsamentaría y restaurante.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo y al apoyo que puede recibir de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante.

De este negocio dependerán su sostenimiento, el de su esposo y el de su hijo a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarle un legado a su progenitor.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar sillas, mesas y surtido de ingredientes en gran variedad para la preparación de sus alimentos y poder ofrecerlo a sus futuros clientes.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una mujer llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Edilma is a very enterprising and creative woman who has wanted for some time to work independently and open her own restaurant and food store. At the moment she has the opportunity to make this dream a reality thanks to her work ethic and to the support of all those who would like to see her get ahead. 

This business venture will provide income that she, her husband, and her son will depend on. She hopes to show her family how the business works and leave a legacy for her descendents. 

Edilma is asking for a loan to buy chairs, tables and a wide variety of ingredients that she will use in preparing food that she can then offer to her future customers. With this loan, you can help to support a woman who is full of life and who has a drive to help her family!

loans.use: buy chairs, tables and a wide variety of ingredients that she will use in preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, la joven vive  con su grupo familiar en casa propia, ella  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman with the blurred face is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She has been selling clothing for 6 years as a street vendor in different neighborhoods. She has many regular customers because of the quality of her clothing and good prices. She is seeking a loan to buy more clothing at wholesale in order to continue with her sales and in this way have increased income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Habibe

texts.en:
Habibe is married and has two children. She decided to work after marriage. First, she had made some money with sewing clothes, and later she had begun sewing shawls and bags from felt. Both of her children study in college. She purchased necessary materials to produce handicrafts with the credit she received from Maya. She wants to make sure that her children have a good future ahead.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Habibe Hanım iki çocuk annesi evli . Evlilik sonrası ihtiyaçtan sonra çalışmak istemiş. Dikiş dikerek para kazanmış daha sonra keçeden şal ve canta yaparak aile bütcesine katkı sağlamış. Çocuklarını üniversitede okutuyor. Maya’dan kullandığı kredi ile malzeme aldı ve üreterek satıp para kazanmak istiyor. Cocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamayı istiyor.

loans.use: to buy felt.

loans.name: Desma's Group

texts.en:
Desma, pictured above, has been a farmer for 15 years, and she is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 40 years old, is married and has five children.

Desma likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Desma plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Desma’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan is a 39-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Joan has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Joan described her harvest as excellent last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Joan’s Group will be able to plant a total of 11 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a hardworking woman who goes out every day to sell charcoal, cooking oil and gari (cassava flour) to customers who live near her home. Naomi lives in Teshie, Accra, Ghana. She is 42 years old, married, and has children. She is asking for this loan to buy more charcoal, cooking oil and gari (cassava flour) to sell so she can increase her orders. Naomi hopes to keep receiving support from Kiva to be able to achieve one of her dreams, which is to make her home better for merchandise sales. She longs to achieve financial stability, which will assure a prosperous future for her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, cooking oil and gari (cassava flour) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking mother with the responsibility of taking care of seven children, of which two attend school. She raises chickens to sell, and she earns additional income by renting out houses she owns. Grace wants to expand her chicken business, so she intends to use the loan to buy more chicks for rearing. She will use the additional income from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Juan Sebastian

texts.es:
Juan es joven hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el corte y confección.
Él es independiente, constante, inteligente, emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, una zona caracterizada por el comercio de buen gusto, de clima templado, con una temperatura aproximada de 21 grados centígrados durante el verano.
Juan es de tez morena, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el español y habla un poco de aymara por herencia familiar, su vida la realiza junto a su apoderada a quién ve como a su madre porque vive con ella desde que era niño, viven en una casa de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la confección de ropa innovadora para el segmento juvenil, como; chaquetas, camisas, pantalones, etc., labor que viene realizando desde que era niño, pues su apoderada le enseño la técnica y ahora es su forma de vida. También estudia la carrera de informática en la universidad y se encuentra cursando el quinto semestre. Su sueño es abrir una tienda grande donde pueda exponer sus creaciones y terminar su carrera profesional para desempeñarse profesionalmente en su área sin descuidar la actividad que lo apasiona que es la costura y el diseño de prendas. Esta es la quinta secuencia de préstamos con la institución en diez años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juan solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor para confeccionar sus diseños de fin de año.
texts.en:
Juan is a single 26 year old man. He doesn't have any children. He has a business as a tailor. He is independent, reliable, intelligent, enterprising, responsible, and hard-working. His business is located in the southern area of the city, a zone known for its businesses of good taste. The area has a temperate climate with an average temperature of 21 degrees centigrade during the summer.

Juan has a dark complexion, is short, and his first language is Spanish and he speaks a bit of Aymara through his family. He lives his life under guidance of his foster mother, who he sees as his mother because he has lived with her since he was a small child. They live in a brick home with drinkable water and electricity.

His business is making innovative clothing for youths, such as jackets, shirts, pants, etc. He has been doing this work since he was a child as his foster mother taught him the techniques and not it it part of his life. He also studies information systems in the university and is in his 5th semester. His dream is to open a great store where he can display his creations, and complete his professional studies, launching himself in a professional career while continuing to do what he loves which is sewing and designing clothing.

This is the 5th loan sequence with the institution over 10 years that he has been doing this activity. It is for these reasons Juan seeks a loan to buy fabric at wholesale in order to make his end-of-year designs.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale to make his end-of-year designs.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
María creció en un ambiente de estilistas, donde en cada gaveta de la casa siempre había peines, maquillaje, secadoras y planchas de cabello, pues con tan solo un año vio como el negocio de su madre, iba desarrollándose a grandes pasos. El esfuerzo de su mamá motivó a esta joven de 21 años a no dejar de estudiar para poder cumplir con todos sus sueños. Ahora ella cursa el cuarto año de la carrera de Turismo y hotelería, una línea que le encanta estudiar porque se siente identificada. 
María cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien todavía posee el salón de belleza donde ella también trabaja. Además sus hermanas envían remesas que sirven para pagar las mensualidades de su universidad. En estos momentos se encuentra en la etapa de realizar su tesis, por lo que solicita préstamo para comprar una laptop para poder cumplir con su trabajo final sin ningún inconveniente. Entre sus planes está culminar sus estudios y empezar a trabajar con lo aprendido en la universidad.
texts.en:
María grew up in an environment of beauticians, where every drawer in the house would have combs, make-up, hair dryers and irons. In one year she saw how her mother's business grew in giant steps.

Her mother's efforts motivated this 21 year old youth to not leave her studies and fulfill her dreams. She is studying her 4th year of Hotel Management and Tourism, something she enjoys studying as she can identify with it. María has the support of her mother who still has her beauty salon where she also works. Also her sisters send her money which help to pay the university expenses.

At this moment she is working on her thesis and for this reason she is requesting a loan to purchase a laptop so she can complete this final task without inconveniences. She plans to finish her university and begin to work with the knowledge that she has gained at university.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Sadiye

texts.en:
Sadiye is married and the mother of three daughters. In summer, she has a stand where she sells jewelry and small gifts. At the same time, she prepares decorative magnets for birthdays, henna nights and other special events. 

With her second loan she will buy jewelry and small gifts and increase her variety of products. Sadiye doesn’t like to sit idly; having a job makes her happy because she can support her daughters and keep busy.  

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Sadiye Hanım evli üç kız annesi.  Yazın tezgah açarak takı ve küçük hediyelik eşya satışı yapıyor.  Aynı zamanda  doğum günleri, kına geceleri ve özel günler için hediyelik süs magnetler  hazırlayıp, toplu olarak organizasyonlara veriyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile de malzeme alacak ürün çeşidini arttıracak.  Sadiye Hanım boş durmayı sevmediğini hem oyalandığını hem de çocuklarına katkı sağladığını söyleyerek bir işe yaramanın mutluluğunu yaşıdığını söyledi.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and small gifts

loans.name: Hatice

texts.en:
Hatice worked in the private sector for 20 years. Three years ago she began knitting dolls. She began making different characters like Pepee, Bebee and Şila – from a Turkish cartoon – as well as Tweety and Bugs Bunny. She makes them by looking at pictures using straight knitting techniques. She sells them from a stand and helps support her family. 

With the loan from Maya she will buy yarn to make dolls.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Hatice Hanım,yirmi yıl özel sektörde çalıştı.  Üç yıl önce örgü bebek yapmaya başladı .  Değişik karakterlerde Pepe, şila, bebe,twety,bugsy bany yapmaya başladı.Resimlerine bakarak düz örgü tekniği ile üretmeye çalışıyor.  Stantlarda koyarak satıyor. Aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile örgü bebek ipleri alacak.

loans.use: to buy yarn to make dolls.

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon is 40 years old and has nine children. He has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Simon is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group, comprised of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Simon started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011. He decided to do so, because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year he decided to represent his group, because he wanted to gain leadership skills.

Simon’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. In addition, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming planting season.

loans.name: Joash's Group

texts.en:
Joash, pictured above, is a group leader. He is here representing his group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011. He decided to represent his group, because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Joash will purchase not only maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming planting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of his loan means that he will be able to reduce his household's consumption of paraffin fuel, which will save him money. Joash plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

In total Joash’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming planting season, and two solar lights.

loans.name: Felistus' Group

texts.en:
Felistus is 45 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Felistus is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by seven farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Felistus started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Felistus’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is a 37-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Christine has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Christine described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Christine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Nancy, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 42 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South Distric, Kenya.  She is married and has three children.

Nancy is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Nancy says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Nancy will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of eight acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Praxides' Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Praxides, often described as an extremely trustworthy person. She is 35 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has two children.

Praxides is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Praxides says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Praxides will use the profits from this season to repair her home.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of five acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Femina's Group

texts.en:
Femina, pictured above, has been a farmer for 17 years, and she is now proud to represent her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 54 years old, is married and has seven children.

Femina likes to think of herself as a very friendly person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Femina plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Femina’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 10.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, has been a farmer for 14 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 42 years old, is married, and has six children.

Mary likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Mary plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Mary’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing solar lights, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick, 38, lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of agricultural produce in Kenya. After his wife died, he was left to take care of their three children by himself. He has relied on mixed-farming to support his family, for three years. His primary income sources are milk and bananas.

Fredrick, however, is slowly developing a greater interest in crop farming. He is seeking a loan to purchase inputs he can't afford, to cultivate food crops and fodder for his cattle. He is also planning to construct a cowshed for his cows, in a bid to increase milk production.

Profits from this investment will be rolled back into business, to ensure maintenance and growth. Income from this investment will help his family to meet their basic needs and to pay the children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to expand his horticultural farm and construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven emprendedor y dinámico de 23 años de edad, estudiante de pregrado y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 3 años comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros de la universidad, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues se le presentó la oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas en esta temporada, por lo que invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor (jeans, camisas, camisetas, accesorios) y ajustará el capital de trabajo con unos ahorros para poder comenzar a generar unos mejores recursos, brindando mayor comodidad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Jorge tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar, además de poder comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a young and dynamic 23 year old entrepreneur. He is a college undergraduate and independent businessman. 3 years ago he started selling merchandise to his relatives, friends and colleagues at the university, with the goal of generating income to support his home and pay for his studies.

The loan he seeks is a support to strengthen his business, as he has the opportunity to improve his sales during this season. Therefore he seeks a loan to buy stock at wholes (jeans, shirts, t-shirts, accessories) and he will supplement the loan with some savings in order to begin generating greater resources, providing greater comfort and better service to his customers, which will make his business more profitable.

Jorge has the concrete goal of having his business be successful and productive. He wants his business to be successful and enable a better quality of life and well-being for his family. In addition, he would like to be able to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy stock at wholesale such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, and accessories.

loans.name: Jaquiline's Group

texts.en:
Jaquiline is 42 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Jaquiline has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to send her children to school. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jaquiline also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jaquiline's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 10.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jesus Mi Salvador Group

texts.es: Maria tiene 30 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento un pequeño taller de costura  en su vivienda en donde hace arreglos confecciona polos para niños. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de hilos cierres  y demás accesorios de costura. En el grupo “JESUS MI SALVADOR” cumple la función de secretaria. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Maria  es la que viste chompa roja.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old, and lives together with 2 children who are dependent on her. She started a small sewing workshop in her home, where she does mending, and makes shirts for children. 

The loan will be used to buy threads, closures and other sewing accessories. In the Communal group 'Jesus mi Salvador', she acts as the secretary. The group thanks the Kiva lenders for the received loan. Maria is the one in the photo in the red sweater.

loans.use: to buy thread, closures, and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Henry's Group

texts.en:
Henry is 67 years old and has five children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Henry is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Henry started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009. He decided to do so, because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. This year he decided to represent his group, because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Henry’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. In addition, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 3 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming planting season.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years.  She is now proud to represent her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 42 years old, is married and has five children.

Rose likes to think of herself as a very hard-working individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012.  She decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Rose plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Rose’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate nine acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Ñ Rare (Flat) Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México se ha formado un grupo de cinco mujeres indígenas, muy trabajadoras y siempre preocupadas por el bienestar de sus hijos. En el lugar aún se conserva la lengua materna y en casi todas las conversaciones de los habitantes se escuchan palabras en mazahua, como el nombre del grupo "Ñ Rare", que significa Río Grande.  

Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría y engorda de borregos porque es muy fácil cuidarlos, además de que las grandes extensiones de campo que hay alrededor les permite sacarlos a pastar y ahorrar un poco en alimento. 

Doña Inés fue elegida como representante por ser la más sociable y alegre, de verdad disfruta conversar con las personas que la rodean. Ella está casada con Fidel quien trabaja el campo, ambos son padres de tres jóvenes independientes. Desde hace 20 años, Inés comenzó a criar animales “Mi mamá me regaló mis dos primeras borregas las cuales ya estaban esperando sus crías” y así comenzó la actividad. Todos los días, Inés se levanta muy temprano para alimentar a sus cuatro borregos y aprovechar el clima fresco, después los regresa al corral y por la tarde los vuelve a sacar. Por el momento tiene un número reducido de animales por lo que le gustaría hacer una mayor inversión y comprar borregos pequeños. 

El riesgo que corren los animales, además de las enfermedades, es que pueden robarlos fácilmente al no tener un corral seguro. Inés comenzará a ahorrar para comprar material como block, cemento, grava y arena y construir un espacio adecuado. 

El sueño de esta gran mujer es tener un molino de nixtamal y una tienda de abarrotes, ella sabe que será complicado pero no pierde la esperanza, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de VisionFund. A lo largo de 7 años de ser cliente de la institución ha logrado ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, mantener a sus borregos y sobre todo pagar la educación de sus hijos en su momento. 

*La foto fue tomada cerca de la casa de una de las integrantes y Doña Inés viste un traje mazahua en color azul.
texts.en:
In a community in the State of Mexico a group has formed of five indigenous women, very hardworking and always worried about the wellbeing of their children. In the area, the native language is still used and in almost all conversations by the inhabitants words are heard in Mazahua, like the name of the group "Ñ Rare", which means Rio Grande.

All of the members work raising and fattening sheep because it's very easy to care for them. Additionally, the large expanses of field that are nearby allow them to take them out to pasture and to save a little on feed.

Doña Inés was chosen as the representative because she is the most sociable and happy. Truthfully, she enjoys talking with the people around her. She is married to Fidel, who works the field. They are both parents of three independent young people. For the past 20 years, Inés started to raise animals: "My mom gave me my first two sheep which were already waiting for their lambs," and that's how she started the activity. Every day, Inés gets up very early to feed her four sheep and enjoy the fresh climate. After, she returns them to the corral and in the afternoon she takes them out again. For the moment, she has a reduced number of animals which is why she'd like to make a larger investment and buy small sheep.

The risk that goes with the animals, in addition to illnesses, is that they can be easily robbed because of not having a secure corral. Inés will start to save to buy material like cinderblock, cement, gravel and sand and construct an adequate space.

The dream of this great woman is to have a corn mill and a grocery store. She knows that it will be complicated but she doesn't lose hope. Additionally, she knows that she has the support of VisionFund. Throughout her 7 years of being a client of the institution, she's achieved helping her husband with the expenses of the home, maintaining her sheep and, above all, paying for the education of her children at the time.

The photo was taken near the house of one of the members, and Doña Inés is seen in a blue Mazahua dress.

loans.use: to buy small lambs.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Aleksander

texts.en:
Aleksander is the father of two young children; eight and six years old, and he is 37; he’s photographed with Donika, his wife.

Aleksander needs your financial help to add the roofing to his house, a work in progress.  He has been staying at relatives with his family for some time now, and they are supposed to move out as soon as possible.  Yet they can’t, because the house has nothing but walls. 

Note that he has built the house all by himself. He and his wife are imploring your understanding in this matter.  Lend to them, and they promise that they will pay back the loan.

To earn a living, Aleksander works as a night man in a cement factory.  His wife receives a disability income.  Together they do agriculture/livestock as well.  They own 2,000 meters of land, where they plant fodder for animals, corn, leeks, spinach, beans, and cabbage. They also have a cow with a calf, two pigs, some chickens, and ducks, too.

loans.use: to add roofing to his unfinished house; his family is living with relatives and must move out asap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to introduce the zero-grazing model on his farm

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 21-year-old student. He is single and lives in AlMafraq.

Eyad is studying nursing in his third year in the university. His family of seven members depends on his father’s military retirement salary, which is not enough.  Eyad has applied to this loan to help him pay his semester fees and buy a few books for the next semester.

loans.use: to pay his upcoming semester fees and buy some textbooks

loans.name: Trufosa's Group

texts.en:
Trufosa, pictured above, has been a farmer for twenty years and is now proud to represent her group of fifteen farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 47 years old, is married, and has seven children.

Trufosa likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Trufosa plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Trufosa’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: El grupo “SAN MARTIN” está conformado por socios trabajadores y responsables. Diana tiene 33 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas en el kiosco de un colegio de su localidad. De esa manera puede mantener a sus hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más golosinas y gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosa es la primera del lado derecho y de la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Marcelo en la parte superior derecha que no pudo estar presente en la reunión.
texts.en:
The group 'San Martin' is made up of hard working and responsible members. 

Diana is 33 years old, and is single with two dependent children. She works selling candies and sodas in a kiosk in a school in her neighbourhood. In this way, she can support her children. 

The loan will be used to buy more candies and sodas. The group thanks the Kiva lenders for the received loan. Diana is the first from the right side of the photo, and in the same way you can find Marcelo added to the photo in the upper corner as he couldn't not be present for the meeting.

loans.use: to purchase more candies and sodas.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 30 years old.  He is married, with two children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Samuel operates a bar.  He has been in that business since 2013, and it has enabled him earn a living. 

Samuel has a dream of expanding his business. He is faced, however, with the challenge of market competition. Samuel wants money to buy beers, spirits, and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, spirits, and sodas for his bar.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is an old ,hardworking married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children, two of whom attend school, in Hoima, Uganda.

He has slowly started running a boutique, mainly selling clothes for men and women. He supplements this income with farming.

Solomon hopes to expand his business and educate his children. He will use the loan money to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la limpieza de ropa en seco.
Él es independiente, constante, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Buenos aires’; caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas de clima templado con una temperatura aproximada de 21  grados centígrados en verano. 
Julio es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará que ya no utiliza y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza con sus padres, viven en una casa de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable y luz eléctrica. Su negocio es la limpieza de ropa en seco, él se dedica a quitar las manchas y la suciedad en forros y entretelas, además de aquellas prendas en las que sus instrucciones de lavado indican el símbolo de lavado en seco. La humedad estropea este tipo de prendas, por eso utiliza líquidos libres de agua, estos líquidos para limpieza en seco no penetran en los tejidos como pasa con el agua manteniendo las prendas en buen estado, disolviendo grasas, aceites, ceras o chicle; ‘empecé como ayudante en una limpieza cercana, luego con el tiempo adquirí una máquina con la que trabajo actualmente y veo muchas oportunidades de negocio donde quiero invertir’. Su sueño es tener sucursales en toda la ciudad y desea ampliar su negocio realizando una inversión en la compra de una máquina de limpieza en seco para mejorar su actividad y abastecer el movimiento de fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en ocho años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Julio solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de limpieza en seco para abastecer los clientes de fin de año y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio is a single, 26-year-old man who does not have children. His business is dry cleaning.

He is independent, persevering, active, responsible, and hardworking. He conducts his business in an area called “Buenos Aires,” known for its commerce in all areas. The area has a mild climate and a temperature of approximately 21°C [70°F] in the summer.

Julio has dark skin, short black hair, and is medium-statured. His native language is Aymará – a language that he no longer uses – and he speaks Spanish for business. He shares his life with his parents. They live in a brick house that has potable water and electric lighting. 

His business is dry cleaning. He makes a living by removing stains and dirt from linings and interlinings, in addition to articles of clothing that have the dry cleaning symbol in their cleaning instructions. Moisture damages these types of garments. For this reason, he uses waterless liquids. These liquids, which are used for dry cleaning, do not seep into the fabric the way that water does, which keeps the garments in good condition. The liquids dissolve grease, oil, wax, or gum.

Julio says, “I started as an assistant in a nearby dry cleaner. Later, with time, I obtained a machine that I currently use for my work. I see a lot of business opportunities in which I would like to invest.” His dream is to have locations all over the city. He wants to expand his business by investing in a dry cleaning machine to improve his work and to furnish his services for the end-of-year movement. This is the first sequence of loans that he requests from the institution in the eight years that he has been in this occupation. 

It is for these reasons that Julio is requesting a loan to buy a dry cleaning machine to furnish his services to the end-of-year customers and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a dry cleaning machine to furnish his services to the end-of-year customers and expand his business.

loans.name: Pauson

texts.en:
Pauson is a 46-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming alongside selling produce and also operating a retail shop to earn himself an extra income. He started this business so as to educate his children. He hopes to be a model farmer in his area despite the challenge of unpredictable weather changes. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more farm inputs like seedlings, fertilizers & manure to add in his farm.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs like seedlings, fertilizers & manure to add in his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer to be able to better supply her customers.

loans.name: Mildred's Group

texts.en:
Mildred is the leader of her group in Kakamega North District, and she is representing 11 farmers, including herself. She is married and the proud mother of three children. Mildred joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 11 years.

Like many other farmers, Mildred decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to send her children to school. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who doubled their harvest in their first year with the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Mildred's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 7.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of two solar lights, Even though Mildred decided not to, some farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 21-year-old student. He is a single man who lives in Al Mafraq.

Bashar is studying for his fourth year at the university. Bashar has a seven-member family who are supported by his father's salary, which comes from working in a governmental entity.

Being in a big family like Bashar's makes it difficult for his father to afford to pay for some of his fees this semester. For that reason, Bashar has applied for a loan to help him pay the rest of his fees for the semester and to buy books.

loans.use: to help him pay the rest of his fees for the semester and to buy books

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Maria de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas y ventanas en el lugar que muestra la fotografia, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para poder comprar balcones, laminas, vidrio para ventanas y pago de mano de obra, para que ella y su esposo puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She owns a small store, which is located in her residence. With what she obtains from her sales, she is able to get ahead. 

She wants to improve her home by putting doors and windows in the place shown in the photograph, but she does not have sufficient capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to buy window railings, sheet metal, and glass for the windows, and to pay for labor. This will allow her and her husband to live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy window railings, sheet metal, and glass for windows, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old, married with six children, and living in Kasese, Uganda.

John is working hard to see his children go to school. John has a dream of educating his children to the university level and expanding his business. However, he faces a challenge of inadequate capital. John would like money to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

John used the previous loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elasto

texts.en: Elasto is a married man with five children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He sells sodas, sugar beers, salt and spirits. He obtains additional income from buying and selling peas, soya beans, and maize. He experiences low turn up of customers and price changes. His vision is to be economically stable and be able to support his family. Elasto needs the loan to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell during Christmas peak season.

loans.use: to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell during Christmas peak season.

loans.name: Nesta

texts.en:
Nesta is 29 years old and single; she lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

She owns a bar joint where she sells drinks like sodas, beers, wines, and waragi, which is a local brew.  She obtains other income from the salary she earns as a nursery teacher. 

She began her bar business so as to be able to look after herself. She hopes to expand her bar business, though she mainly faces the challenge of limited space for expansion. She is requesting a loan to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Otumfoo Nyame Farms Group

texts.en:
John is 54 years old and a farmer; he is a member of Otumfoo Nyame Farms.  John is married with five children, two of whom are schooling. His first born is 32 years old and his youngest is 15 years old. 

John comes from Egyirkrom in the Abura Aseibu Kwamankese Distract in the Central Region of Ghana. He has 10 acres of orange farm plantation, alongside plantain and cassava farms. He sells his cassava and plantains during market days to generate other income to support his family. 

His aim is to expand his orange plantation by five more acres in five years to come. His main challenge now is obtaining financial assistance to achieve his objectives of maintaining the farm and increasing his crop yield and income. 

John needs micro-loan assistance to undertake his farm maintenance. He needs money to hire labor to weed the farms and to buy fertiilzer and food fly traps to improve his yield and harvest. 

John is grateful to all his micro-lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To hire labor weed his farms and to buy fertilizer and food fly traps

loans.name: Yamikani Group

texts.en: Judith is 28 years old and married with a child. She owns a hardware shop selling motor vehicle spare parts and is requesting this loan from Kiva lenders to purchase things in large quantities to attract more customers in her locality. She started her business to improve her family living standards and to accumulate funds to build a house for her family. With the previous profits made, she is able to feed her family three meals a day without the husband's involvement. Her plan is to diversify her business with a grocery store when she has enough capital. With the knowledge Judith gained on savings culture trough MLFs training, she is assured that her goal of building a house will be achieved. As a woman Judith is self-reliant and is giving thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy assorted motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Juan Juvencio

texts.es: Juan tiene 32 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, juan solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar electrodos, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 32-year-old Juan lives with his family in their own home. He owns a metalworking workshop where he makes doors, balconies and railings, among other things. He has been running his business for 15 years and has plenty of experience which helps him to improve his work every day.  He has a wide clientele who come back to him on account of the high quality of his work.  Juan is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy electrodes, iron, metal, tools, etc. which will enable him to boost his income.

loans.use: to buy electrodes, iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 42 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Mercedes está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, harina de arroz, chicharrón, quesillo, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con la elaboración de las pupusas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mercedes is a 42-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in their own home. For some years now, she has been running a business selling pupusas (a kind of tortilla) from her home and she has a wide clientele. Mercedes is applying for a loan to buy corn, beans, rice flour, pork crackling, cottage cheese etc. in bulk so she can continue making pupusas, which will enable her to  boost her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice flour, pork crackling, cottage cheese, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Kabirizi Catholic S &c Group

texts.en:
John is 54 years old and a hard-working married man, with four children.  He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He owns a retail shop, alongside farming to earn himself an extra income. He started his business so as to educate his children.  He hopes to be a commercial farmer and to have educated children up to higher levels.  His main challenge, however, is inadequate capital and seasonality changes. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more items like sugar, soap, salt, and others to sell.  He is a member of Kabirizi Catholic Group, where there is member group guarantorship.

The extra people in the photo are also group members, saving together but have not taken the loan.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, soap, salt, and others to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 33-year-old, hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He deals in goat rearing and selling along with farming to earn extra income. He started this business so as to afford to educate his children and to improve his standards of living.

Thomas hopes to become a prominent businessman, but his main challenge is inadequate capital. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more goats to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more goats to add to his farm.

loans.name: Eulisa

texts.es:
Eulisa tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 03 hijos dependientes. Eulisa vive con sus hijos y su cónyugue. Eulisa vive en el sector Palo Blanco, distrito de Pucará, Sector mediano, en dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura a la ganadería, así como al comercio, sector mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, ubicado en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Eulisa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, esta actividad lo realiza en su domicilio cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio, además Eulisa se dedica a la cría de animales de corral como son cuyes, pavos, gallinas, entre otros. Con una experiencia de 10 años, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de mercadería arroz, azúcar, etc. Invirtiendo en su negocio lo hará crecer y por ende captar nuevos clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eulisa is 45 years old.  She lives with a partner and has 3 dependent children.  Eulisa lives in the Palo Blanco neighborhood of Pucara district.   In her district, the people work mainly in agriculture, livestock production and commerce, and they have a desire to succeed.  This community is located in Pucara district, in the Jaen province of the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Eulisa has a business selling groceries.  She does this work from her home, and she has more than 5 years of experience with the business.  She also works raising barnyard animals such as guinea pigs, turkeys, hens, and other small animals, and she has more than 10 years of experience in this activity.  She has good personal and work references.

Eulisa will use this loan to invest in her business. She will buy merchandise including rice, sugar, and other groceries.  By investing in her business, she will make it grow and attract new customers.  In a short period of time, this will allow her to increase her earnings and income, and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Crystal

texts.en:
Crystal completed degrees in Business Management, Information Systems Management, and Applied Science in Hospitality Management. After serving as an Information Systems Manager with the U.S. Air Force, Crystal held management positions in the hospitality industry, but she was always working toward her own business: Beautiful if…, LLC. Crystal says, “I can still go back and read journals where I physically wrote the name: “Beautiful if… .” 

Crystal lives with her husband, her son, and her aging father, who is their care.

Crystal’s company started with her idea to empower women through words. She wrote a book and spoke in her community about self-empowerment. Over the past few months, this work has evolved into a media and production service, creating video and audio production for entrepreneurs and small businesses.

Crystal needs a loan to complete software purchases, as well as audio visual equipment.

loans.use: to purchase software and audio visual equipment.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming and also produce sales, selling items like coffee and maize, to earn him extra income.

He started this business so as to look after his family and to educate his children. He hopes to become a modernized farmer; however, his main challenges are inadequate capital and weather changes. 

He is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs like seedlings, fertilizers and manure to boost his farm outputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seedlings, fertilizers and manure to boost his farm outputs.

loans.name: Msekele Group

texts.en:
Grace is a member of the Msekele Credit Group. She is a 46-year-old widow with 4 children. As a single parent she has managed to pay school fees for her children and she is independent.

She supports her family by selling assorted grocery items such as sugar, soap and bread in a market in Chikwawa District. She is a hard worker and has been operating her business for four years.

Since she started accessing loans, Grace has seen herself making more profits as compared to the past. She is now applying for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy bulk of various grocery items in order to attract more customers and maximize her profit margins.

Her ambition is to diversify her grocery shop when she has enough capital by selling second-hand clothes.

With the knowledge of business management that she gained from MLF's training, Grace believes that she will achieve what she wants in her life.

loans.use: To buy assorted groceries

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha Elena es una mujer de 49 años de edad, muy enérgica y ejemplo vivo de lo que se denomina como esfuerzo.  Con la intención de aportar mayores ingresos en su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus 4 hijos,  actualmente posee  un pequeño negocio de nacatamales,  el cual desea se convierta en un negocio local y con mayores ventas. Por esta razón, ella solicita  un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, piedras, zinc, entre otros que le permita acondicionar  las instalaciones de su  negocio y así proveer un mejor servicio a los clientes.

Además de la satisfacción por los cumplidos de parte de sus clientes después de probar su comida, doña Martha también disfruta de su trabajo como auxiliar de administración en un colegio. Sin embargo, bajo el instinto de independencia y  la necesidad de proveer mejores recursos a su familia, insiste en tener un negocio que pueda ser  un capital para sus hijos y que responda a las demandas en la competencia del mercado. Entre sus planes está  acondicionar  el lugar de trabajo para poder elaborar con más comodidad sus nacatamales y dedicarle tiempo de calidad a sus dos trabajos.
texts.en:
Martha Elena is a very energetic 49-year-old woman who is a living example of what can be surpassed with sacrifice. With the intention of contributing more income to her family, which is made up of her husband and their 4 children, she currently owns a small tamale business. She hopes that it will become a local business with greater sales. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, stones, zinc, and others that will allow her to set up facilities for her business. This will allow her to provide better service to her customers. 

Aside from the satisfaction that she gets from the compliments she receives from her customers after they try her food, Martha also enjoys her job as an assistant of administration at a school. However, due to her independent instinct and her need to provide greater resources to her family, she insists on having a business that can be capital for her children, and which responds to the demands of the market competition. Part of her plan is to set up her workplace to be able to prepare her tamales more comfortably and to dedicate quality time to both of her jobs.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, stones, and zinc, among others.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is the 47-year-old mother of four, with her youngest being eight years old.  Vera (or "summer" in English) is seeking your help.  She hasn't been able to pay her electricity bills for long time; recently, the power company shut off the electricity in her household. 

Livestock, agriculture and fishing have been Vera's activities for some years now; she’s photographed with her fishnets. Currently, Vera has one dairy cow and a female calf and 7,000 meters of agricultural land, where she plants corn, wheat, and beans.  She also has a little fishing boat. She sells raw milk, fresh produce, and fish. 

Vera’s husband owns a tricycle (called a "dum-dum" locally) that he uses to offer small transportation services to locals and also a small tractor.

loans.use: to pay her electricity bills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, refreshments, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 44-year-old, hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.

He deals in livestock rearing, as well as farming to earn him extra income.

He started this business so as to educate his children. He hopes to become a modern farmer, although his main challenge is inadequate capital. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows and farm inputs to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with six children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

She sells sodas, spirits, beers, cooking oil, salt and soap. She obtains additional income from a pork joint business.

Her vision is to look after her children, but she faces low customer turn out and bad debtors. She also hopes to become economically stable with the proceeds from her business.

Margret needs this loan to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell

loans.name: Ngarama Bataka Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Deo is an elderly, hard-working married man who lives in Kamwenge Uganda. He deals in farming, alongside produce and sugarcane selling to earn additional income. 

He started his business to educate his children. He hopes to become a prominent businessman.  His main challenge, however, is changes in the weather, especially prolonged droughts. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more produce like beans, bananas, and cabbages to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce like beans, bananas, and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Todas las mañanas Doña Norma se levanta sonriente para ofrecerles a sus clientes desayunos y almuerzos. Está casada y tiene tres hijos, hace 11 años se dedica al negocio de la comideria. Empezó vendiendo fritangas en un pequeño tramo en el mercado de Granada poco a poco empezó con desayunos y almuerzos y así fue conquistando a su clientela. Su hija menor le ayuda en el negocio y su esposo que es carpintero le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Doña Norma requiere del préstamo para comprar al por mayor Arroz, Aceite, Frijoles entre otros. Gracias a la alta demanda de la comida que realiza sus ventas han mejorado y ha logrado obtener mejores ganancias ya que este negocio es muy rentable. Su meta próxima es con las ganancias comprar materiales de construcción para remodelar su casa y sacar adelante a su pequeña hija que aún está en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Every morning Norma gets up with a smile to offer her customers breakfasts and lunches.  She is married and has 3 children.  She's had her food business for 11 years.  She started out selling fried food from a small stall in the Granada market, and gradually she started with breakfasts and lunches as she was acquiring customers.  Norma's younger daughter helps her with the business.  Her husband is a carpenter who helps with the household expenses.

Norma needs a loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, and other supplies at wholesale.  Thanks to the strong demand for her products, her sales have increased and she has managed to increase her earnings, as the business is quite profitable.  Her next goal will be to buy construction materials with her earnings so that she can remodel her house and provide for her young daughter, who is still in school.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, and other supplies at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Santos Samuel

texts.es:
Santos Samuel tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío de Huamachuco, una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Santos Samuel se dedica al Cultivo de maíz. Desde hace 15 años, en el Caserío de Huamachuco. Santos Samuel necesita del crédito para invertir en su cultivo de maíz, realizando el pago de peones y compra de abonos. Con la realización de las buenas prácticas agrícolas en su cultivo le permitirá obtener buenos rendimientos. Santos Samuel posee conocimientos en el negocio por lo que se esperá será una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Santos Samuel is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the village of Huamachuco in a rural area of the Cañaris district. The people there work mainly in agriculture, in commerce, and raising cattle. This district is located in the province of Ferreñafe, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

Santos has grown corn for 15 years in the Huamachuco village.  Santos Samuel needs the loan to invest in his corn crop by paying the workers and buying fertilizers.

He uses good agricultural practices on his crop, which allow him to get good yields.  Santos Samuel has knowledge in the business, and he therefore expects that it will be a good harvest.

loans.use: to invest in his corn crop.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia ya cuenta con tres créditos brindados por KIVA-MICREDITO los cuales le han sido de mucha ayuda en su trayecto como comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, los créditos obtenidos le han sido de mucha utilidad ya que ha incrementado el tamaño de la mercadería que les ofrece a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar pacas de ropa de segunda mano. Cuenta con el apoyo de su mama que le envía mercadería del extranjero a un precio cómodo y así logra generar mayor ganancia y apoyar a su hija que está en la universidad.
texts.en: Ana Cecilia has had three loans provided by Kiva/MICREDITO, which have been of great help to her in her development as a merchant. She works selling secondhand clothing. The loans she has obtained have been very useful to her, since she has increased the volume of merchandise she offers to her customers. She is requesting this loan to buy bundles of secondhand clothing. She receives support from her mother, who sends merchandise from abroad at a good price. In this way, she is able to generate better earnings and support her daughter who is at the university.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Las Glorias 2 Group

texts.es: Grupo Las Glorias está formado por tres socias laboriosas y emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Gloria de 56 años de edad, viuda, y su negocio es venta de refrescos naturales y gaseosas desde hace siete años. Ella tiene varios ciclos financiados por la institución ADIM y le ha servido para el crecimiento de su negocio en la inversión de productos en mayor cantidad; este crédito lo invertirá en la compra frízer, baldes, frutas como naranjas, dulces, guayaba para frescos, mangos, utensilios de cocina, azúcar, etc. La segunda socia es la señora Facundina de 54 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de sopa y comida en su domicilio; Y la tercera socia es Elieth de 26 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa interior.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Glorias" is made up of three hardworking and enterprising members. One member, Gloria, is 56 years old and is a widow. She has been selling natural drinks and soft drinks for seven years. She's been a client of the ADIM institution through a number of loan cycles, and these loans have helped her to grow her business by investing in products at bulk.  She will use this loan to invest in a freezer, buckets, and fruits such as oranges, melons, guayaba, mango, cooking utensils, sugar, etc. 

A second member of the group is Facundina, 54, who has a business selling soup and food from her house.  The third member is Elieth, 26, who has a business selling undergarments.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her business

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria tiene 59 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 2 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la calidad de los productos, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, age 59, lives with her family in her own house.  For two years she has had a small store at her house.  She has a lot of customers because of the good prices and the quality of the products.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, etc.  This way she will be able to have better income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge e hijos en el C.P.M Laynas. La vida en el lugar es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como es sembrío de maiz, frejol caupí, y crianza de animales vacuno, ovino, caprino y aves de corral.

La actividad que realiza Nestor es la venta de cerveza, chicha de jora y piqueos, esta actividad la realiza junto con su cçonyuge. La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años en el c.p.m. Laynas y zonas cercanas. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en su negocio de venta de cerveza, chicha de jora, pues él comprará maiz como materia prima para su negocio, cerveza, etc. y comprará también mesas, sillas para implementar su local. La inversión le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos para su familia. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el negocio es una de las actividades principales como ingreso económico. Nestor piensa trabajar invirtiendo en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan a un mediano o corto plazo aumentar sus ingresos, para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nestor is 41 years old and has a live-in partner and 3 children. He lives in his own house with his spouse and children, in the population center of Laynas. Life in this place is tranquil, and the inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock raising, including the growing of corn and cowpeas, and the raising of cattle, sheep, goats and poultry. 

Nestor's work is selling beer, chicha de jora [traditional corn beer] and snacks. He carries out this activity together with his spouse. He has done this work for more than 10 years in Laynas and hearby areas. The loan will be used to invest in his business selling beer and chicha de jora, since he will buy beer as well as corn as a raw material for his business. He will also buy tables and chairs to equip his shop. This investment will help him obtain a better income for his family. 

The market offers good opportunities, since this business is one of the main income-producing activities. Nestor plans to keep investing in his business and obtain better earnings, which will allow him to increase his income over the medium or long term, so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in supplies for his business selling beer and chicha de jora.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase and diversify his stock of animals.

loans.name: Auwalu

texts.en:
Auwalu is a maize farmer from Danju Gubuchi village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Auwalu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Auwalu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Auwalu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland.  He hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to avoid the need to sell his maize at harvest time for low prices.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul completed several certification programs for computer repairs and worked for several years as a computer technician. He couldn’t help but notice that clients needed more services and more attention than what the companies were offering. Raul decided to start his own business, handling everything from linking computers to installing hardware. His clients find him through word-of-mouth and “to see my portfolio of clients grow through references” is something Raul is very proud of. 

Because of an identity theft incident, many traditional doors to credit have been shut. Raul works out of his home, and goes to his clients' site to provide the requested services. 

Raul will use this loan to purchase office furniture and supplies, as well as a large printer for marketing needs.

loans.use: to pay for office furniture and a large printer

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Jorge Luis se dedica a brindar servicio de animaciones y shows infantiles; desde hace 05 años, este servicio lo ofrece en su distrito y alrededores, además tambien cuenta con una motocarguera que la alquila para mudanza o para llevar carga, él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; es decir desea realizar arreglos de su vivienda; esto le servirá para mejorar sus servicios a sus clientes que lo visitan en su domicilio para hacer los contratos de los show infantiles. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
25-year-old Jorge Luis lives with his wife and children in Oyotún, a community in Chiclayo province which belongs to the region of Lambayaque, on the north coast of Peru. The people there work in farming, trade and cattle rearing. 
Jorge Luis has been providing entertainment and shows for children for 5 years. He offers this service in his district and the surrounding areas and he also owns a motor-van which he hires out to people who are moving house or want to carry heavy loads. He is applying for the loan to invest in fixed assets - he wants to have some renovation work done on his home.  It will help him to provide better service for the clients who come to see him to book children's shows. In the short term, it will enable him to boost his income and improve his earnings and, in the longer term, he will be able to improve his own and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: repair his home and provide better service for the clients who come to see him to book children's shows.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Dario tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo dependiente. Dario vive con su familia (esposa y su hijo) en el Caserío Fila Alta. Dario realiza las labores de destilación de aguardiente. La casa de Dario se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Dario está dedicado a la destilación de aguardiente, desde hace más de 15 años, en caserío fila alta. Dario necesita del crédito para la cancelación de parcela que ha comprado la cual posee caña destinada a la producción de aguardiente. Esto incrementará su producción de aguardiente, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dario is 43 years old and lives with his wife and dependent child in the Fila Alta settlement. He works distilling “aguardiente” [a traditional alcoholic drink that is made from sugar cane following an artesanal process].  Dario’s house is located in the Callacyuc district, Cajamarca province and region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  His community works basically in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.  Dario has been distilling aguardiente for over 15 years in the Fila Alta settlement.

Dario needs the loan to pay off the land that he has purchased.  The land has sugar cane, which is destined for the production of aguardiente.  This will increase his production of aguardiente.  That will allow him, in the short term, to improve his revenue and increase his profits.  He will, therefore, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay off the land, which has sugar cane, that he has purchased.

loans.name: Bwirukiro Tukwatanize Group B

texts.en:
Nalis is an old, hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a bar alongside farming to earn himself an extra income. He started this business so as to look after his family. He hopes to be a rich man. However, his main challenge is inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to buy more items such as crates of beer and sodas to sell. He is a member of Bwirukiro Tukwatanize Group, where there is group guarantorship.

loans.use: to buy more items such as crates of beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is 29 years old and a father of four children. He is a hardworking man and a cattle trader. He buys cattle and fattens it to mature for the market. He started this business because his banana plantations were being attacked by a banana wilt disease, and changes in the price of agriculture products depending on production. 

He has dreams of educating his children, but is faced with lack of enough capital and transport to serve different market segments. 

He needs a loan to buy more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening to sell

loans.name: Kyaitamba Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
William is a member of Kyaitamba Tweimukye Group, where each member guarantees the other will pay back the loan. 

He is a retailer dealing in the sale of sugar, salt, washing soap, cooking oil, and other general merchandise. He faces challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations, however, he hopes to have all his children educated to higher levels of learning. 

William needs a loan to buy sugar, salt, washing soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, washing soap, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Abuneri

texts.en: Abuneri is a 33-year-old married man with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a pub alongside a business buying and selling cocoa to supplement his income. Using the proceeds, he has been able to pay fees for his children. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital. He hopes to expand his business and educate his children. He wants a loan to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
