Fatma is married. She owns a tailoring shop. She also sells Amway products. With her second loan, she will buy tailoring materials and Amway products to fill her orders. She wants to make her sales target for Amway and win a trip.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Fatma Hanım evli. Kendine ait terzi dükkanı var. Aynı zamanda amway ürünleri satışı yapıyor. Aldığı ikinci kredisi ile de dükanına terzi malzemesi alacak ve amwey den ürün çekip siparişlerini karşılayacak. Amwayde satış limitini tutturup seyhat kazanmayı hedeflemiş.

loans.use: to buy more Amway stock and sewing materials.

loans.name: Bajame

texts.en:
This is Bajame, who is an ethnically vulnerable Egyptian Albanian.  She is photographed inside her family's restroom, so that you can get a clearer picture of the condition that this part of her house is in. The money she is requesting will be used to do some repairs there. 

Bajame (or "Almond" in English) is 23 years old and married.  She has a 6-year-old and an 8-month-old.  The family lives extremely poorly in a one-room rental house, where they pay almost $20 a month.  She works in a shoe factory, while her husband (who is mentally challenged) offers shoe polishing services in the streets of ther little town in the northern Albania.

loans.use: to make some repairs to the family toilet room

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Ibrahim expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, to become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To store his maize, thereby eliminating pressure to sell it at havest time for low prices.

loans.name: Ummar Suleiman

texts.en:
Ummar Suleiman is a maize farmer from Doya village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ummar Suleiman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ummar Suleiman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ummar Suleiman, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing at harvest, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices.

loans.name: Brigido

texts.pt:
O senhor Brigido de 28 anos é membro da policia, casado pai de 2 filhos 1 no ensino primario outro ainda menor de idade vive na casa propria.
Com o  valor do empréstimo irá comprar bebida, omo, chocolate ovos, sabonetes, leite, caldos, acucar para reforcar o seu negocio.
Tem como projectos e sonhos crescer no seu negocio responder todas as necessidades de seus clientes e terminar a construcao de sua casa.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao  os financeiros, e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Brigido is 28 and works as a policeman. He is married with two children; one is in elementary school and one is not yet of school age. He lives in his own home with his family.

With this loan Brigido would like to strengthen his sales business by buying drinks, laundry detergent, soap, chocolate, eggs, milk, sugar and soup. His dream is to expand his business to respond to customer demand and to finish construction of his home. He says that his main challenges have been financial ones and that he will take out further loans in the future in order to make his plans a reality.

loans.use: buy drinks, laundry detergent, soap, chocolate, eggs, milk, sugar and soup to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, tiene un taller de reparación de motosicletas desde hace 1 año, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar repuestos y un compresor nuevo, y asi poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated because of being 26 and living in a high risk area has had a motorcycle repair shop for the past year. He has many customers because of the quality with which he carries out his work. The young man lives in his own house with his family. He is applying for a loan to be able to buy parts and a new compressor, and therefore be able to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy parts and a new compressor.

loans.name: José Rigoberto

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, está acompañado, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos en su familia, desde muy pequeño aprendió las labores agrícolas. José y sus hermanos trabajaban juntos para cultivar el maíz, frijol y maicillo que se consumen en el hogar.  José está acompañado, por eso decidió buscar un empleo que le generara  ingresos para su nueva familia, trabaja como seguridad y en sus días libres ayuda con algunos quehaceres en el hogar.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para pagar la mano de obra de las personas que le ayudaran en la tapisca del maíz a sus hermanos, puesto que él por su trabajo no tiene tiempo para apoyarlos en la actividad y por lo tanto les ayudara contratando mozos.

José quiere tener un negocio propio y que lo administre su esposa para comenzar a tener ahorros para cuando deseen tener hijos ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old and married. He did not have the opportunity to continue his studies due to his family’s lack of financial resources. He learned agricultural work when he was very young. José and his brothers work together to farm corn, beans and sorghum that they consume at home. José is married and that is why he decided to find a job that would generate income for his new family. He works as a security man and on his free days he helps with some tasks at home.

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to pay for the labor costs of the people who will help his brothers with the corn harvest, since because of his job he does not have time to support them in that work and therefore will help them by contracting workers.

José wants to have his own business managed by his wife in order to start having savings so that when they wish to have children they can offer a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the labor costs of people who will help his brothers with the corn harvest.

loans.name: Milagro Edith

texts.es: Milagro de 53 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 20 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, Milagro solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Milagro, 53, is a very hardworking and responsible person who dedicates herself to her business. She lives in her own house with her family. She has had a fruit and vegetable sale for the past 20 years, located in the municipal market which is near her place of residence. Milagro is applying for a loan to be able to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk, to have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona is 31 years old and a divorced mother of one. She owns a hair salon as seen in the photograph and at the same time, she is studying for a master’s degree in philosophy. Since she got divorced, she went back to her parents’ to live; she had nowhere else to go according to her.

Here is what Elona said during her interview with the branch assistant: “I suffered throughout the marriage, yet I never thought for one second to divorce because here in town, it is still considered a bad thing for a woman; for a man, it’s not a problem at all. I tried to hide from my parents as much as I could all the problems, but I couldn't any longer; my son grew up, and he should not be raised in a dysfunctional family. I have been feeling a huge sense of relief since I divorced, and so has my son, thank God.”

loans.use: to pay for her university fees; she is taking philosophy for her master's degree.

loans.name: Peninah's Group

texts.en:
Peninah is 53 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very reliable person. Even though Peninah is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Peninah started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Peninah’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Byron

texts.en:
Byron is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in wrought iron sculptures and home decor. He would like to purchase a motorcycle, in order to have an efficient means by which to transport the raw materials he needs and deliver the finished products he has crafted.

Byron has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I work in wrought iron. All my designs are completely original and crafted by hand. The wrought iron is created with fire and a forge. I never liked school much. All my life, what I've been passionate about is my work, my art. I have two daughters who are the light of my life. Someday when they're grown up and have their own families, I'd like to teach my art to my grandsons.

"I really need this microcredit in order to improve my business. Right now we have to transport raw materials and deliver products either by foot or in a pickup truck, both of which are very inefficient. I thank you for this opportunity and I am hopeful that this will benefit my business in the long run."

Use the link below, to view Byron's wrought iron sculptures and home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7287

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle, in order to have an efficient means by which to transport the raw materials he needs and deliver the finished products he has crafted.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is an artisan from Peru who specializes in maté gourd ornaments and décor. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including dried gourds.

Emilio has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"I was born in Huancayo, Peru. This art is in my blood. It's something that is borne from generation to generation, carried by a magical world toward natural materials. Through my own initiative and desire to learn, my eyes saw and my hands created. This is how I began in this wonderful world, trying to create and create.

"I am very happy and thankful for this opportunity. The microcredit will allow me to buy the materials I need to craft more pieces and meet sales demand."

Use the link below, to view Emilio's maté gourd ornaments and décor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6001

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including dried gourds

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en:
Lawan is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Lawan joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Elasha and Alsa.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Lawan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Lawan spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing at harvest, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: creams, lotions, deodorants, makeup, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Sabougnouma 1  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème prêt.
La spéculation cultivée est l’échalote et Tomate  avec Yaya qui est  assis au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels pour exploiter sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Sabougnouma 1 group are married men with an average age of 43 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional families in Fonfona, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third administrative district of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their market gardening activities. This is their second loan.

Yaya, who is sitting in the middle in the picture, grows shallots and tomatoes. He plans to use his loan to buy the seeds, agricultural inputs and equipment he needs to cultivate half a hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a varied clientele. He expects to make an average profit of 100 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser and equipment.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Margarito vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyugue y sus dos hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad, Margarito es natural de la zona, tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales y laborales en su comunidad. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Margarito es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, ubicado en el caserío de Cabra Sondor, con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agricolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en: Margarito lives with his wife and his two children (aged 18 and 16) in their own home which is made of rustic materials. Margarito was born and brought up in the area and has a good personal and professional reputation. The people of the area where he lives (the Pucará district of Jaén province in the Cajamarca region on Peru's north coast) work predominantly in agriculture, cattle rearing and trade. Margarito works in agriculture (particularly pineapple growing) in the Cabra Sondor estate and he now has about 15 years' experience. He will use the loan to pay for agricultural work, applications and new parts for plant sanitation products, fertiliser and to pay those who bring in the harvest. This will help him to improve his crops physiologically, morphologically and productively and, thereby, have a good harvest. In the long term, he will be able to boost his production and offer better quality products, so he will have no problem in selling them.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural work, applications and new parts for plant sanitation products, fertiliser and to pay those who bring in the harvest.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, soap, sugar, canned goods, and other items to sell 

Elena has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, sugar, canned goods, and other items to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and married and she works very hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 6 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Enrequeta

texts.en:
Enrequeta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines.

She requested a 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase pandan or buri leaves and dye materials to make woven mats to sell.

Enrequeta has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pandan or buri leaves and dye materials to make woven matts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a clean cook stove.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton es un joven de 22 años, nació en la provincia Andres Ibáñez del departamento de Santa Cruz – Bolivia, actualmente vive con sus hermanos, ya que sus padres fallecieron tiempo atrás. 

Milton actualmente estudia durante el día el programa de preparación para Inspector de Soldadura y por las noches trabaja como ayudante de Barman en una empresa gastronómica de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, pues al morir sus padres él se hizo cargo de sus hermanos, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para poder culminar sus estudios. Milton considera que al terminar este curso, esto le permitirá alcanzar  uno de sus sueños, el cual es trabajar en una empresa petrolera, de esta manera podrá generar mayores ingresos y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hermanos.  

Milton considera que lo que le hace diferente a otros estudiantes son sus ganas de superación y el empeño que pone siempre para lograr sus objetivos. Se siente muy agradecido y motivado con el Programa, así como también con aquellas personas que confiaron en él y le están dando una oportunidad de alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Milton is a young man of 22. He was born in the province Andres Ibáñes in Santa Cruz department, Bolivia. Currently he lives with his brothers, since his parents passed away a long time ago.

Currently, Milton studies a preparation program for Soldering Inspector during the day and at night works as a Barman's helper in a food business in the city of Santa Cruz. He uses the income he earns to cover the costs of his home; he took charge of his siblings when his parents died. Because of this, he is applying for an education loan to be able to finish his studies. Milton thinks that upon finishing this course, this will allow him to achieve one of his dreams which is to work in a petroleum business. In this manner, he will be able to generate better income and give a better quality of life to his siblings.

Milton thinks that what makes him different from the other students are his urge to get ahead and the effort he always puts forth to achieve his goals. He feels very thankful for and motivated by the program, as well as those people who trusted in him and are giving him an opportunity to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for a preparation course for Soldering Inspector.

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
O senhor Mateus de 46 anos é militar, casado pai 3 filhos dos quais 1 ainda menor 2 a estudar na 9ª e 12ª classe nao sustenta mais ninguem alem dos filhos e vive na casa do servico.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, areia, chapas de zinco, barrotes, varroes para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar a construcao de sua casa, concluir a faculdade esta a formar se engenharia electronica, investir na formacao de seus  filhos
Diz que o maior desafio e insuficiencia de de fundos  e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Mateus is 46 years old and works for the military. He is married with 3 children, two of whom are in high school, in 9th and 12th grade, and one who is not yet of school age. He lives with his family in military housing and is not financially responsible for anyone besides his family. 

With this loan Mateus would like to continue with a home construction project by buying cement, sand, zinc plates, metal bars and posts. His projects and dreams for the future are to finish the construction project, finish his degree in electrical engineering, and invest in his children's education.

He says that his main challenge has been a lack of funds for his projects, and that he will take out more loans in the future to make his plans a reality.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, zinc plates, metal bars and posts.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Sabougnouma 2  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème prêt.
La spéculation cultivée est la Tomate  avec Benjamin qui est  assis au bout vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels pour exploiter sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Sabougnouma 2 group are married men with an average age of 36 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Fonfona, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their market gardening activities. This is their second loan.

Benjamin, who is sitting on the far right in the picture, grows tomatoes. He plans to use his loan to buy the seeds, agricultural inputs and equipment he needs to cultivate half a hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a varied clientele. He expects to make an average profit of 105 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and meet his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser and equipment.

loans.name: Santos Enrique

texts.es: Santos de 25 años de edad es un joven emprendedor, desde muy temprano sale a cuidar de sus cultivos, ya que es la manera que encontró de ganarse la vida desde hace 6 años, pero también se desempeña como jornalero por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecho de poder tener dos fuentes de ingresos, lo que ha logrado gracias a sus esfuerzos y tenacidad. Él habita en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo, pero aunque vive solo apoya económicamente a sus 2 hijas de 4 y 2 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de poder sostener a sus hijas y trata siempre de darle lo mejor. Santos sabe que su mayor fuente de ingresos es la agricultura, es por ello que ha tomando la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: abono, semillas y fertilizantes para continuar con sus cosechas de jícama, frijol y maíz.
texts.en: 25-year-old Santos is an enterprising young man who gets up very early to go and tend his crops, as this is the way he has earned his living for the past 6 years. He also works as a day labourer and so he is happy and satisfied to have 2 sources of income which he has achieved thanks to his hard work and tenacity. He has lived in his own home for a long time, but although he lives alone, he supports his two daughters (of 4 and 2 years of age). He is glad that he can support his daughters and always tries to do his best for them. Santos knows that agriculture is his major source of income and that is why he has taken the decision to apply to FUSAI for a loan to buy: manure, seeds and fertiliser so he can continue growing jicama yams, beans and corn.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Sabougnouma 3  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème prêt.
La spéculation cultivée est l’échalote avec Ladji qui est  assis au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels pour exploiter sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Sabougnouma 3 group are married men with an average age of 49 and, on average, 6 children. They all live in traditional families in Fonfona, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third administrative district of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their market gardening activities. This is their second loan.

Ladji, who is sitting in the middle in the photo, grows shallots. He plans to use his loan to buy the seeds, agricultural inputs and equipment he needs to cultivate half a hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a varied clientele. He expects to make an average profit of 95 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable him to repay his loan and cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser and equipment.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Adelaida is a fish vendor living in Dulag, Leyte. She sells fish in the community using her motorcycle as mode of transporting her stock from one place to another. Behind Adelaida is the foam filled with fresh fish ready for delivery.   

She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 7. To increase her income, Adelaida raises and sells hogs. Adelaida is planning to open up a sari-sari (variety) store, but has no capital for the start-up of said business. 

Adelaida has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy a variety of fresh fish and assorted stock for the store. She is hoping that with the additional capital, she will be able to expand her businesses to improve her livelihood as well as continue sending her children to school for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fresh fish and assorted stock for her store.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a merchant residing in Dulag Leyte. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic goods like noodles, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, and other beverages. She has been operating a variety store for eight years. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are 6 and 7 years old. Her husband is a fish vendor.

Due to the scarcity of capital to continue her small livelihood, Julie has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy assorted good like chips, seasoning, toiletries, and soft drinks.

In the future, Julie dreams of expanding her business to prosper and provide her growing children with their basic needs, including quality education.

loans.use: to buy assorted good like chips, seasoning, toiletries, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Cepriana

texts.en:
Cepriana is a widowed entrepreneur who sells vegetables and other groceries in her village to make a living. She repaid her previous loan used for this business. 

Cepriana recently ventured into selling cosmetic products and is earning good returns thus far. She has requested a new loan from GDMPC to purchase more cosmetic products to sell. 

In the future, Cepriana wants to build a house and see her child successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, farming fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

Gloria requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Gloria has been farming fruits and vegetables for 6 years now and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 33 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. Jean works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jean has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Jean would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in the Philippines where she sells construction materials.

Jocelyn has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional construction materials to sell. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials to sell from her business.

loans.name: Esnang

texts.en:
Esnang is 44 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, juices, bread, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Esnang has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from retail of gasoline.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, juices, bread, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza works hard to support her family. Esperanza is married and has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase milk, sugar, ice cubes, etc. for her business.

Esperanza has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Esperanza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, ice cubes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Estuvo casada, pero por motivos personales decidieron separarse pero él le dejo una casa para que viviera con los hijos de ambos. 

María es comerciante pequeño, vende golosinas y alimentos a los estudiantes y empleados de un colegio que está situado en su comunidad, comenta que le va muy bien puesto que en época de vacaciones el colegio abre sus puertas para dar clases de arte y otros cursos de verano.

El préstamo será utilizado para abastecer su negocio, comprar golosinas, bebidas, y alimentos harina, carne de pollo y res para los alimentos entre otros. María espera continuar con su negocio y le siga brindando frutos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
María, 51, is single and has three children. She was married but for personal reasons they decided to separate but he left her a house to live in with the children. 

María is a small business owner. She sells candy and food to the students and employees of a school which is located in her community. She comments that it is going very well for her given that during vacation season the school stays open to give art classes and other summer courses. 

The loan will be used to supply her business, buy candy, drinks and food stuffs, chicken and beef meat etc. 

María hopes to continue with her business and that it continue to bring fruit so she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy candy, drinks and food stuffs, chicken and beef meat etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
O senhor Joao de 30 anos é professor, casado pai 1 filho a estudar sustenta sua mae enviando e vive na casa propria.
O valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, areia, chapas de zinco, barrotes, varroes para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar a construcao de sua casa, investir na formacao de seu filho e fazer mais  filhos.
Diz que gosta dos servicos prestados pois assim consegue realizar  seus projectos  e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Joao is 30 years old. He works as a teacher and is married with one child who is in school. He lives with his family in their own house and also helps to support his mother by sending her money.

With this loan he would like to continue with a home construction project by buying cement, sand, zinc plates, metal bars and posts. His main goals are to finish the construction project, invest in his son's education, and have more children.

He says he is happy to have the opportunity to take out a loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner] because it allows him to undertake these projects, and he will take out more loans in the future to make his plans a reality.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, zinc plates, metal bars and posts.
